loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana de 43 años de edad, es una mujer casada con Elmer. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de 21, 14 y 10 años, ya que los mayores son independientes. Ana vive con su familia en una casa propia en el distrito de San Luis de Shuaro. La agricultura es la actividad económica de Ana y su familia. Desde pequeña, sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra.  En la actualidad, cuenta con 6 cuadras de terrenos agrícolas de 15 por 20 metros aproximadamente cada uno. En 3 de esas parcelas produce: café, plátanos y ahora una nueva siembra de piñas. En las labores del campo recibe el apoyo de su esposo e hijos, ahorrándose en la contrata de personal ajeno. Así también se dedica a la compra y venta de café. “Años atrás solo compraba café de mis vecinos y los vendía, eso por que no tenía capital para invertir en abonos para mis sembríos”, explica contenta, ya que en el presente realiza ambos negocios. Ana ve su futuro prometedor, por esa razón seguirá con sus sembríos y los ampliará en los 3 terrenos que le faltan trabajar, a la vez arrendará más parcelas para maximizar su producción;  “tengo pedidos por todos lados, por eso no dudo en invertir”, finaliza. Éste sería su crédito número 5 con MFP, entidad a la que muestra agradecimiento por la oportunidad de crecimiento. “Los Cafetaleros”, es el nombre de su banco comunal. Se siente contenta con el grupo por que sus integrantes comparten los mismos intereses. Invertirá alrededor de 1200 soles en la compra de abonos para fertilizar 2 parcelas de café. Además pagará el servicio de personal para la limpieza de los terrenos.
texts.en:
Ana is a 43-year-old woman who is married to Elmer. They have six children, but only three of them (ages 21, 14, and 10) still live with them. The older children are already independent. Ana and her family live in their own home in the District of San Luis de Shuaro. Farming is their business activity. When she was a young girl, Ana’s parents taught her how to work the land. She currently has six plots of farmland that measure approximately 15 x 20 meters each. On three of the plots she produces coffee, bananas, and just recently pineapple. Her husband and children help with the farm work, which saves her the cost of hiring outside staff. Ana also buys and sells coffee. “Years ago I only bought coffee to sell from my neighbors because I did not have the capital to invest in fertilizers for my crops,” Ana happily explains as to the reason why she has both businesses. She sees a promising future ahead. For this reason, she wants to continue with planting on the three other plots of land that are fallow. She also wants to rent more land in order to maximize production. “I have orders from everywhere, so I do not hesitate to invest”, Ana exclaims.

This will be her fifth loan with MFP. Ana expresses her appreciation to the organization for giving her the opportunity to grow. The name of her Communal Bank is “Los Cafetaleros” (The Coffee Growers). She is pleased with her group because all of the members share the same interests. Ana will invest approximately 1200 PEN in the purchase of compost so that she can fertilize two plots of coffee. The rest of her loan will be used to hire workers to clear the land.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers and to hire workers.

loans.name: Jelmarie

texts.en:
Jelmarie is 52 years old and married with 4 children.

Jelmarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Jelmarie has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Jelmarie aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a resident farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is 54 years old and married with 8 children, seven of whom are still attending school. He has been in farming for 10 years and currently produces milk, maize and eggs for the local market.

David has made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo for 31,200 KES, this being his second loan request. He says he will use the loan to buy and insure a dairy cow. He hopes his milk production will improve and the family will have more milk for consumption as well as generate more income.

However, he laments the high cost of feed and animal diseases.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formo gracias al esfuerzo de una de las miembros, quien con las ganas de ayudar a sus amigas y vecinas se informo y les motivo a formar el comité. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy emprendedoras, quien con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio luchan por sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Blanca, quien se dedica a las ventas. Nos comenta que vende todo tipo de artículos, como ser frazadas, sábanas y demás artículos, en lo cual le va muy bien, porque ya tiene una clientela bien definida que siempre compran de ella. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener un local propio donde ofrecer sus productos. Ella se define como una mujer luchadora, trabajadora y muy emprendedora.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, frazadas y demás artículos para la posterior venta. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le están dando.
texts.en: This group was formed thanks to the effort of one of its members, who with the desire to help her friends and neighbors, became informed [about the loan process] and this motivated her to form the commitee.  They are hard-working, determined, and very enterprising women, who with a lot of effort and sacrifice fight for their families.  One of the members is Blanca, who works in sales.  She informs us that she sells all types of products, such as blankets, sheets, and other articles, and that it is going very well for her because she already has well-defined customers who always buy from her.  One of her dreams to to be able to have her own place where she could offer her products.  She describes herself as a determined, hard-working, and very enterprising woman.  She requests the loan in order to purchase blankets, sheets, and other articles to later sell.  She thanks the foundation and Kiva for the opportunity that they are giving her.

loans.use: to purchase blankets and sheets to then sell.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla (pictured here) is 35 years old and her husband Khan is 42 years old. They live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1994 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Three children are in school and the other two are still too young for school. 

Phalla is a garment worker, while her husband is a construction worker.  She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle for her children to drive to school.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en:
Jesselyn is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Jesselyn has a repair shop for electronic products where her husband is the repairman. He repairs televisions, karaoke machines, and music components. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools needed for repairing electronic appliances.

Jesselyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools needed to repair electronic appliances.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a driver who contributes to the provision of basic family needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Amina has operated a shoe-selling business for the past 10 years. Her potential clients are the local area ladies. She faces a major challenge of theft. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase more pairs of shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust because of their fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 47 years old and comes from Gattaran, Cagayan. She is married and has been blessed with five children. Her husband works as a mailman, while she manages their piggery. Even though both of them are earning, their income is sometimes insufficient to provide for the needs of all their children. That’s why Marilyn wants to avail an education loan of PHP 8,000, which will help her to send her daughter, Lanie, to college. Lanie hopes to finish college and to be able to help her parents and siblings.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's college tuition.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza 2 Group

texts.en:
Patulul in the Department of Suchitepéquez is located on the Southern Coast of Guatemala. It is a tropical area where the climate is hot and coffee, fruit (bananas, mangoes, pineapple, papaya), and sugarcane is grown. Here, seven women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Nueva Esperanza 2” or “New Hope 2”. The ladies are determined to improve themselves and their businesses and bring a higher quality of life to their families. Out of the 7 women, only 2 were able to attend school until the 3rd grade. The rest are illiterate.

The President of the group is 27 year old Reina. She married at an early age and has three children who range in age from 3-9. They each are enrolled in primary school. Reina has a tamale business and lovingly makes and sells them. Her business is quite popular and she has seen the need to secure a loan. She would like to buy rice, chile, sesame seeds, pumpkin seeds, salt, corn and firewood. This is a great time for the business as it is the end of the year and there are graduations and parties!

Besides providing loans to the women, Friendship Bridge offers educational trainings during the monthly meetings. A Facilitator from the organization conducts these trainings in the indigenous language of the women and uses games, diagrams, pictures and role playing. 

KIVA investors from all parts of the world are valuable partners in this effort and the ladies are very appreciative. It would be impossible for them to walk into a bank and secure a loan. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: To buy rice, chile, sesame seeds, pumpkin seeds, salt, corn and firewood for her food business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To finish up the building

loans.name: Tunzala

texts.en:
This 33-year-old young woman is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, settled in Absheron region, Masazir village. She is married and has 2 children.
She has had her own grocery store for 2 years.
Having borrowed  $400 she built the store in the yard of her house.
For the second loan she borrowed $800 and bought foodstuffs.
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to increase variety of goods and to buy a refrigerator.
This business has allowed her family to have a better income.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria sells clothing and bedspreads. She has no fixed place of business, but sells door to door and in markets and offices, collecting her money each day, what's known here in Bolivia as a runner. She is a 43-year-old widow with two children in school so she is the only earner in her household. She makes sales on request, so if for example a customer asks for a dress, she finds it and sells it on the same day repaying the wholesale purchase and making a profit. She has been doing business this way for ten years and has been a client of IMPRO since 2005 with a first class track record of paying back loans. This credit will be used to buy clothing, bedding and other goods. She can get them at a better price buying in volume and it will also let her show customers the goods in advance. Her record with IMPRO recommends extending her credit as she has experience in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Alexis Hult

Victoria, vende frazadas, abarrotes edredones, ropa, repartiendo en los mercados, oficinas, efectuando la cobranza diariamente, no tiene un puesto fijo ya que es repartidora, actividad que en Bolivia comúnmente se denomina como “corredoras”. Tiene 43 años y dos hijos es la única que genera ingresos en su familia ya que es viuda y sus hijos son estudiantes. Sus ventas son al pedido ya que si alguna persona le pide algún artículo como por ejemplo frazada la señora compra y le entrega para que le cobre diariamente hasta cubrir el monto total más su ganancia. Tiene una experiencia en este tipo de comercio de más de 10 años. Es cliente de Impro desde el 2005, su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento muy bueno de pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de ropa, frazadas, edredones y abarrotes ya que le resulta mas barato comprar en cantidad, además que puede exponer y mostrar a sus clientes sus productos. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva sells one of Ecuador’s most popular seafoods, crab, or cangrejo in Spanish. She and her husband have been in this line of work for about 15 years. She learned from her grandfather who was an expert in catching these animals in the muddy waters along the Ecuadorian coast. In the picture, you can see Eva and her husband in their canoe along the waters surrounding La Isla Trinitaria, a very poor sector on the outskirsts of Guayaquil.

Eva is now asking for her second loan with our organization through Kiva. She used the first to buy a new motor for the canoes she uses to catch the crab. The motor is now in need of maintenance and she needs the new loan in order to fix it. She also will continue investing in diverse types of seafood to sell from her stands. Since receiving her first loan she has employed two new people to help her with her sales.

Eva and her husband have 4 children, 3 of whom are still in school. The oldest son is already in college and works on his own in order to pay for the costs. She lives with her sister in a house she inherited from her mother.

loans.use: Fix the motor for her canoe and invest in diverse types of seafood

loans.name: María

texts.en:
Maria is married and has 4 children. She is a member of the Divino Amparo association of Pro Mujer. Her main line of business is selling cosmetics and costume jewelry in the main markets of the city of El Alto. She started out as an artisan, weaving woolen items, but this activity was not very profitable. She currently has six stalls which she opens only on market days.

She needs this loan to buy a selection of perfumes to add to her merchandise mix, as this is a very profitable line of business which will allow her to quickly increase her income and will result in better living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

María M. de Arazaca Casada y madre de 4 hijos, pertenece a la asociación Divino Amparo de Pro Mujer. Se dedica principalmente a la venta de cosméticos y bisutería en las principales ferias de la ciudad del Alto. Comenzó en Pro Mujer como artesana, tejiendo prendas en lana, pero esta era una actividad muy sacrificada que además no era redituable. En la actualidad María es dueña de 6 puestos de venta los cuales abre solo en días de feria. Ella precisa de capital para poder incursionar en el negocio de compra y venta de perfumes, actividad mucho mas redituable y que permitirá mejorar sus ingresos de forma mas rápida y ayudarla a mejorar sus condiciones de vida

loans.use: To purchase perfumes for resale

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha L. is a 44-year-old mother of four and a resident of the Pugu area in Dar es Salaam. She sells charcoal, a business she has been running for 2 years. She obtains her charcoal north of the city, and sells it as both a retailer and a wholeseller. She has recently gained a large store as a customer and needs more capital to expand her stock. Martha would like a loan of $450 to achieve this.

loans.use: To expand her supply of charcoal to meet the growing demands of her customers

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Señora Carolina belongs to Banco Comunal Las Samaritanas, and her business is located within her home. She lives in the Shatoja district of El Dorado, San Martín. She sells beauty products by catalog (Ebel, Avon) as well as groceries. She has been selling groceries for about 12 years and beauty products for 5 years. With the recent loan from Manuela Ramos worth S/. 800.00 soles ($ 270.00), to be paid off in 6 payments, she will buy products that are high in demand in her area such as: different types and brands of pasta (2 packages), canned fish (2 boxes), bagged rice and sugar (1 bag of each), gallon- and liter-sized oil (to be sold retail); in addition to replenishing her stock of beauty products. She is 39 years old, has 2 daughters and a son. Her daughters are older and live on their own outside the city. Señora Carolina is grateful that she had the opportunity to raise them to be professionals, thanks to her and her husband’s efforts as well as her daughters' hard work and dedication. Their achievements show that their parents' sacrifice was worth it. She would like to exclusively increase her sales of beauty products, since with them she contributes to improving the local women's self esteem and personal care.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Carolina pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Samaritanas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa. Vive en el distrito de Shatoja, provincia El Dorado, departamento de San Martín. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo (Ebel, Avon) y también abarrotes, la venta de abarrotes la desarrolla desde hace 12 años aproximadamente y la venta de productos de belleza hace 05 años. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 800.00 soles ($ 270.00), el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará algunos productos que son muy requeridos en la zona como: fideos de distintas variedades y marcas (02 paquetes), conservas de pescado (02 cajas), arroz y azúcar en sacos (01 sacos de cada producto), aceite en galón (para su venta al menudeo) y en litros; además surtirá el stock de productos de belleza. Ella tiene 39 años de edad, 03 hijos, 02 mujeres y 01 varón, dos de ellas son mayores de edad y viven fuera de la ciudad, son independientes. La señora Carolina se siente orgullosa de la oportunidad que tuvo de hacerlas profesionales, gracias al esfuerzo de ella y su esposo y el de sus mismas hijas por poner empeño y dedicación demostrándoles así que valoran el sacrificio de sus padres. Desea crecer en la venta exclusiva de productos de belleza, ya que con ello aporta en su comunidad mejorando la autoestima y cuidado personal de las mujeres de su localidad.

loans.use:
Purchase of various products (groceries). Purchase of beauty products.

Compra de productos variados (abarrotes). Compra de productos de belleza.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga is 37 years old and together with her inseperable family, she has for 15 years been dedicated to the creation of cut wood boxes, which are indispensable to fruit producers who pack their produce in these crates. Thanks to her agile and creative hands, she has managed to generate a great many crates, thus permitting her, through this work, a good income to cover the expenses of her home and the schooling of her three young children. Nevertheless, due to her enterprising spirit they are wanting to try their hands at selling chickens in the city, and in order to achieve that goal they diligently are developing this noble work at the same time that they are requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of all the necessary elements of this project. At the same time this sum will be very useful in that they would be able to produce a greater quantity of crates.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga, tiene 37 años de edad y junto a su inseparable familia está dedicada hace quince años a realizar prácticos cajones de madera, indispensables para los productores de frutas, quienes empacan sus productos en estos recipientes.Gracias a sus ágiles y creativas manos han logrado realizar gran cantidad de cajones; permitiéndoles obtener mediante esta actividad buenos ingresos económicos, para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y los estudios de sus tres menores hijos. Sin embargo debido a su espíritu emprendedor ellos están deseosos de incursionar en el comercio de pollos en su ciudad; y para lograrlo se desenvuelven diligentemente en esta noble labor y al mismo tiempo solicitan un préstamo de dinero para invertirlos en la compra de todo los elementos necesarios para este proyecto; así mismo esta suma será muy útil para que puedan producir una mayor cantidad de cajones.

loans.use: Establishing of a small chicken farm and purchase of primary material to continue her business of making wooden produce crates.  -  Establecimiento de una pequeña granja de pollos y compra de materia prima para seguir elaborando sus ya acostumbrados cajones de frutas.

loans.name: Victor Javier

texts.es:
My wife and I have run a taco and tortas (Mexican sandwich) shop for the past year. Thanks to God things have gone very well for us, but now we would like to invest some money in the purchase of more merchandise since we need certain things our customers have requested. In this way we will have more sales and thereby more income. We would also like to fix-up the space that we use for our shop. This would include painting and making some repairs. I am asking for $300 dollars to invest in the purchase of merchandise and in making repairs for my business.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

“Mi marido y yo tenemos un venta de tacos y tortas en mi casa desde hace 1 año gracias a dios nos ha ido muy bien pero ahora nos gustaría invertir un poco en la compra de más mercancía ya que necesitamos tener algunas cosas que nuestros clientes nos solicitan y así tendremos más ventas y por la tanto más ganancias también nos gustaria arreglar un poco el espacio que tenemos destinado para el negocio como pintar y hacer algunas reparaciones”. Solicito $ 300.00 dlls para invertir en la compra de mercancía para mi negocio y hacerle algunas reparaciones.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of merchandise for my business

loans.name: Amira

texts.en: Amira is from Porječani, a small village near Visoko. She is a 39-year-old housewife and she has  2 children, 15 and 18 years old. Amira does agriculture with her husband, who has a full-time job. His monthly income is 800 KM. Amira want to use this loan of 1000 KM to buy seedlings and seeds. They want to improve  their business in order to secure a safe future  for their children.

loans.use: Buying seedlings and seeds.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma was born in 1984 and lives in Vukovije, a small village near the town of Živinice. Her husband  has a full-time job from which he earns about 700 KM a month. In addition to his salary, they earn income by farming and raising animals. Alma has applied for her first loan from us, for $850, to buy seeds and compost . She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to help secure a good life  for her son.

loans.use: To buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou D. is 54 years old, married and the mother of one daughter. She has been a member of the village bank Niaguiss Nema in Ziguinchor for two and a half years. She would like to purchase oil, rice and sugar to stock her store which is currently seeing good times. The profits she makes will help her to improve her family's standard of living. She is asking for her 6th loan, which will be repaid at the end of six months in one single payment.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Aissatou D., 54 ans, mariée, 01 fille en charge est membre du banc villageois de Niaguiss Néma à Ziguinchor depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter de l’huile, du riz et du sucre pour renforcer sa boutique qui marche bien. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer le bien être familial. Elle sollicite un 6ème prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To purchase rice, oil, sugar and coal to stock her store.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva is a young mother who has always pursued the best for her small, one-year-old daughter. She is a promoter of a prestigious brand of pots and pans. On weekends, she sells them independently happily explaining the merits of her kitchen products to hundreds of mothers in her city. She wishes to increase her amount of stock and for this reason is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Eva, es una joven madre de familia que siempre ha buscado lo mejor para su pequeña niña de una año. Es promotora de una prestigiosa marca de ollas y sartenes y los fines de semana los oferta de manera independiente explicando muy contenta sobre las bondades de sus objetos para la cocina de centenares de madres de familia de su ciudad.Desea incrementar la oferta de las mismas y a esa razón atiende su petición.

loans.use: More capital so she may offer a greater quantity of pots and pans.

loans.name: Naouton Rachelle

texts.fr:
Mrs. Naouton Rachelle Houkanrin is the mother of 5 childen. She is responsible for 6 grandchildren. She has lived in Yagbe, a neighborhood of Cotonou, since birth and is married to Zachée Zannou, who is a mason. She was born around 1961 in Cotonou and has sold cakes since around 1978. To diversify her business, she chose to sell liquor. The demand from her clientele has grown and she is not entirely able to satisfy her customers, due to her financial resources. She is requesting her fifth loan in the amount of US$ 475 which will bolster her capacity to satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Dame H. Naouton Rachelle est mère de 5 enfants. Elle a à sa charge 6 petits fils. Elle réside à YAGBE, un quartier de COTONOU depuis sa naissance et a épousé ZANNOU Zachée, technicien en maçonnerie. Elle est née vers les années 1961 à COTONOU et exerce comme activité la vente de gâteaux depuis les années 1978. Pour diversifier son activité elle a opté pour la vente de liqueurs. La demande de sa clientèle a augmenté et elle ne pouvait plus satisfaire pleinement ses clients, faute de ressources financières. Elle sollicite pour son cinquième crédit un montant de 200 000 F CFA qui serviront à renforcer ses capacités à satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Purchase of 50 kg of wheat flour, 5 cases of liquor, and 10 liters of peanut oil

Achat de 50 kg de farine de blé, de 5 cartons de liqueurs et de 10 litres d’huile d’arachide.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Doña Virginia is 28 years old. She has completed elementary school, is the mother of three children, is married, and lives in the M. in the town of Camicachi, Ilave district, Province of El Calloa and the Region of Puno.

She is an active member of the "22 de Septiembre" community bank in M.. With the first loans she received, she embarked on the business of purchasing and selling cattle in the markets in the districts of Pilcuyo and Ilave. This business has generated earnings.

With this loan of 300 new soles ($125), one that she will repay in 4 months, she will buy more cattle.

Her dream is to increase her income to buy a house in the city of Ilave, to continue raising cattle, and for her children to study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Virginia tiene 28 años de edad, su nivel educativo es primaria completa, es madre de tres hijos, es casada y vive en la parcialidad de M., del Centro Poblado de Camicachi, del distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y Región de Puno.

Ella es socia activa del Banco Comunal de 22 de Septiembre de la parcialidad de M., con los primeros créditos que recibió emprendió el negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno, en las ferias del distrito de Pilcuyo y del distrito de Ilave, este negocio generó ganancias.

Con este crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual serà pagado en 4 meses, comprarà màs ganado vacuno.

Su sueño es incrementar más su capital para comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave, continuar con el engorde de ganado vacuno y que estudien sus hijos y sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of Cattle

loans.name: Peggy Ysabell

texts.es:
Peggy belongs to the La Familia Communal Bank located at Jr. Habilitación Urbana Mz.A Lt.4 in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 31 years old and is the mother of 2 children and her husband is in the military. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles Peggy decided to invest in a bodega.

Peggy now sells food and other merchandise and also raises chickens on a temporary basis.

With this loan of 3,000 soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy staple food goods so that she can prepare her menu and she will also buy clothing such as 1 package of men's polos, 3 packages of women's blouses, 2 packages of pants and other products.

Peggy is happy because she has been able to achieve certain goals of hers and all because of Manuela Ramos' support because the last loan that she received helped her to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Peggy, pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en Jr. Habilitación Urbana Mz.A Lt.4 del Distrito de Calleria, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años es madre de 2 hijos y su esposo es soldador. Peggy con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en bodega. Peggy, en la actualidad esta con venta de comida, venta de mercadería y crianza de pollos que es temporal. Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará víveres de primera necesidad para que pueda preparar su menú, y comprará mercaderías de ropa como: (1doc. polos de caballero, 3 doc. blusas para damas, 2 doc. pantalones y otros). Peggy, se siente feliz y a la vez realizada de poder conseguir ciertos objetivos y todo esto gracias a la institución de Manuela Ramos por que con el préstamo que recibió le ayudo a implementar más su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase supplies and clothing.

loans.name: Fatou Teugne

texts.fr: Fatou Teugne D. est mariée et mere de cinq enfants.Elle est agée de cinquante ans.Elle confectionne des habits qu'elle renvend dans son quartier à Cité Lamy et cela depuis plusieur années de cela
texts.en:
Fatou Teugne D., age 50, is married and the mother of five children. For several years, she's been making clothes that she sells in her neighborhood in Cité Lamy.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Manufacturing and sale of clothes

texts.es:
La señora Benny Margarita Álamo P. tiene 27 años y vive en Manuel Cox 132 en el Pueblo Joven Aurora Díaz del distrito de Salaverry en la provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Auroras en Acción y es tesorera.
Benny estudiaba Técnica contable en el Instituto San Luis, pero ya no pudo continuar debido a que tuvo un embarazo de alto riesgo. Tiene un hijo que depende de ella.
Empezó su negocio vendiendo marcianos, luego incrementó con mazamorra, cachanga, etc. Gracias al préstamo de Manuela Ramos ha incrementado su negocio y compró una vitrina fue  así  como superó  con la venta de abarrotes y golosinas. Su negocio funciona en su casa. 
Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas, con los que incrementó su negocio.
Con este crédito de 1200 soles que cancelará en 6 cuotas, Invertirá en la comprar  abarrotes y golosinas, luego viajará a Lima para comprar ropa interior.
Benny sueña en ser profesional y tener un gran negocio, piensa que si lo logrará porque es una mujer emprendedora que lo que se propone lo logra.
texts.en: Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Paraiso Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "PARAÍSO" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA MERCEDES  ELLA ES CASADA Y TIENE CUATRO HIJOS MENORES D. EDAD ; LAS DEMÁS SOCIAS TANBIEN SON MADRES D. FAMILIA, CON NIÑOS MENORES D. CINCO AÑOS. EN SU MAYORÍA LOS MIEMBROS DEL GRUPO SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO D. ROPA, VERDURAS Y VARIEDAD D. CARNE, ENTRE LOS VARONES SE DEDICAN AL TRANSPORTE PÚBLICO. EN GENERAL TODOS LOS SOCIOS TIENEN EXPERIENCIA EN SUS DIFERENTES RUBROS SABEN QUE EL CRECIMIENTO DEL MERCADO LES EXIGE MEJORAR Y AUMENTAR MAS LOS PRODUCTOS A LA VENTA ES POR ESO QUE OPTARON POR UN FINANCIAMIENTO D. LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL. PARA ALGUNOS EL TRABAJO EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS ES DESCONOCIDO PERO SON GENTE RESPONSABLE Y CON GANAS D. TRABAJAR PARA SALIR ADELANTE.
texts.en:
The "PARAÍSO" ("Paradise") Group is represented by Ms Mercedes. She is married and has four minor children. The other women in the group are also mothers with children under the age of five. For the most part, the members of the group sell clothes, vegetables, and a variety of meats. The men in the group work in public transportation. Generally, all the members have experience in their different businesses. They know that the growth of their businesses will require them to improve and increase the products they sell. For this reason they have decided to request a loan from Agrocapital. This will be the first group loan for some of the members, but they are responsible people who want to work in order to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora has been blessed with two children, Prescious who is 10 years old and Kevin who is one year old. Aurora helps her family in her own little way by selling viands and snacks in their barangay while her husband farms. Despite the hardships they encounter with everyday life, they still manage to stick together as one family.

Aurora generates an income of PHP 250.00 per day through her business. She wants her family to escape poverty and so she has joined hands with her husband to strive harder to improve their way of living. To further develop her business, Aurora now requests a loan of PHP 5,000 so she can purchase farm materials for her husband. This will help him to maintain his crops.

Like any other mother, Aurora dreams of giving her children a good education. She believes that by working with her husband, she will be able to fulfill this dream. Together they will be able to taste the beauty of life, even if just for a little while.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Luaiva

texts.en: Luaiva T., 31, is divorced with 2 children.  She has no experience in the ice cake business. She sells to the village people and primary school 7 days per week. She is a new member requesting her first loan. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 100 Tala.  SPBD loans are Luaiva’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of sugar, Koolaid, foam cups and a refrigerator to start up her ice cake business

loans.name: Inés Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, en el sector cuatro, comunidad de Sucano, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 21 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene un hijo, asimismo posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace dos años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio de compra y venta al mayor de cereales (habas, quinua, chuño) en las ferias de Arequipa y crianza de cerdos; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que destinó a la comercialización de sus productos en la feria de El Altiplano en Arequipa.
Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles que le servirá como capital adicional en la compra de más mercadería (chuño al mayor) para comercializarlo al mayor y menor en los mercados de Tacna y Arequipa; asimismo comprar cerdos para engordarlos y las ganancias de su negocio lo viene invirtiendo en la alimentación de su menor hijo y para su posterior educación; agradece a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo y se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Verónica is a member of The White River's Breezes Community Bank and lives in Sucano, Peru. She is a 21-year-old married mother of one son and has a high school degree. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for two years. She has a business buying and selling cereals (broad beans, quinoa, potato flour) at the Arequipa flea market and also raises pigs. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to sell her products at the Altiplano market in Arequipa. With the current loan of 800 soles she's requesting, she plans to purchase more merchandise (potato flour at wholesale) to sell at wholesale and retail at the markets in Tacna and Arequipa. She will also purchase pigs to fatten, and will use the earnings to feed and later educat her children. She thanks Manuela Ramos for its support and she promises to repay the loan punctually in five months.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potato flour at wholesale to sell at wholesale and retail at the markets in Tacna and Arequipa, and purchase pigs to fatten

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena B. sells local dishes known as Obrayo and also fries fish for sale at Tatermu near Elmina. Abena has received a primary level education.  She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a minister. Abena has been selling local dishes since 1997. She is responsible for assisting her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her buy more corn. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Buy more corn

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
“Life is what you make it mean. What you are now is the result of your actions.” 

This is the philosophy of Everlyn R. of Sta.Lucia, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She lives happily with her beloved husband Edwin R. and their two children, Charmaine and Charmon R.. The eldest is now in her second year of high school, while the youngest is a grade III pupil.

Everlyn manages a small 'sari-sari' store at home, meaning 'a small community store' in Filipino. Her husband is a jeepney driver. Both businesses are their major source of family income. At the store, Everlyn only earns an average of PHP750 weekly, while her husband's income from driving a jeep is fluctuating. At times, they are cash-strapped when their children require financial assistance for school. Thus, the couple want to improve their business in order to increase their income and satisfy their needs. 

Everlyn joined a lending institution to support their business and get some benefits offered by the microfinance institution. She is applying for a loan of 7,000 pesos to increase her store capital.

With financial support and hardwork, she hopes to make their business grow.

loans.use: To expand a community store

loans.name: Adzowa Eyonam

texts.fr: S. adzowa a toujours voulu apprendre le métier de la couture, malheureusement elle n’a pas pu, elle s’est alors lancée en 1999 dans le commerce  d’articles de mercerie, ayant besoin actuellement d’agrandir son stock d’articles de mercerie afin de mieux vendre et augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, elle demande à WAGES son premier crédit qui lui permettrait d’acheter divers articles de mercerie. Elle est mariée et 05 enfants, avec le revenu tiré de son commerce elle contribue aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adzowa S. always wanted to learn to be a seamstress, but unfortunately, she was not able to, so she started up a little business selling notions. She now needs to expand her inventory of sewing supplies, so as to sell more and thus make more profit. She has asked WAGES for her first loan which will permit her to buy various sewing supplies for re-sale. She is married and has 5 children; with the income from her little business, she contributes to supporting the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of notions for re-sale

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 38 years old and married with 4 children. He is a motorcycle mechanic. He also sells motorcycle spare parts. He is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
El señor Rolando Armendáriz es casado con la señora Betty, el trabaja como promotor de diversos comercios desde hace 5 años, ella también es promotora de una empresa de carnes frías, son padres de 3 niños, son una familia unida y trabajadora porque saben que solo así se pueden lograr sus proyectos.
Ellos están solicitando este crédito para la colocación del vitropiso en su casa y lograr así una mejor comodidad para su familia.
texts.en:
Rolando Armendáriz is married to Betty. He has worked as a promoter of various products for 5 years. Betty is also a promoter of a business of cold meats. They are parents to 3 children. They are a united, working family because they know that this is the only way they can achieve their goals. They are requesting this loan to place a “vitropiso” [a type of ceramic floor] in their home, and in this way, gain more comfort for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a ceramic floor in their home.

loans.name: Matthew

texts.en:
Matthew A. is married and has five dependents. He received schooling through senior high school and has been selling wood and firewood in Terterim since 2003. His wife is a fishmonger.

Matthew will use this loan to buy more wood and firewood in large quantity for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Matthew plans to save and build.

loans.use: To buy more wood and firewood.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer P. is from the village of Bay-bay, Balatacan, Tangub City. She is 28 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Jennifer owns and operates a business selling fish. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Jennifer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more fish to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Batdulam

texts.en:
Batdulam B. lives with her husband and two small daughters in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her oldest daughter's name is Zolzaya and she goes a local secondary school. The youngest daughter, Monhzaya, is 3 years old and goes to a local kindergarten.

Batdulam's husband has a small business in local freight transportation. She owns a small truck that is used for transportating various products between local towns. Although she started this transportation business last year, she has done well and her business capital has increased from 80,000 Mongolian tugriks to 200,000 tugriks (US $55 to $139).

Batdulam and her husband say that they would like to see their daughters well educated and they are working hard to make their dreams come true. Batdulam requests a loan to purchase necessary accessories and fuel for the truck in their business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and fuel

loans.name: Gadoy

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Гадой Бойкузиев работает плотником, из дерева он мастерит окна и двери. Но основным источником дохода в его семье является занятие Гадойя животноводческой деятельностью. 20 лет Гадой занимается выращиванием и откормом крупнорогатого скота. У него достаточный опыт в этой сфере деятельности. Помощники Гадойя – это его дети Чурат и Соат, а так же жена Назира. 
Гадой хочет получить кредит для откорма скота и переработки молока.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Gadoy B. works as a carpenter, he makes doors and windows from wood. But the main source of income for Gadoy's family is the animal husbandry business. For twenty years Gadoy has been growing and feeding large cattle. He has sufficient level of experience in this field. Gadoy's helpers are his children Churat and Soat and also his wife Nazira. Gadoy wants to get a loan to feed the cattle and for processing of milk.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To feed the cattle and process milk

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel has owned and run a small shoe vending business for the past year. A 33-year-old father of two, Samwel has requested his first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to buy a stock of shoes. He hopes that this loan will help to raise his income and allow him to pay school fees for his children and have a good life. One day, Samwel wants to grow his business and buy a house to operate his business from as well as to use as a home. Samwel describes himself as polite, committed, and self-dependent.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of shoes

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 64 year old widow with no children. She resides in and owns a four roomed house where she stays with five people. Margaret takes care of additional family members. There is no electricity or piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area. She doesn’t incur extra transport costs to and from work. She buys her local brew from suppliers in Kibuye, who get it from villages, at one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She sells to 30 customers a day, both retail and wholesale. Margaret works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business and residence, plus medication costs. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Margaret has been with MCDT for five years and is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of local brew and gin for resale. Margaret hopes to see her business grow bigger, as well as own a permanent business premise and home.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local brew and gin.

loans.name: Vicenta Del Carmen

texts.es: Vicenta Del Carmen S. M. reside en Lourdes Colon municipio del departamento de La Libertad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos menores de edad Oscar de 9 años y Diana de 7.  Ambos hijos han crecido muy apegados  a su mamá, y pasan las tardes en la pequeña venta de productos de belleza que Vicenta maneja en su casa. Vicenta solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva materia prima y buscar un mayor desarrollo de su negocio.

loans.use: Surtir su inventario

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira G. is from the village of Tonggo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Elvira is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elvira joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elvira from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Djasmin

texts.en: Djasmin is married with 5 children.  Djasmin is a true entrepreneur.  She has been working in her field of selling small fish from Lake Kivu (3 hours drive from the capital city of Kigali) for 9 years.  The hours of operation for her business are 6AM - 630PM every day.  The business is doing quite well and employs a total of 4 other people.  The anticipated monthly profit for Djasmin's business is nearly 150,000 RWF (or roughly $US275).  This is not Djasmin's first loan from Vision Finance Company - she has had 7 loans previously - All fully paid.  Access to credit is critical for the proper functioning of any small enterprise and Djasmin's business is no exception.

loans.use: for purchasing more small fish to sell

loans.name: Bibihursand

texts.ru: Бибихурсанд Холова проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 45 лет. Вдова, имеет 4 детей. Бибихурсанд более 15 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет магазин в котором торгует хозяйственными товарами. Ей также помогают ее дети. Кредит просит для закупа нового ассортимента.
texts.en:
Bibihursand H. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 45 years old, a widow and has 4 children. Bibihursand has been involved in retail sales for over 15 years. She owns a store where she sells household goods. Her children also help her. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a new selection of goods.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new goods selection

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel L. is from the town of Magcamiguing Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Maricel is married and has 2 small children. To make a living, Maricel owns & operates a specialized retail store selling goods like blouses and shorts in the local community. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Maricel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and give her the ability to engage in business activities. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maricel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Marie Madeleine

texts.fr: B. Marie Madeleine est née en 1965 à Dangbo, non loin de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à DOSSOU Mondji un chauffeur,  Marie Madeleine est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Marie Madeleine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Djègan-kpèvi à Porto-Novo, depuis près de 6 ans. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Marie Madeleine n’a fréquenté que le cours primaire. Pour se prendre en charge et satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants, Marie Madeleine vend depuis environs 4 ans, des gâteaux d’arachides (fait à base d’arachide et du sucre) à son domicile et aussi de façon ambulante. Marie Madeleine mène comme activité secondaire, la vente de maïs. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Bohicon dans le Zou au Bénin, que Marie Madeleine s’approvisionne. Marie Madeleine a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Marie Madeleine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de l’institution, afin d’agrandir davantage son activité et de mieux faire face aux besoins de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Marie-Madeleine B. was born in 1965 in Dangbo, not far from Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married to Mondji DOSSOU, a driver. Marie-Madeleine is the mother of four children, all in school. Marie-Madeleine has lived with her children and her husband in Djègan-Kpèvi in Porto-Novo for the last six years. The couple together takes care of the family’s expenses.

Marie-Madeleine only attended elementary school. In order to take care of herself, and to meet the needs of her children, Marie-Madeleine has been selling peanut cakes (made from peanuts and sugar) for the last four years. She sells from her home and door-to-door. As a second activity Marie-Madeleine sells corn.

Marie-Madeleine gets her goods from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and in Bohicom in the Zou County of Benin. Marie-Madeleine has already received two loans from ALIDé, which have been fully repaid. Marie-Madeleine is requesting a third loan from the institution in order to increase her activity and to better meet her customers’ needs.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar and baskets of peanuts.

loans.name: Life Group

texts.en:
Rose is 36years old she is married and mother with six children. Among the children one is schooling and the rest are currently working. Margaret is resourceful mother who works very hard to provide food for the children. She is a petty trader who sells in the community market of Offinso where she lives. She sells items like cassava, spices, vegetables, yam etc. and she has been in business for thirty years now. She requests the loan to buy more food stuffs like cassava, yam, vegetables etc. She takes delivery of stock from the farming communities. She would be grateful for your assistance.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Life’. She is the one sitting in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty trader, food vendors and farmers respectively. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan. They would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk.

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.es:
La señora Kamila A. de 24 años vende zapatos en la calle Tihuanaku todos los días y necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería. Verónica B. de 32 años tiene su tienda de ferretería, donde vende material de construcción como fierros, tubos, grifos y otros, ella necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería. Las demás integrantetes del grupo Shalom que pertenece al Centro Focal Santiago II, cuentan con diferentes negocios como la pintura, confección de polleras, venta de jugos, café, queso y pollos. 
Shalom se fundo hace 2 años aproximadamente y les gusta llevarse como hermanas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kamila A. is 24 years old and sells shoes on Tihuanaku Street every day. She needs a loan in order to buy merchandise to resell. Veronia B. is 32 years old and has a hardware store where she sells construction materials like saws, plumbing, pipes and other necessities. She needs a loan in order to buy merchandise to resell. The other members of the Shalom Group from Centro Focal Santiago each have different businesses like painting, a dress shop, a juice store, a cafe, and cheese and chicken sales. Shalom was foudned two years ago, and the group supports members as if they were sisters.

Translated from Spanish by Misty McNally, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for their stores to resell

loans.name: Jose Elmer

texts.es: El señor Jose Elmer P. M. tiene 51  años de edad, vive en el Barrio Waspan Norte, es casado y su esposa le ayuda a atender el negocio mientras él anda realizando trabajos de albañilería, él tiene una pequeña venta de queso y cosméticos, ellos tienen 2 hijos de 23 años el cual actualmente trabaja y la menor de 14 años que estudia la escuela secundaria, el mayor anhelo del señor P. sería el terminar de edificar su casa, el educar y preparar a su hija menor y poder hacer evolucionar su negocio para que un dia solo depender de el, para esto solicita un prestamo que le brinde los recursos económicos para elevar las ventas y tener mayores ganacias.
texts.en:
Jose Elmer P. M. is 51, and he lives in the Waspan Norte neighborhood. He is married, and his wife helps him tend the business while he is doing his work as a bricklayer. He has a small business selling cheese and cosmetics. They have two children. One is 23 and is currently working. The younger one is 14, and she goes to high school. Mr. Peralt’s greatest desires are to finish building his house, to educate and prepare his youngest daughter, and to be able to develop his business so that one day they can rely solely on the business. That is why he is requesting a loan to give him the economic resources to increase sales and have greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa B. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Luisa is widowed and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Luisa plants and harvests rice for sale. Luisa has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luisa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Luisa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en: Ganbold is 51 years old and lives with his two children in the Ovorhangai province of Mongolia.  He and his two sons live in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent.  He operates a wooden furniture trading business and his two children help him paint the wooden furniture.  With the Mongolian Lunar New Year coming, demand for his services is high.  He started his business in 1990, and he has his own equipment in his home.  He is a hard working person, and his communication skills are good. He says, “I would like to expand my business and to buy a car for my son. Therefore, my son will be able to run a taxi service and it will be easier for us to transport our wooden products. ” He is requesting a 2,780,000-tugrugs loan to purchase wood and materials.

loans.use: To purchase wood and raw materials

loans.name: Makhbuba

texts.en:
Makhbuba A. is a very hardworking woman and knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all of her courage. She is married and has six children.

Makhbuba works raising animals and feeding them with the goal of later selling them. This activity creates in her feelings of satisfaction because it allows her to provide a considerable part of the household income.

Makhbuba wants to improve her stable stalls and produce milk in a quantity sufficient for selling it commercially. It is for this reason that she’s requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN to buy calves. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Doña Justina Gutiérrez M., reside en la ciudad de Somoto, y se dedica a dar clases como profesora de nivel de educación primaria, ella utilizara este préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y pago de mano de obra, con este crédito quiere construir un muro o pared para tener una mayor seguridad en el patio de sus casa. Doña Justina comenzó a trabajar como profesora de educación primaria desde hace 12 años, el lugar donde ella trabaja como profesora es en una comunidad  rural a unos 8 km de Somoto, viaja todos los días por la mañana a impartir sus clases a los niños que viven en esa localidad y que no pueden viajar hacia Somoto para estudiar. Doña Justina con este crédito espera mejorar las condiciones de sus vivienda y de esta forma darles a sus hijos un lugar más digno y seguro  donde ellos  puedan vivir. Ya que ella es madre soltera de dos Hijos los que estudian por la mañana, la razón por la cual es madre soltera fue porque su ex esposo la abandono de forma irresponsable a ella y sus hijos sin darle ningún tipo de ayuda.   Doña Justina tiene 4 años de trabajar con Ceprodel se le han otorgado 6 créditos los cuales ha utilizado para ir poco a poco mejorando sus casa de habitación.  El beneficio que ella ha tenido es bastante importante, ya que ella tiene como ingreso único su salario como madre soltera y de este tiene que cubrir los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, con el crédito ella ha podido lograr ir poco apoco mejorando su casa y darles a sus hijos un mejor nivel de vida más digno.
texts.en:
Doña Justina Gutiérrez M. lives in the city of Somoto and works as a primary school teacher. With this loan she wants to build a wall around the patio of her house, for better security. She will use the money to pay for materials and labor. Doña Justina has been working as a teacher for 12 years. She works in a rural community 8 km from Somoto and travels everyday to teach to the children in this town, who can't get to Somoto to attend school. With this loan, Doña Justina hopes to improve her living conditions and give her children a decent, safe place to live. She is a single mother and her children go to school in the mornings. Doña Justina's ex-husband abandoned her and their children without giving them any kind of support. Doña Justina has been working with Ceprodel for 4 years. She has received 6 loans, which have been used to improve her home bit by bit. She has benefited greatly from this, as her only income is her salary, which must be used for household expenses and her children's studies. These loans have allowed her to slowly improve her home and provide her children with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: 16 bags of cement, 3 bags of sand, 300kg of iron rods.

loans.name: Tarapaca Group

texts.es:
El centro focal Senkata es  pequeño y se encuentra en una zona alejada del centro de la ciudad de El Alto. En centro focal se encuentra la Asociación Comunal Tarapacá la misma que está conformada por 8 integrantes.  Este grupo es nuevo y están motivadas a trabajar con fuerza en sus negocios, al respecto, ellas tienen variadas actividades económicas como la venta de comida, costura de prendas de vestir, trabajo de construcción, tejido de manta, servicio de transporte y atención de tienda de barrio
Elva M.  de 19 años, es esposa y madre de 1 niño, tiene el negocio de tejido de manta hace 3 años, aprendió esta actividad de su cuñada, ella esta solicitando Bs.- 1000 para comprar lana y seguir produciendo. Vende sus productos en la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto  ambulando (ofrece sus productos persona a persona).
texts.en:
The Senkata regional office is small and in an area far from the downtown of the city of El Alto. The communal association Tarapacá is located in the regional office. It is made up of 8 members. This group is new and they are motivated to work hard in their businesses. They have various economic activities such as selling food, sewing clothes, working in construction, weaving blankets, transport service and attending to a neighborhood store. Elva M. is 19 years old. She is a wife and mother of a 1 year old boy. She has had a blanket weaving business for 3 years. She learned this activity from her sister in law. She is asking for Bs.- 1000 to buy wool and keep producing. She sells her products in the Ceja in the city of El Alto as a street vendor (she offers her products person to person).

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw material (wool)

loans.name: Americo Antonio

texts.pt:
Américo António G.   

Américo António G. nasceu no Distrito de Zavala, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique tem 42 anos de idade, casado e Pai de 5 filhos de 14, 12, 10, 8 e 2 anos de idade, os 4 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez 9ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras e por problemas de vista. Vive na casa cedida pelos serviços com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Zavala para Maputo quando foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatório, mais tarde decidiu fixar sua residência em Maputo. É militar e quadro do Ministério da Defesa ha mais de 28 anos, tem um salário mensal de 14.884.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BCI).
Ja teve empréstimos no Banco Millenium Bim, mais tarde decidiu não continuar devido a varias razoes. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de mobilizações feitas por oficiais de crédito no quartel. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 21.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para concluir a sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 20.000.00mt e 26.148.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro, gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para terminar a sua casa e passar a viver na sua própria residência.
texts.en:
Américo António G. was born in Zavala District, Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique. He is 42, married and the father of 5 children, ages 14, 12, 10, 8 and 2. The four eldest go to school. Américo finished ninth grade but did not continue with school because of financial difficulties and vision problems. He lives with his family in military housing and does not support anyone else. He left Zavala for Maputo when he was drafted into military service. Later on, he decided to live in Maputo. He has been a soldier employed by the Ministry of Defense for more than 28 years. He has a monthly salary of 14,884 meticais, which he uses for household expenses and saves some in his bank account (at BCI). Américo has had loans before with Banco Millenium Bim. He eventually decided not to continue with them for several reasons. He learned about Hluvuku through enrollment efforts made by loan officers at the barracks. This is Américo's third loan. He is asking for 21,000 meticais to buy construction materials (cement, sand, stone and other items) to finish his house. The previous loans were for 20,000 meticais and 26,148 meticais, both for the same purpose. He promises to pay off this loan on time to maintain his credit. In the future, he would like to ask for more loans to finish his house and begin to live in his own home.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material (cement, sand, stone, etc.)

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has a pharmacy store where she sells drugs, groceries, wine and baby items in order to sustain her self and family financially. She does this trade in Lagos and has been it for some years now. She lives in Lagos with her husband who is a civil servant. She is very determines to pull her family out of poverty by increasing her business and profitability. 
She is 40 years of age and she hopes for the loan of NGN100, 000 to purchase more drugs, groceries, wine and baby items to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs, groceries, wine and baby items to sell.

loans.name: Heiddy Del Socorro

texts.es: Heiddy Del Socorro tienen 33 años, su actividad es la venta de productos de limpieza. Ella tiene más de 2 años que se dedica a este negocio es su primer crédito y está muy entusiasmada con este negocio, pues es su principal fuente de ingresos para su familia, pues es una mujer muy emprendedora y se siente muy satisfecha con sus avances. Por lo que este financiamiento lo solicita para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su actividad. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio lo suficiente  para mejorar su condición.
texts.en:
Heiddy Del Socorro, 33, sells cleaning supplies. She has been in this line of work for 2 years and this is her first loan. She is very enthusiastic about the business because it’s her family’s main source of income; she is a very enterprising woman and she’s very satisfied with her progress to date. She is asking for funding to buy raw materials. Her wish is to expand her business enough to improve her condition.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cleaning supplies.

loans.name: León

texts.es:
El señor León F. H. tiene 52 años, es viudo con tres hijos que viven con el, vive en la comunidad Dami Rancho ubicado a 75 Km aproximadamente de Cochabamba sobre la carretera antigua a Santa Cruz en la Provincia Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba.

La principal actividad del señor León F. H. es la agricultura que trabaja juntamente con su familia ellos producen papa, haba, arveja y cereales, los cuales despues vende en la feria de Tiraque. Las condiciones en las que vive es una casa que está construida de barro con techo de paja son agua de pozo y lamentablemente no tienen luz en su domicilio. Esto es debido a lo alejado de su domicilio.

El crédito que ha solicitado es para comprar los insumos agrícolas para la producción agrícola de esta año, el objetivo del señor León es producir mas este año para mejorar sus ingresos y de esa manera poder mejorar un poco sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. León F. H. is a 52 year old widower, who lives with his three children. They live in Dami Rancho, a community in the province of Tiraque, located approximately 75 Km away from Cochabamba, on the old road to Santa Cruz. Their house is built out of clay, with a thatched roof, no water well and unfortunately, without electricity due to the remote location. Mr. F. H.’s main activity is agriculture. Together with his family, he grows potatoes, beans, peas and cereals. He later sells these crops at the fair in Tiraque. He has requested a loan to buy the agricultural supplies for this year’s production. His goal for this year is to produce more and improve his income. By doing this, he looks forward to slightly improving his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Liliana Matos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies for the harvest

loans.name: Illuminada's Group

texts.en:
Illuminada P. is from the village of Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 60 years old, married, and the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. To make a living, she operates a sari-sari store selling a variety of different products. Illuminada has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month. In 2009, Illuminada joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 12500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Illuminada from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy goods to sell.

loans.name: Bilquis' Group

texts.en:
Bilquis is a resident of a city called Vehari, in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 15 years. 

A very active lady, Bilquis stays at home to manage the domestic chores and take care of her family. She gets up early and waits until the family members come back home. They help each other in their work. 

Her husband's name is S.. He runs a canteen in a local school, where he sells home-cooked food such as nan kababs and finger chips. His items are very famous among the students. He recovers the financial expenses from his canteen business, but as the expenses are going higher day by day due to the high cost of purchasing the required items, Bilquis has decided to apply for a loan from Asasah. With the loan amount, they will buy the required items and save the purchasing cost by buying in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase required items for canteen business

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Aun E. is married to Thav Long, and she lives in the village of Angkonh in the province Takeo. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land, on which she cultivates rice to sell to support her family; her husband is a motorbike taxi driver. They try to work hard, but they earn little money to support their family. In order to improve this condition, Aun E. is seeking a loan to buy a cow, and with the rest of the loan she will buy ten piglets to start a new breeding business. She is the mother of four children, two of whom are studying in local public school, while the others are too small to work or study. Her husband is pictured in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Rafael Genaro

texts.es: El  Sr. Rafael Genaro C. M.   él es Trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur  desempeñándose como Operario de Limpieza tiene  diez  año de trabajar para esta empresa. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Rafael Genaro C. M. Works for the city of San Rafael Sur. He has been a municipal sanitation worker for 10 years. He has had two loans with CEPRODEL that he’s used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements. The loans have been of great use to him in that his and his family’s living conditions improved.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies like: sand, cement, stone, gravel.

loans.name: Davronbek

texts.en:
Davronbek I. lives in Chaldovar village, in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan. He is married and has two children.  Davronbek was born into a family of farmers and was the main helper to his parents in farming and cattle breeding.  That allowed him to gain a wide experience in these activities. 

In 2000, in order to find the earnings required to support his family, Davronbek decided to start his own business in cattle breeding. Using the money, which he had put aside for a rainy day, Davronbek bought one milch cow. Owing to his persistent and hardworking personality, Davronbek managed to multiply his investments. Today, his farm has five milch cows and two bulls.
