Davronbek is applying for a loan of 100,000 KGS  to buy one milch cow and bull-calves. With the revenue, he plans to broaden his business by purchasing more cattle for fattening. In future, Davronbek plans to move near Karabalta town, where his children could go to a good school.

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Sahtagan

texts.en:
Sahtagan M., 37, lives with his wife and four children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Bayan-Ulgiy Province in western Mongolia. His wife is currently unemployed, while three of their children attend a local secondary school and his youngest son goes to a local kindergarten.

Sahtagan has operated a transportation service using his truck since 2000, and his earnings from this successful enterprise enabled him to purchase a big new Russian truck called the Zil-130 with a truck trailer in 2009. He hopes to continue making progress with his business and says, " My truck trailer is old, so I need to purchase a new one." Sahtagan is now requesting a 3,000,000 MNT (2249 USD) loan to increase his working capital before coal prices become high in anticipation of winter.

loans.use: To buy more coal

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 23-year-old man, looking after his siblings. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a permanent house and lives with six family members. His dream is to educate his siblings to have better qualifications. Richard is a motorcycle rider and has been in the business for four years now. He has the challenges of irregular customers and fluctuating fuel prices. He needs this loan to buy an improved model of motorcycle that is appropriate for the region of his transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for a transport business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Yencala Boggiano, una zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, ubicado a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de ganado ovino. Ella cría ovejas en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio. Cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Con el dinero que percibe de este negocio ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Isabel desea incursionar en el negocio de la crianza y venta de ganado caprino, ya que estos animales desarrollan más rápido y son vendidos a mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante tranquila y trabajadora. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer honesta y de confianza.
texts.en:
Isabel is a mom, she is 42 years old and she lives together with her husband and their children in the Yencala Boggiano sector. It is a rural district of Lambayeque, located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. 

She raises sheep for a living. She keeps the sheep in a corral near her home. When they have reached a certain time in their development she sells them to the merchants that visit the region. With the profits she earns from this business she is able to contribute with her husband towards the family's finances.

Isabel wants to start raising and selling goats because they grow and develop quicker and they are sold at better prices. In order to meet her objective she has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a first time loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles.

She is a calm and hard working woman. Those that know her consider her to be a very honest and trustworthy person.

loans.use: To purchase goats.

loans.name: Hoeurng

texts.en:
Hoeurng C., 30, is a married mother. Hoeurng currently works as a masseuse on staff with a proper monthly salary in Siem Reap Province. She is married to Mr. Chan Thoun, 40, who shares responsibility for the family by working as a policeman. They are good parents to four children, who are students at the public school. 

Hoeurng C. is concerned that she faces difficulties in travelling to her workplace because her motor is broken from overuse. Hoeurng’s personal savings are not enough to buy a replacement. Hoeurng has therefore requested a loan of $300 to buy a used motorcycle to replace her broken one.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Flora Estefani

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Flora; ella tiene 52 años de edad, casada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de  ollas de la marca Reyna Ware vendiendo sartenes, ollas a presión, cacerolas. 
La socia es profesora de nivel primario y en sus ratos libres se dedica  a  este negocio. 

  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más ollas para así poder vender a todos sus conocidos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ms. Flora belongs to the "Amauta" communal bank [Amauta means "wise man" or "teacher" in the Quechua language]. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Flora is 52 years old, married, and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with selling Reyna Ware brand cookware.  She sells saucepans, pressure cookers, and casseroles. She is a primary school teacher and runs this business in her spare time.

She is requesting a loan to buy more pots so that she can sell them to all of her acquaintances.

She is thankful to all those who, through this means, will help her realize this dream. She promises to make her repayments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy pots and pans to sell to her acquaintances

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
el señor Manuel de Jesus T. A. tiene 47 años de edad, esta casado y tiene dos nietos que dependen de el, vive  en el barrio La Ceibita de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, su negocio esta ubicado en el interior del mercado nuevo de San Lorenzo, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo.
don Manuel es un hombre trabajador que a sacado adelante a su familia, cuando las ventas estan malas en el mercado el sale a vender en un microbus la mercaderia a los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo y Nacaome.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar ropa y calzado de damas, caballeros y niños. se acerca la navidad y esta epoca es cuando mas se vende y quiere estar preparado para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Manuel de Jesus T. A. is 47 years old, married, with 2 grandchildren who are dependents.  He lives in the Ceibita neighborhood of the city of San Lorenzo.  His business is located inside San Lorenzo's new market, and he sells from Monday to Sunday.  Manuel is a hard-working man who supports his family.  When sales are poor in the market he takes a bus and sells in neighborhoods in San Lorenzo and Nacaome.

He will use the loan to buy clothing and shoes for men, women, and children.  Christmas is approaching, which is his busiest time, and he wants to be prepared to satisfy all of his customers' demands.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes and clothing for men, women, and children.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a 34-year-old lady, married and a mother of three children aged 15,13 and three years old. She has been selling ornaments through moving around Nairobi city and surrounding estates for the last two years where she manages to get a profit of Kshs 8,000 monthly.

She was introduced to Kadet by  a friend who has benefited and this is her first loan. She plans to buy more ornaments for sale. She plans to be in the position of importing ornaments in bulk from Dubai in future.

loans.use: Ornaments for sale

loans.name: Phourn

texts.en:
Phourn S., 31, sells Chinese noodles, earning an income of $20 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. 

The family has to spend $40 on food, $10 on electricity supply and $70 on other necessary expenses every month. Her husband is a carpenter, earning an income of $17 per day. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more materials to improve her husband's carpentry business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy more materials to improve her husband's carpentry business

loans.name: Yessenia Del Rosario

texts.es:
Yessenia tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el distrito de Chulucanas, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Morropón y se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de cerveza en su domicilio. Ella ofrece en venta a sus vecinos durante los fines de semana. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria. Ella se esfuerza siempre por captar nuevos clientes brindando un buen trato. Gracias a ello durante el poco tiempo que lleva funcionando su negocio este ha podido contar con una clientela estable y fidelizada.

Yessenia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más bebidas de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta debido a la temporada de verano. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Yessenia is 21 years old, single, and lives together with her parents in Chulucanas district, an agricultural area of Morropón province, in Piura region, more than three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Yessenia sells beer from her home.  She offers her products for sale to her neighbors on weekends.  Her business helps her to cover her personal expenses and to support her family with their daily finances.  She is always working hard to attract new customers, providing them with good customer service.  Thanks to this, during the short time that she has been in business, she has managed to attract a stable and loyal customer base.

Yessenia would like to expand her business by purchasing more drinks so that she can meet her current demand during the summer season.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy more drinks so that she can meet her current demand

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna L., 46 years old, is a married woman from the town of Santo Niño in South Cotabato province on the Mindanao islands. She has six children: four girls and two boys.

Lorna is a farmer who plants and harvests rice crops. She also has banana trees planted on her land. Lorna rents a stall at the market to sell her harvest. That way, she has access to more people in the market for rice. Lorna works hard to provide for the needs of her family.

Lorna is in need of additional fertilizer and seeds. She has applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her harvest.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine M. is 29 and is married to a technician. She and her husband do not have any children. 

For the past two years, Vestine has run her own video rental shop and employs one person. Her shop is open from 7:00 AM to 10:00 PM every day of the week. 

This is Vestine's first loan, and she intends to use it to purchase more videos to rent out. Vestine hopes to see her profits increase, allowing her to reinvest in her business and continue to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more videos to rent out to customers.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa lives in the town of Surallah with her family. She makes a living raising pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and then sells them at the market. She works hard to improve her business and her family's living conditions.

Rosa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI, and is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: Alizabeth

texts.en:
Due to issues of modesty as a married woman, Alizabeth's 20 year old daughter is pictured in the photo. Alizabeth is a 39-year-old mother of 11 children. Three years ago, she opened a photography and event organization business. She speaks about catching that special moment with a simple click of her lens. Alizabeth works with each client to focus the pictures and event album to fit their dreams. Before opening her business, Alizabeth never held down a job.

Alizabeth took this loan to update and purchase photography & video equipment and a rolling cart for equipment transport.

In the future, Alizabeth wants to purchase a DJ system and continue to expand her business so she will actualize the dreams of each bride, family and client.

loans.use: to update and purchase her photography & video equipment and a rolling cart for equipment transport.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a single mother of four.  She is able to raise her children with the income she gets from selling old newspapers and magazines.  She has engaged in the business for four years.  She is a very hardworking lady who hopes to become a major supplier of newspapers in the future.  Her life has changed since she joined Faulu Kenya because of her improved business.  She has requested for 60, 000 Kes to buy more newspapers.

loans.use: to buy more newspapers

loans.name: Fantasia De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama  FANTASIA D. SAN PEDRO, las integrantes eligieron el nombe porque añoran el éxito cotidiano en su negocios, buscando  una oportunidad  D. tener más ventas y crecer. Están ubicadas en el Estado D. México. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un crédito. Esperanza A. R. es integrante del grupo tiene 34 años, tiene esdudios D. tecnico iundustrial, es ama D. casa  y no tiene hijos. Ella se dedica a la producción y venta D. totillas hechas a mano que inició hace 2 años. Solicita el prestamo para adquirir más materia prima como maiz. Sus clientes son personas D. la misma localidad, prefieren comprar los productos con ella , por la calidad y buen servicio que ofrece así como la atención muy amable D. la señora, eso ayuda  a incrementar su mercado y siga creciendo en clientes y ganancias. Al monento  D. solicitar este  préstamo se siente con mucha alegria D. tener la oportunidad D. invertir  nuevamente y poder distribuir más producto en movimiento. Su negocio es tan importante  ya que con ello pueD. salir adelante con los gastos D. su familia y asi tener una mejor calidad D. vida tanto D. ella como la D. su familia.
texts.en: This group is called “FANTASIA D. SAN PEDRO.”  Its members selected that name because they yearn for success in their businesses.  The group is located in the state of Mexico and is maD. up of 10 members and this will be their first loan.  Esperanza A. R. is 34 years old and a member of the group.  She is a housekeeper and doesn’t have any children.  She makes and sells tortillas by hand and has been doing so for two years.  She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients like dried corn.  Her customers are local people who buy from her because of the quality of service she provides.  She is very friendly and this helps her to increase her market share, customer base, and earnings.  She is very happy for this opportunity to once again invest in her business and be able to distribute more of her product.  Her business is so important because it allows her to get ahead with her family expenses and be able to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her tortila business.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en: Fanny is seeking a loan of $3,000 from Grameen America to support her ice cream truck business.  Fanny has been a member of Grameen America for the past two years, during which time she has received three loans and proven herself to be an exemplary borrower.  In fact, she has never missed a payment and has established herself as a leader and a source of support among her fellow Group and Center members.  Prior to receiving her first loan, Fanny was working at McDonald’s and dreaming about starting her own business.  Now, she operates a successful food truck business where she sells ice cream and other treats.  Fanny plans to use this latest loan to upgrade to a bigger ice cream truck and to purchase the food she needs to fill it.  Having a larger ice cream truck will allow Fanny to capitalize on the major increase in her business that comes with the warmer months.  With this loan, she expects to see her business boom and to get even closer to her dream of opening a store-front ice cream shop.

loans.use: to purchase a larger ice cream truck

loans.name: Dahir Abdi

texts.en:
Dahir Abdi is 36 years old.  He is married to Halimah, who helps in his restaurant. He has been running his restaurant business for a period of about five years and earns an income of 5,000 Kenyan shillings a month. 

This is Dahir Abdi's first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET by a group member. He wants to use this loan to buy wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil to be used in his restaurant.

He hopes to expand his business and improve the living standard for his family.

loans.use: to buy flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y crianza de ganado, él vive con su esposa y tres hijos, don Andrés se dedica a la crianza de ganado, comercializa la leche y quesos, también siembra maíz para el consumo familiar.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una vaquilla, ya que no dispone de los fondos, esto sea una gran ayuda para él y le permitirá aumentar el número de animales.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuertemente para ayudar a su familia y sobre todo a que sus hijos terminen de estudiar,
texts.en:
Andrés grows basic grains and also raises cattle. He lives with his wife and their three children. He sells milk and cheese, and also grows corn for the family to eat.

Andrés is seeking a loan to buy a heifer as he doesn’t have enough money to do this. This would be a big help and allow him to increase the number of animals he owns.

His goal is to work hard to support his family, and above all to help his children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy a heifer

loans.name: Obidon

texts.fr: Agée de 31ans, Mme est revendeuse de boissons depuis 2006. Son conjoint est commerçant et ils ont  01 enfant en charge. Elle est une ancienne cliente de WAGES et est à son quatrième prêt. Ce montant qu’elle sollicite lui servira à s’approvisionner en boissons pour répondre à la demande de ses clients.  L’achat se fait à la brasserie de Lomé et elle revend dans son bar nommé « BAR FOMBI »
texts.en: At 31 years of age, this lady has been retailing beverages since 2006. Her spouse is a merchant and they have one dependent child. She is a long-standing WAGES customer and this is her fourth loan. She will use the amount she is requesting to procure beverage supplies to meet her clients' needs. She purchases from Lomé brewery and resells in her bar named "Bar Fombi."

loans.use: to purchase beverages.

loans.name: Magno Dioulacolon Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 14 Décembre 2010. Il compte 29 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles  font toutes le petit commerce.

Goundo (debout à l’extrême droit)  est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans, veuve et mère de 02 enfants.

Elle gère un « Tangana » place  où on vend le petit déjeuner dans son village activité qu’elle pratique depuis trois ans

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter des sacs de niébé, des paquets de spaghettis et autres produits pour le bon fonctionnement de son activité.

Les bénéfices lui permettront en plus d’épargner, d’assurer la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en: This group was created on December 14, 2010. It comprises 29 women who all live in the same village. They all have small businesses. Goundo (standing at the far right) is the group's official. She is 46 years old, a widow, and the mother of two children. She runs a tangana, where breakfasts are sold in the village. She has had this business for three years. Her new loan will enable her to buy sacks of black-eyed peas, packets of spaghetti, and other products for her business to operate properly. The profits will allow her make sure her children are educated, as well as to save money.

loans.use: to buy sacks of black-eyed peas, packets of spaghetti, and other products for the proper operation of her business

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar, tiene 40 años, tiene 4 hijos, conviviente, tiene una cebicheria y restaurante, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de un horno para la preparación de pollos a la brasa.
Mariela y su esposo tiene una cebicheria – restaurante y también buffet para eventos especiales como: matrimonios, bautizos, cumpleaños, graduaciones, fiesta de promoción, etc. ahora piensan incursionar en la preparación de pollos a la brasa, por eso compraran su horno. Ingreso a FINCA Perú, por la invitación de una amiga,,loe gusta por los ahorros ya está casi 1 año y está ahorrando para comprarse un carro. Su sueño es poder tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Mariela is a member of the Communal Bank “Despertar” (To Wake Up). She is 40 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has four children. Mariela has a restaurant and “cevicheria” (an establishment that sell marinated seafood). The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of an oven for preparing rotisserie chickens.

Mariela and her husband manage the restaurant and “cevicheria”. They also prepare buffets for special events such as weddings, baptisms, birthdays, graduations, promotion parties, and other occasions. Now they plan to sell rotisserie chickens by purchasing this oven.

Mariela joined FINCA Peru after being invited by a friend. She enjoys being able to save. It has almost been a year and she has already saved for the purchase of a car. Her dream is to have her own location.

loans.use: to purchase an oven for preparing rotisserie chickens.

loans.name: Diappo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Diappo du banc villageois de Ngadji existe depuis le 17 mai 2010,il est composé de 16 femmes qui habitent le même village et qui ont comme dénominateur commun le petit commerce.
La responsable madame Coumba est âgée de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants, est à droite de la photo en châle rose.
Elle fait du commerce de fruits et légumes et a une bonne expérience dans ce secteur. Elle dispose d'une boutique dans le village.
Elle voudrai avec son prêt agrandir son secteur d'activité.
Ses bénéfices lui permettent de développer et de diversifier son activité.
texts.en:
The Diappo solidarity group belonging to the Banc Villageois in Ngadji was created on 17th May 2010 and is made up of 16 women who live in the same village, their common denominator being small trading activities.

The person in charge of the group is Coumba, who is 44 years old, married and mother to six children. She is on the right of the photo covered in a pink shawl. She buys and sells fruit and vegetables and has good experience in this domain She has a shop in the village. With her loan she would like to expand her field of activity. Her profits will enable her to develop and diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for reselling

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora tiene 45 años, es una mujer pujante y valiente, ella es madre de 3 hijos de los cuales solo  vive con una de ellos y su esposo en su casa que es propia. Dora depende mucho del tiempo y la temporada de lluvia para tener un trabajo arduo o simple, pues cuando el río sube su nivel, ella tiene que salir al río junto a su esposo en busca de pescado. Posee 4 redes, de las cuales los utilizan al máximo; pero cuando es temporada baja solo sale su esposo y ella queda en su casa haciendo algunas otras actividades. Lleva ya dos años trabajando en esta actividad y tiene clientes fijos quienes esperan su llegada para comprarle su producto alimenticio. Le agrada trabajar en este negocio por que lo hizo desde muy niña y aun que se dedico a otras actividades antes, se dio cuenta que esta le genera mas ganancias, además de poder trabajar junto a su esposo y en algunas oportunidades también junto a sus hijos, Lo que no le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene que salir al río y es un trabajo un poco peligroso, pero como dice ella, “que se le va hacer si de eso vive”. Tiene también 2 botes de pesca y esta en proyecto comprarse una red y un bote más. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP se siente bien con este grupo por que los problemas lo solucionan entre ellas. Con el monto solicitado, piensa comprar una red, además de dar el pago inicial para comprarse un bote.
texts.en:
Dora, 45, is a very vigorous, brave woman.  She’s the mother of three children but only one of them still lives with her and her husband in her house.  

Dora is quite dependent on the weather, especially the rainy season, to have a simple, but hard, job.  When the river’s level rises she has to go out with her husband to seek out fish.  She owns four nets that are used to the maximum extent but when the season is low, just her husband goes out and she stays home doing some other activities.  

She’s been in this line of work for two years and has regular customers who wait for her to return to buy the food fish from her.  She enjoys working in this occupation because she’s done it since childhood and even though she did other things previously she realized that this is more profitable plus she’s able to work alongside her husband and sometimes even with her children.  What she dislikes about the job is having to go out into the river because this can be somewhat dangerous but like she says: “what can one do if that’s one’s livelihood.”  She also has two fishing boats and is planning to buy another net and another boat.

This is the 2nd MFP loan.  She feels happy with this group because they solve their problems among themselves.  She will use the amount requested to buy a net and to pay the down payment on a boat.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and to pay the initial payment on a fishing boat.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Pascual de 30 años de edad,vive con su esposa e hijos en casa de su padre, cuenta con servicio deluz solamente, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Guadalupe que pertenece al departamento de la Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad comercial, ganadera y agrícola.

Desde hace 3 años Pascual se dedica a la fabricación y venta de ladrillos para construcción de casa, esta actividad es muy rentable, para seguir realizando dicha labor a solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar los materiales necesarios para seguir fabricando ladrillos y cumplir con algunos pedidos pendientes y con los ingresos que adquiera podrá pagar su crédito y mejorar elnivelde vida de su familia.

Pascual todos los días trabaja muy duro con la finalidad de que sus hijos tengan otras oportunidades académicas y también mejoras económicas.
texts.en:
Pascual is 30 years old.  He lives with his wife and children in his parents' home.  The house only has electricity.  It is located in an urban area of the Guadalupe district, which is located in the state of La Libertad. This area is known for commercial activity, ranching, and agriculture. 

For the past 3 years Pascual has had a business making and selling bricks for home construction.  This activity is very profitable.  In order to continue with this work, he is requesting a loan for 1500 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase materials he needs to make bricks to fill pending cusotmer orders.  With the income he earns he will pay off his loan and improve his family's quality of life. 

Pascual works very hard every day with the purpose of providing his children with academic opportunities and a better economic situation.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make and sell bricks.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es:
El Señor Aurelio es oriundo de la ciudad de Carapeguá tiene 52 años de edad, está casado hace más de  20 años con la Señora Isidra y tienen tres hijos ya mayores de edad.
Desde temprana edad comenzó con la venta de las colchas que el mismo produce junto con su madre, después de 8 años se independizó y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia. El se dedica a la venta de hamacas, frazadas y sábanas artesanales. Lleva los productos a vender por las ciudades aledañas a Carapegua, transportándose en su propia motocicleta. Gracias a este trabajo logró construir una modesta casa para su familia y pudo hacerse de varias comodidades en su hogar. El comenta que todo el sacrificio que hace es por darle a su familia una vida digna y decorosa.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hamacas, frazadas y sábanas puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos y le gustaría cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Aurelio is a native of the city of Carapeguá. He is 52 years old, has been married for more than 20 years to Isidra, and they have three already older children.

From an early age he began to sell bedspreads that he himself produced together with his mother. After 8 years he became independent and began to work on his own. He makes a living selling hammocks, blankets, and handmade sheets. He takes his products to sell in the neighboring cities of Carapeguá, using his own motorcycle as a means of transportation. Thanks to this work he managed to build a modest house for his family and was able to make his home more comfortable. He says that all the sacrifice he makes is to give his family a good, respectable life.

He is requesting the loan to buy hammocks, blankets, and sheets since he has many orders for these products and he would like to fulfill his customers' demands. He is thankful to the Fundación for the opportunity they have given him.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, sheets, and other things for future sales.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is an 18-year-old single man from Ain. He has been working at raising livestock for five years. His family made him start working early because they need extra money for living expenses. 

Mahdi didn't finish his education  and he really feels sad for not doing so because he had a dream to  make come true but he knows all he's got are those loyA. friends.

Mahdi works hard at raising his livestock in clean and healthy surroundings, to  make sure that they will provide him with the best quality of milk to be sold. He sells his goats' milk and meat depending on customers' requests. He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua, in order to built a suitable barn for his livestock and to keep their living place healthy and updated with the best equipment necessary for the winter season.

He hopes to increase his herd through future loans to be requested.

loans.use: To build a suitable barn for his herd.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
El señor Lorenzo esta casado y vive en aldea Las Balitas, Lorenzo desde muy temprana edad se ha dedicado al trabajo de campo, siembra maíz y maicillo para sustento de sus familia, tambien cría cerdos, los engorda y luego los saca a la venta,  y todos los días por la tardes sale a vender leña en su carreta de bueyes a la ciudad de Nacaome, de este rubro que es el mas fuerte, sostiene a su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de leña, en estos momentos la leña esta por escasearse y tiene que estar preparado para comprar y guardarla, ya que su precio se eleva y es muy dificil de comprar. 

Su meta es que su hija se gradué este año de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is married and lives in the village Las Balitas. Since he was very young Lorenzo has worked in the fields, planting corn and millet to support his family. He also bred pigs, raising them and then taking them for sale. Also every day in the afternoon he goes out to sell wood in his oxcart in the city of Nacaome. This is the area that is the strongest in supporting his family. 

He will use the loan to buy wood. Right now wood is scarce and he has to be prepared to buy and save it because the price has gone up and it’s very difficult to buy it. 

His goal is for his daughter to graduate this year.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia con su anterior credikiva compró productos para el aseo  con el cual surtió su punto de ventas, igualmente hace 8 meses lanzó un nuevo negocio de comidas rápidas en el cual le ha ido muy bien, pero necesita adicionarle herramientas de trabajo e inusmos para incrementar sus ventas, por eso con su tercer credikiva, al cual se postula invertirá en la compra de una estufa utensilios de cocuna e insumos y mateias primas para preparación de commidas rápidas. Ella envia a sus financiadores el siguiente mensaje: "Gracias por confiar en mi y brindarme su apoyo con un nuevo préstamo".
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Cecilia bought cleaning products to restock her shop. Eight months ago, she launched a new fast food business and has done very well. However, she needs to buy work equipment and supplies to increase her sales. For this reason she is requesting her third Kiva loan and will invest in the purchase of a stove, cooking utensils, supplies, and ingredients for preparing fast food.

She would like to send Kiva lenders the following message: “Thank you for trusting me and providing your support with this new loan.”

loans.use: to purchase a stove, cooking utensils, supplies, and ingredients for preparing fast food.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 31-year-old married man and a father of two beautiful children. Samer has worked as a bus driver for five years. He is a man with a good reputation. That's why most of the parents request him to transport their children from/to school.

Samer is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner. This is his fourth loan with a perfect history of paying back his earlier loans.  All previous loans reflected perfectly on both his social and financial situations. This loan will be used to do necessary maintenance to his bus, which is an important source of living for him.

Samer also has another business to run just like most of the Lebanese do these days to make their living. He transports water to most of the villages and villagers who suffer from water stinginess.
 
He hopes he can stay healthy and active to continue providing his family the best living he can afford.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to his bus

loans.name: Munhshur

texts.en:
Munhshur is 23 years old and lives with her mother and sister in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her mother works in a health organization and her sister is a college student. 

Munhshur started her garment retail business in 2008 by renting a counter in the market. Her business has been sustainable ever since. Now that winter is arriving, she needs to buy warm clothes to sell. Therefore, Munhshur is requesting a long for 600,000 MNT, wich she will use to buy winter clothing. She is a bright and diligent woman who wants to open a store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase winter garments.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 22 years old and single. For the past two years, he has run a retail shop to earn a living. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business because has received business management training. 

James is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy cooking fat, sugar, salt, and wheat flour. In the future, he hopes to expand his business into wholesale

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, sugar, salt, and wheat flour

loans.name: Luna Group

texts.es:
El grupo Luna esta integrado por diez Mujeres las cuales son muy tarabajadoras y amables, ellas viven en una comunidad que se caracteriza por estar rodeada de arboles de hule y el clima es calido, Esta comunidad la mayoria de sus habitantes hablan el dialecto Nahuatl y han llamado a su grupo luna ya que es el nombre de una hija de un miembro del grupo.

Doña Susana es uno de los integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 45 años, estudio hasta la primaria y es madre soltera de dos hijos el amyor de ellos estudia la carrera y el menor asiste a la preparatoria de su comunidad. 

Doña Susana platica que como es madre soltera siempre ha tenido la necesidad de trabajar para sacar adelante a sus hijos y gracias a dios lo ha logrado trabajando muy duro todos los dias, ella comenta que desde hace 25 años inicio a trabajar en la venta de antojitos mexicanos y refrescos, ella realiza sus ventas todos los dias por la mañana y por la tarde desde su hogar, ella pone unas mesas frente a su casa donde acomoda sus recipientes con los ingredientes para preparar los antojitos y conforme van llegando a comprarle les va preparando para que coman rico y calientito.

DoÑa Susana dice que Gracias a Dios le ha hido bien con sus venta y hace un poco mas de un año a iniciado a vender dulces para ganar un poco mas de dinero.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de variedad de dulces, refrescos, tomates, chiles,  cebolla, frijol, maiz, crema, queso, carne de res y pollo, papas, platanos y huevos para la elaboracion de sus antojitos y posteriormente realizar sus ventas.

Ella dijo"espero que este credito ayude a mejorar mi negocio y pueda pagar una carrera a mis dos hijos y pues gracias Fundacion por el apoyo que brindo a mi y a mis compañeras"

Las demas integrantes del grupo son:
Teofila venta de antojitos mexicanos
Vicenta venta de frutas y legumbres
Maria Francisca venta de dulces
Epifania venta de antojitos
siria papeleria
Maribel venta de antojitos
Azucena venta de pan 
Maria magdalena molino de maiz
Lucia venta de dulces
texts.en:
The group "Luna" is made up of 10 women who are very hard-working and nice.  They live in a community that is known for being surrounded by rubber trees and the climate is warm.  In this community the majority of inhabitants speak the Nahuatl dialect and they have called their group "Luna" or moon since that is the name of the daughter of one member of the group.

Susana is one of the members of this group.  She is 45 years old, studied through elementary school, and is a single mother of two, the oldest of whom is studying in college and the youngest attends high school in the community.

Susana tells us that because she is a single mother she has had to work in order to help her children get ahead.  Thanks to God she has been able to work hard every day.  She comments that for the past 25 years she has been working selling Mexican appetizers and soft drinks.  She makes sales every morning and afternoon from her home.  She puts some tables out in front of her home where she can arrange her containers with ingredients for preparing appetizers and as customers arrive to make purchases she prepares their food so that they can eat tasty and hot snacks.

Susana says that thanks to God her sales have gone well and a little over a year ago she began to sell sweets in order to earn a bit of extra money.

She needs this loan in order to invest in the purchase of a variety of sweets, soft drinks, tomatoes, chiles, onion, beans, corn, creme, cheese, beef and chicken, potatoes, bananas and eggs for making her appetizers and thereby to accomplish her sales.

She said "I hope that this credit will help me to improve my business and so that I can pay for a career for my two children.  Thanks to Kiva and the Fundación for the support that they have given me and my other group members.

The other group members are:
Teofila who sells Mexican appetizers
Vicenta who sells fruits and vegetables
Maria Francisca who sells sweets
Epifania who sells appetizers
Siria who runs a paper shop
Maribel who sells appetizers
Azucena who sells bread
Maria Magdalena who sells ground corn
Lucia who sells sweets

loans.use: to purchase sweets, soft drinks, tomatoes, chiles, onion, beans, corn, creme, cheese, beef and chicken, potatoes, bananas and eggs

loans.name: Horn

texts.en: Horn, 52, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Horn is a farmer and raises animals at home. Horn is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work in the city. By doing so, her family is able to decrease expenses on public transportation. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy irrigation pipes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children. 

Agapita has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Agapita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 32 years old. He is married with 3 children aged 4 and 9 years. 2 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 4 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria de los Angeles is 31 years old and is married with two children. Her husband works in a gas station.

She started her business two years ago because her husband was paying for their house. Angeles is a very dynamic woman and, since she was a child, she learned about selling and doing business. She never thought that her business would be the unique source of income but this happened a year and a half ago when her husband was sick. He had a peritonitis and, for that reason, he was operated on for a colostomy . While living in this situation, she decided to work more tenaciously in her business and designed a new way of selling candies. She creates prizes when she sells to the kids outside of the school and she is well accepted.

Currently, her husband is working but he is probably going to be operated on again. For that reason, Maria de los Angeles wants to supply her business to keep her clients. She is requesting a loan for $ 475 USD to buy merchandise and she hopes to repay in a term of 4-8 months. She would like to get a mobile stand in the future to put outside the school.

**This text has been translated from the original business description**

La señora Maria de los Angeles tiene 31 años de edad y esta casada, tiene 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja en una gasolinera. Hace dos años inicio su negocio pues con el sueldo de su esposo estaban pagando su casa y como ella es una mujer muy dinámica que desde chica aprendió el negocio de las ventas, decidió contribuir al ingreso familiar dedicándose a la venta de dulces en su casa. Nunca pensó que su negocio sería su única fuente de ingresos como sucedió hace un año y medio en que su esposo se enfermó y le dio peritonitis, por lo que le tuvieron que hacer una operación de colostomía que tiempo después le causaría una hernia. Al vivir toda esta situación, decidió dedicarse con mas empeño en su negocio y diseño una nueva forma de vender sus dulces, elaborando premios que vende a los niños afuera de la escuela y que ha tenido una gran aceptación.

En estos momentos su esposo ya esta trabajando pero es muy probable que lo vuelvan a operar, por eso Maria de los Ángeles quiere surtir su negocio para que siga teniendo la misma aceptación, es por eso que solicita un préstamo por $ 475 USD para comprar mercancía y piensa pagarlo en un plazo de 4-8 meses. A ella le gustaría poder contar en un futuro con un puesto portátil para poner a la salida de la escuela.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For Restocking

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch S. is a 56 year old woman living in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. As a widow, S. raises her five children alone making five dollars a day selling groceries. Two of her children contribute to the family's income as moto taxi drivers each making $100 per month. Two other children work in garment factories each making $60 per month. S. plans to use the loan to buy more groceries and expand her store. In the future she hopes to build a new home for her family.

loans.use: To expand grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve the appearance of her store

loans.name: Mele

texts.en: Mele is one of the owners of the Fugalei Flea Market. She sells earrings, bracelets, Samoan necklaces, ladies handbags and picture frames for family pictures. She is a hard working lady of thirty-eight years. Her first loan is nearly paid off and she is now looking forward to getting another loan to further improve her business. She opens six days a week, and her sales vary from $1000-$1500 a week. The net profit after all her expenses is betwen $500-$800 a week. She wants to take advantage of extra revenue that she can genearate from tourists visitng the SPG Games in Samoa.

loans.use: To buy hooks, chains, paints, afa and timber for frames

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
The client works as a Music teacher in Dons Bosco school in the town of La Paz, and he also gives private classes in guitar.

His house is located in Pasankeri zone on the West side of La Paz cuidad, where he lives together with his mother and younger brothers, for whom he is responsible.

This is the fifth time that he has asked for a loan. His credit history shows him to be an excellent client, who has fulfilled his repayment obligations in good faith. The total asked for will be used to pay for his studies for a Diploma in Education. His work allows him to access this loan as he already has experience as a Music professor, which allows him to earn money to cover the loan.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El cliente trabaja como profesor de música en el colegio Don Bosco de la ciudad de La Paz, y también dicta clases particulares de guitarra.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pasankeri de la ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, donde vive junto a su madre y hermanos menores de quienes es responsable.

Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito Su antecedente crediticio lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago se su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para el pago de estudio de diplomado en el área de la pedagogía. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia de profesor de música, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Education

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Maria is an entrepreneurial woman who has worked very hard at the various jobs she learned over the years, especially after her five daughters left home. She maD. the decision to receive training at an agricultural training center in her town, so that she could learn how to begin raising guinea pigs in her small house.

After many years of hard work and dedication, she can now see the fruits of her labor. The number of guinea pigs has increased rapidly and they keep getting bigger and more beautiful. She feeds them alfalfa, which she grows on her land, so that they can receive the best nutrition. She dreams of eventually becoming one of the best guinea pig exporters. To achieve this, she needs to improve her operation. She plans to use a large portion of the land she cultivates to expand the guinea pig business. So that she might begin this project soon, she turns to you for your good-hearted help.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria, es una mujer emprendedora que trabaja diligentemente en los diversos oficios que aprendió con el paso D. los años; después D. que sus cinco bellas hijas se marcharon para forjar su propio futuro. Entonces fue que decidió preparase en un centro D. instrucción agrícola y ganadera D. su ciudad para instalar un criadero D. cuyes en su pequeña casa. Luego D. muchos años D. esfuerzo y dedicación hoy pueD. observar los frutos D. este labor, ya que el número D. cuyes que mantiene en casa se incrementa rápidamente y cada vez son más grandes y hermosos; ella les proporciona la alfalfa que cultiva en los terrenos que posee a fin D. que estos puedan recibir el mejor nutriente.Sueña con ser en un futuro una D. las mejores exportadoras D. cuyes y para ello necesita mejorar su granja y ha pensado utilizar un amplio espacio D. su terreno D. cultivo para implementarla y para que este anhelo se cristalice pronto acuD. en ayuda D. tu bondadoso corazón.

loans.use: To build a new space for raising guinea pigs with the goal of becoming one of the largest and best guinea pig exporters.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana is a beautiful woman who dedicates herself to selling cosmetics. This business, which she began more than two years ago, has quickly brought her and her four beloved children some satisfaction. Every day, she carries around her promotional catalog selling cosmetic products from the prestigious brand Oriflame. Her travel to each of the houses is very tiring for her, as is her return on payment days, since she sells each of her products for the promise to pay every twenty days. Nevertheless, all her tiredness dissipates when she receives pleasing comments and results from each visit. She is the mother of four children, aged 20, 18, 11, and 7 years, and the oldest are her biggest concerns due to their higher educational expenses. But to her, this is the least important since she believes that the best she can do for her children is grant them a profession that they can use to survive. For this reason, she is in the middle of building a shop where she’ll sell seafood in the market of her city. She needs your contributions to make her dreams a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Diana, es una bella mujer que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, negocio que empezó hace más de dos años y el cual le ha otorgado en poco tiempo algunas satisfacciones para ella y sus cuatro queridos hijos.Todos los días carga su catálogo de promoción para ofrecer sus productos cosméticos de la prestigiosa marca Oriflame y su tránsito por cada una de las casas de sus queridas clientas le resulta muy agotador y de igual forma se tornan los día de cobranza, ya que deja cada uno de sus productos con una promesa de pago cada veinte días, sin embargo todo cansancio se diluye cuando obtiene comentarios y resultados satisfactorios en cada visita.Ella es madre de cuatro hijos de 20,18,11 y 7 años de quienes los mayores son su más grande preocupación, debido a los gastos educativos superiores que realizan, pero para Diana es lo menos importante, ya que cree que lo mejor podría hacer ella por ellos es otorgarles una profesión con la cual puedan sobrevivir. Es por esa razón que está en plena construcción de su puesto de ventas de pescado en el mercado de su ciudad.Y requiere de tu contribución para concretar sus ilusiones.

loans.use: Starting up a small stand to sell seafood.

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru:
Safar S. is 51 years old, has secondary education, married and has 4 children. Safar is in breeding and sales of cattle and he has been doing it for the past 20 years. He plans to use the loan to buy a milk cow. By buying a milk cow he expects to get milk for resale and for personal use. Part of the milk will be sold to the locals so he can pay back the loan, and the other part he will keep for himself.

Safar plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шерханов Сафар, возраст – 51 год, образование – среднее, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Сафар занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 20 лет. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести дойную корову. Приобретя дойную корову он планирует получать молоко от коровы для продажи и личного пользования. Часть молока он будет продавать местным жителям для выплаты кредита, а другую часть молока будет использовать в личных целях.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Kireka C2 C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Harriet N.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine. Harriet is 27 years old and is married. She has 2 children aged 2.5 and 5 and one of them goes to school. Each week, Harriet makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save it for her children's education. Harriet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Harriet is joined in her small group by Ruth N., Harriet K., Rebecca N., and Rose N.. Ruth N. has a business running a grocery store and wants to purchase more groceries. Harriet K. is currently operating a canteen business and wants a loan to add to the business. Rebecca N. operates a business of charcoal sales and wants to expand to bulk selling. Rose N. is currently in the business of selling ripe bananas and is requesting a loan to add stock.

loans.use: To expand tailoring business

loans.name: Loida

texts.es:
Day after day, Loida works tirelessly to ensure that her family is secure, which is why she and her husband offer transportation services in their van. She wakes up very early and feeds her three children, taking great care attending to them. By mid-day, she delivers lunch to her husband and, depending on their shifts, she also works as the van driver. She works hard all day, until 10pm, but despite this endless, arduous labor, she works toward the goal of seeing her children overcome each day. Her goal is to hire another driver to increase their earnings, which is why she is now seeking a loan to repair their vehicle so they can increase the number of routes they travel.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Loida, día a día trabaja incesantemente para lograr que los suyos estén seguros, es por ello que junto a su esposo ofrecer el servicio de transporte en un vehículo de transportes, labor para la cual se levanta muy temprano y prepara los alimentos para sus 3 hijos y se esmera por atenderlos para finalizar al medio día y llevar el almuerzo a su esposo, dependiendo de sus turnos ella también colabora como cobradora, el trabajo dura todo el día, hasta las 10 de la noche, a pesar de esta ardua labor que no cesa porque trabaja con la finalidad de ver a sus hijos superándose cada día, su anhelo es obtener otra unidad para incrementar sus ganancias es por ello que ahora solicita un préstamo para reparar su movilidad a fin de acumular mayores espacios recorridos.

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is a single woman with 5 children, ages 3-15 years old. Matilda sells charcoal. She started in 2008. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Hajra's Group

texts.en: Hajra A. R. is a 52 year old widow who resides in the city of Kasur, Pakistan, which is famous for its sweetmeat. She has a two room brick house and she is the mother of four sons. Her first two sons, named Rashid Mahmood and Nasir Mahmood, make decorative embroidery. Hajra's third son, named Talat Mahmood, is a worker in a factory. Talat was educated until 10th standard. The youngest son is a worker in a sugar factory, and he was educated until 8th standard. Hajra is now applying for a loan of $1,350 for her third son, Talat, who wants to start a small restaurant specializing in breakfast and a Punjabi food named Nan Chana.  Hajra has been joined in her loan group by a few more members: Mumtaz wants to buy spare parts for her machines; Mumtaz wants a loan to buy cloth for selling; Naila wants a loan to expand her repairing business; Parveen wants a loan to expand her card business.  This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married and has a little daughter. She owns a business selling food products in a store called “ABC”. Her business is growing fast, and Irina is able to sell large volumes of groceries that are always in demand. Doing her best to succeed in the business, she is now able to make about US$300 of net profit each month. 

Irina started her venture two years ago and, ever since, has been working hard to develop her business. Still, she would like to further increase the efficiency of the business and believes that additional financial assistance will help her in achieving this goal. Irina is therefore asking for a loan which she will use to increase the stock of goods for the current busy summer season.

loans.use: Purchase of a stock of groceries for sale

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza- Group 1

texts.en:
Before I even opened my mouth to say hello to a group of associates the small community of El Rincon, Faustina F. was offering me some mango she was busy peeling before the start of the loan meeting. She is a kind and open 60-yr old lady who started her business six years ago with the help of loans from Esperanza. She is in the business of selling used clothing which she buys with her loans from larger towns and cities such as Samaná and Santo Domingo. She has one daughter who is 43 yrs old and lives in her own place. Mrs. F. is an evangelic Christian whose favorite food is arroz con vaca (rice with beef). She has hopes of seeing her business succeed to construct better living quarters and provide for herself and her husband.

Mrs. Faustina F. is a member of a 5 person group, Group 1, which is part of a larger micro-bank called Luz y Esperanza, "Light and Hope" in English. In the picture, Mrs. F. is second from the left. Her story is just one of a list of men and women who are improving their quality of life through the help of micro-credit loans of Esperanza. Together, this group has united with a common vision of a better life with faith and hope in their hearts and an unbreakable spirit. The concept of group lending is to have loans paid in a group to reduce the risk of a person defaulting, as others pick up where a person may lag to receive the next loan. Each of the associates in this bank has a similar business whether it is a gas station or the sale of clothing. Thank you for your support and awareness of this issue, and it is your concern and efforts that is able to bring a difference to the lives of people such as Mrs. F..

loans.use: This group would like to improve their various businesses like Faustina who would like to improve her clothing business.

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yat S. is a farmer, and also sells fish and vegetables in the town market. Her husband, Mr. Chan Em, is a fisherman. She created a group to get the loan, and is group leader with three members. Yat has three children, all of whom are in school and lives in Vat Tamim Commune, Battambang Province.

The farming business is the main income in her family, so she needs to expand and strengthen it. She now is requesting a loan for rice growing, including farmland plowing expenses, and purchasing seeds.

Her group members are following: Mrs. Mommy M., who is requesting a loan to use for fish, vegetable, and beef selling by bicycle; Mr. Lymin S., who is requesting a loan to purchase fishing tools.

loans.use: For rice growing, including farmland plowing expenses, and purchasing seeds.

loans.name: Denis Gleydi

texts.es:
Denis Gleydi  tiene 23 años, nacida en AgaLLpampa de la provincia de Otuzco,  vive en Manzana B lote 25 Barrio 2 Alto Trujillo La Libertad Perú.
Denis fue becada por círculo Solidario gracias a su buen aprovechamiento escolar y estudió Enfermería  Técnica en el Instituto  San Luis y desea hacer una especialización en la Cruz Roja.
Ella se casó con Máximo Segura y tiene un hijo que aun es muy pequeño razón por la cual no puede seguir estudiando, tiene que trabajar para poder dar comodidad a su pequeño.
Denis se dedica a diversos negocios desde vender ropa, artículos de belleza hasta vender pollo, los compra pequeños, los alimenta y los vende a los 45 días.
El primer préstamo que le brindo Manuela Ramos fue de 300 soles con los que compró ropa para vender nuevamente, luego con las ganancias compró artículos de belleza y algunos pollos.
Con este préstamo de S/ 500 soles comprará comida de pollos para alimentar a más de 70 pollos que tiene actualmente, su préstamo lo devolverá en 4 meses.
Denis tiene un gran sueño aparte de ejercer su profesión, ella desea tener un restaurant  y una pequeña granja.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal Trabajo y Amor del cual a aprendido mucho a disciplinarse con los gastos de su dinero.
texts.en:
Denis Gleydi is 23 years old. She was born in Agallpampa in Otuzco province and currently lives on B block of Neighborhood 2 in Alto Trujillo, La Libertad, Peru.

Denis received a scholarship from the Solidarity Circle thanks to her good grades and studied Technical Nursing in the San Luis Institute. She would like to specialize with the Red Cross, but because she married Máximo Segura and they had a child, she cannot continue her studies. Her child is still very young, so she has to take care of the little one.

Denis is involved in various businesses, from selling clothing and beauty products to selling chickens, which she buys young, feeds, and sells after 45 days. Her first loan from Manuela Ramos was of 300 soles (about US $100), which she used to buy clothing to sell. Then, with the profits, she bought beauty products and some chickens.

With this loan of 500 soles, she will buy chicken feed for the more than 70 chickens she currently owns. She will repay this loan in four months.

Denis has a great dream aside from continuing her current work: she would like to open a restaurant and a small farm. She belongs to the Trabajo y Amor Communal Bank (a group loan), from which she has learned a lot about using discipline when spending money.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens in bulk

loans.name: Emma Patricia

texts.es:
Emma inició el negocio para obtener un ingreso extra que le permitiera progresar económicamente y poder ayudar a su mamá con sus hermanos pequeños. Ella quería contar con un ingreso más de dinero, ya que tuvo que dejar sus estudios de preparatoria para meterse a trabajar y ayudar a su mamá ya que necesitaba mucho el dinero porqué su padre los abandonó y había muchas necesidades en casa. Comenzó en el mes de Septiembre de 2007, vendiendo tortas con su mamá por las noches enfrente de su casa, ya que con una “tanda” de dinero que recibió y con la ayuda de un crédito que le otorgaron pudieron comprar un carrito de tortas para poder ayudarnos y salir adelante, pues ella deseo estudiar una carrera universitaria y seguir ayudando a su mamá y a sus hermanos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de tacos y tortas y unas sillas de plástico en donde la gente pueda sentarse a comer para darles un mejor servicio y mayor comodidad
texts.en:
Emma started the business to obtain an extra income which would allow her to progress economically and to be able to help her Mum out with her younger siblings. She wanted be able to count on another income as she had to leave her studies to start working and help her Mum as she needed the money a lot as her father left them and they had a lot of need at home. She started in September 2007 selling cakes with her Mum by night outside their house, and with a 'batch' of money that she got and with the help of a credit that she was given she was able to buy a cart to sell cakes to be able to move forward. She wishes to study a university degree and to keep helping her mother and siblings.

She needs a loan of $250, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, to buy ingredients to make tacos and cakes and some plastic chairs where people can sit down to eat so they can give their clients a better service and more comfort.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients/comprar materia prima

loans.name: Doris Ortencia

texts.es:
La señora Doris pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Perseverantes ubicado en la Carretera Federico Basadre Mz. N Lt. 02 Km. 6, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 23 años de edad y es madre de una hija menor de edad que aún depende de ella , es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de repuestos para carro. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio. Tiene el apoyo de su esposo y se dedica tanto a su hogar como a su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará 4/4 de rodajes, 6/4 de amortiguadores, una docena de celiconas, etc.

Doris se siente realizada como mujer y como madre porque ha logrado estabilizar su negocio para el beneficio de su menor hija.
texts.en:
Señora Doris belongs to the Persistent Women Communal Bank located at Lot 2 Km 6 of Federico Basadre Highway N, district of Callería, Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 23 years old and is a mother of an under-age daughter that still depends on her. She is married and her husband is independent in her work. With the first loan that she received of Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she decided to invest in the sale of replacement parts for cars. She has been working with the communal bank for 2 years. Currently she relies on the same business. She has the support of her husband and is dedicated as much to her home as to her business. With this loan of 1,300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 4 sets of rotors, 6 sets of shocks, a dozen tires, etc. Doris feels fulfilled as a woman and a mother because she has managed to stabilize her business for the benefit of her small daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy car parts such as rotors, shocks and tires for resale

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Đoan năm nay 42 tuổi,. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Hiện nay ngoài chăn nuôi chị Đoan còn kinh doanh thêm các mặt hàng tạp hoá.Chồng chị hiện đang làm công nhân tại nước ngoài. Hàng tháng chị đều nhận được sự hỗ trợ của chồng  nên thu nhập của gia đình  rất ổn định, việc hoàn trả vốn vay cũng rất thuận lợi.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 đ để đầu tư mua thêm một số mặt hàng bia, bánh kẹo… để phục vụ cho nhu cầu của ngưòi dân địa phương trong dịp Tết.
texts.en:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Đoan is 42 years old. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2007. Currently, in addition to raising animals, Đoan also has a small grocery shop. Her husband is now working as a labourer in a foreign country. Each month, she receives a regular remittance from her husband, so the income of the family is very stable, thus assuring her ability to repay the loan. In the next lending cycle, she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in her grocery by buying beer, candy, etc., in order to meet the demands of her local community during the Tet holiday (lunar new year).

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her grocery

loans.name: Chadulu 1 Group

texts.en:
Eliza is a clothes seller in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma. She currently earns an average monthly profit of 95 USD. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Eliza is 23 years old, single, and has two children aged two and five. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Rehema, Pendo,and Vumilia. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy K. is 38 years old. She is married with one boy, who is currently in senior high school. She is a hardworking woman who sells charcoal in her neighborhood. She has been in the charcoal business for the past 5 years. She travels to Edwura in the Ashanti region to buy her charcoal, which is about 400 kilometers from where she lives with her family. She is requesting a loan to buy charcoal to supply nearby restaurant operators, which she believes will give her additional income so she can support her husband to take care of the home. Mercy says her dream is that her family will own a house of their own.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Anafe

texts.en:
Anafe R., 30, and her husband Mr. Felecito R., who is a fisherman, are blessed with three children. They live in Pta. Miray, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. Anafe became a member of PDP-LP (the Micro- finance program of Paglaum MPC) on August 27, 2004. She is a very hardworking person who started her own small business to generate additional income for her family. She says "if we only depend on the income of my husband from fishing, it is not enough to support our daily needs.”  She bakes "pan Bisaya," a native bread that is cooked in a Hornohan (a clay oven that uses firewood for cooking). 

Anafe has taken out loans to purchase ingredients for her bread-making business. With her profits, she purchased an unfinished fishing boat. Now Anafe is requesting her eighth loan. She is requesting PHP 5,000.00 to purchase materials and paints to finish her fishing boat.

Anafe is grateful that she became a member of Paglaum because Paglaum's  financial services and low interest rates have helped her a lot. Her future plan is to acquire a motor for her fishing boat to help increase their income. Her ambitions in life are to have a decent home for her family and to see her three children graduate from college.

loans.use: To finish her boat

loans.name: Kwami

texts.fr: A. kwami est  un monsieur qui habite le quartier d’adidogomé, il tient un cafétariat non loin de la rue qui passe à côté de l’église de Zion tio, il souhaite mieux exploiter son cafétariat et demande à wages un prêt, son activité marche bien, il a une clientèle considérable surtout les jeunes célibataires de son quartier.il est divorcée de sa femme et les deux (02) enfants qu’ils ont eu sont à sa seule charge.
texts.en:
A. Kwami is a gentleman who lives in the Adidogomé district. He has a cafeteria not far from the street that goes right by the church of Zion Tio. He would like to get more out of his cafeteria and is asking WAGES for a loan. Business is good. He has a considerable customer base, especially among the young unmarried people in his area. He is divorced from his wife, and he alone supports the two children they had.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the necessary goods for his cafeteria

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela G. tiene ya mas de 1 año con su negocio de venta de comidas preparadas y venta de dulces, esté es el ingreso de su familia. 
El negocio esta ubicado en una colonia muy poblada, pero esta muy retirada de su domicilio y el vehiculo que tienen para trasportarse y llevar la mercancía el lugar de venta. Esta en malas condiciones, y no cuentan con el capital necesario para repararlo. Portal motivo están solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar la reparación de vehiculo.
texts.en:
Gabriela G. has more than one year's experience with her business selling prepared food and desserts. This provides income for her family. This business is located in a well populated area but it is far from her home and the car that she uses for transportation and to carry merchandise to their place of sale is in bad condition and she does not have the necessary money to repair it. The main reason for requesting this loan is to be able to pay for car maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair a car for the business.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es: El comité “Primavera” cumple actualmente su 3er ciclo del programa D. Mujeres Emprendadoras D. Fundacion Paraguaya. Sus integrantes ya realizan una actividad productiva, por lo que ya se desenvuelven cada una en su propia microempresa.  Reciben un crédito promedio D. 500.000 y lo utilizan para  fomentar y variar la actividad que ya estan realizando como ser:  compra D. insumos para la fabricacion D. comestibles, compra D. leche azucar, yerba, harina, sal, panificados y verduras para su posterior venta, compra y venta D. bebidas como refrescos, gaseosas , cervezas, vinos cumpliendo asi con el compromiso D. crecer y cambiar su forma D. vida.
texts.en:
The committee "Primavera" (spring) has currently completed its third cycle with the progam Mujeres Emprendadors D. Fundacion Parguaya (Entrepreneurial Women of the Paraguay Foundation). Its members realize productive activity, as each has developed in her own micro-finance business. They receive average loans of 500.00 and use them to encourage and vary the activities that they are involved in. They incluD. buying of groceries to prepare artisanal foods; buying milk, sugar, herbs, oatmeal, salt, rolls, and vegetables for sale; the buying and selling of drinks like refreshments, sodas, beers and wines. They are committed to growth and to changing their lifestyles.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for special events, artisanal jewelry, milk, sugar, vegetables and fruits, wine, oil, and corn. To make and sell artisanal foods like sausage, blood-sausage, tortillas, empanadas, croquettes, etc.

loans.name: Mut

texts.en: Mut T., 41, is married and lives with her young child and husband in the Takeo province. She makes and sells baskets and earns US$5 every day, while her husband works as a rice farmer and sells rice in the market and earns around US$13 every day. Mut T. approached CREDIT to request a loan of US$1200 for her husband to purchase rice in bulk for a special discount. She sees this as a way to increase their daily income.

loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk

loans.name: Carlos Francisco

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Masaya, el señor Carlos Francisco L. se dedica con gran empeño a su actividad de zapatería donde tiene su propio negocio el cual ha logrado mantener desde hace 10 años siendo este su única actividad que le ha permitido mantener a su familia.

El señor Carlos L. actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de trabajo ya que le urge adquirirlo para así continuar con su trabajo de reparación de zapatos para todas las edades y para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Carlos Franciso L. has his own business in the city of Masaya. He works very hard as a cobbler, and has had the business for ten years. It is the only activity that has allowed him to support his family. He currently has approached Ceprodel for a loan to buy work materials. He needs the loan urgently to be able to continue his shoe repair work. He repairs shoes for all ages, women, men, and children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy work materials

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Ni ketut Suci Ariani -  is a 29 year-old female living in the town of Tukadaya. Ni ketut Suci Ariani is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by DINARI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Segara Mandala (DNR.M-0695).
Jocelyn G. is from the town of Gimaylan, Libertad Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
