Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Dhalia

texts.en:
Dhalia is a hardworking mother. She sacrifices a lot for the welfare of her family. She used to venture in different businesses to help her husband improve their poor living conditions. She thinks positively and works out the things that are good in the eyes of the people around her. 

Dhalia now manages a vegetable vending stall in their house. Aside from vegetables, she is also raising a backyard piggery. To further improve her business, Dhalia is requesting a from Kiva lenders of PHP18,000. She is now 52 years old and has seven children. Three of them are now married and some are still currently attending school. Her husband is a local farmer in their place. She hopes someday that her business will become successful for the progress of their daily living.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Selling grocery items is part of 35-year-old Mom P.’s daily routine. She runs her business very well and gains much income through selling her goods, items like cakes, candies, cooking ingredients, and some canned goods. In addition, her husband works driving a trailer-motor taxi.

This modest couple is responsible for three school-aged children who are living at home. Mom P. has sold her wares from her stock supply and she hopes to be able to replenish her other items by using a Kiva loan to buy additional grocery inventory for resale. Note: In the picture is Mom P.'s husband.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery inventory for sale

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua.
Felipa es casada, tiene 39 años, Felipa viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende verduras y de las ferias compra quesos, animales menores que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho, además Felipa teje chompas que vende en las ferias.
Felipa necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras y lana.
Los sueños de Felipa son mejorar su negocio y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Felipa is a member of the Communal Bank Kusikuy, which means “rejoice” in Quecha. She is 39 years old and married. Felipa travels to different markets in the region to sell vegetables. While at the markets, she buys cheese and small animals so that she can sell them in Ayacucho. She also produces woven sweaters to sell in the markets.

Felipa needs a loan of 900 soles to buy vegetables and wool. She dreams of expanding and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables & wool

loans.name: Anem

texts.fr: Cet homme pour couvrir les besoins de sa famille s'est lancée l'année dernière dans la publication de presse écrite, parce que c'est un secteur de plus en plus rentable. Actuellement il vient de signer un accord avec deux nouvelles agences qui viennent de faire leur entrée sur le marché de la presse écrite privée à Lomé. Pour cela, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter une nouvelle imprimante Laser couleur A3 pour satisfaire sa demande de plus en croissante. Ce monsieur est marié et a 03 enfants à sa charge. Il exerce son activité à Lomé.
texts.en:
To meet the needs of his family, this man got started in publishing last year because it's a sector growing in profitability. He just signed an agreement with two new agencies, which just made their entry into the private publishing market in Lomé (the capital of Togo).  Thus, he's requesting a WAGES loan to buy a new A3 laser color printer in order to satisfy the growing need.  This gentleman is married and has three children to support.  He operates his business in Lomé .

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a laser printer

loans.name: Mission 7 Namutosi Lydia Group

texts.en: N. Lydia is representing her group. She is twenty years old and a business lady, married with one daughter and she is looking after three dependents who are schooling. She operates a grocery business dealing with fresh foods and vegetables. She is using the loan to purchase fresh foods and vegetables such as bananas, tomatoes, cabbages, among others for sale. She hopes to obtain many things out of her business and also buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase fresh foods and vegetables such as bananas, tomatoes, cabbages, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 28-year-old married man with 3 children. He has been working in the construction sector since 2007. Today, Ali is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to buy a car to facilitate his work and be able to satisfy the demand of the market.

loans.use: buy a car

loans.name: Silvia Liliana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Yanbal se formo en la ciudad de Cuenca, es una ciudad que encierra mucho de la era colonial y moderna donde además podemos disfrutar de paisajes que resaltan su belleza andina tìpica del clima frió, su gente es  muy cálida y carismática como las socias que conforman  este banco que son un grupo de mujeres dispuestas a superarse día a día y salir adelante con sus familias y nunca ser derrotadas con los obstáculos que la vida les presenta.

La señora Silvia Liliana R. P. vive por la parroquia Ricaurte sector Santa Rosa a unos 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 35 años de edad está casada y tiene dos hijos de 16 y  15 años,  su esposo trabaja como comerciante y es su  mayor apoyo en el hogar, aun no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa arrendada. 

Silvia vende comidas en las ferias  de Azogues y Cañar todos los fines de semana, lleva siete años trabajando en este negocio lo que le permite tener su clientela fija, además cuenta con un pequeño puesto de venta de calzado y ropa.

Este es su cuarto ciclo trabajando con el banco comunal y nos comenta que los préstamos recibidos ha invertido en la compra de  mercadería y productos básicos para sus dos negocios y el crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR  le entregue no va a ser la excepción pues va a invertir en la compra de zapatos y ropa para damas, caballeros y niños para seguir ampliando su negocio y tener un sotck suficiente para la época navideña.

Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The Yanbal Communal Bank formed in the city of Cuenca. It is a city that encompasses much from the colonial and modern eras. We are also able to enjoy its Andean beauty, which is typical of the cold climate. The people are very warm and charismatic like the members who comprise this bank. They are a group of women given to improving themselves day to day and to getting ahead with their families. They are never defeated by life’s obstacles. Silvia Liliana R. P. lives in the Ricuarte parrish in the Santa Rosa sector. It is 30 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. She is 35, married, and she has two children who are 16 and 15. Her husband works as a businessman, and he is her biggest support in the household. They do not yet have their own home, so they live in a rented house. Silvia sells food every week-end in the Azogues and Cañar fairs. She has been working in this business for seven years. It has allowed her to have regular customers. She also has a small stand where she sells footwear and clothing. This is her fourth cycle working with the communal bank. She tells us that she used the loans she has received to buy merchandise and basic products for her two businesses. This loan from the ESPOIR Foundation will not be the exception. She will buy shoes and clothing for women, men, and children in order to keep expanding her business and to have sufficient stock for the Christmas season. Her greatest dream is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes and clothing for women, men, and children to increase her business

loans.name: Zahera Group

texts.en:
This is the Zahera loan group. This group has two members, Zahera and Aziza, and Zahera is the group leader. 

Zahera lives with seven family members.She wants a loan for her husband who has a general store. Zahera's husband wants to buy all the things he needs for his general store. The store is the only source of income for Zahera's family of seven. Aziza wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

Zahera and Aziza thank AFS and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es:
La socia María, pertenece al banco “ALLIN MUJU”; este banco se encuentra en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Huanchac.

Nuestra socia tiene 35 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 5 hijos, nuestra socia alterna sus diversas actividades del hogar con el comercio, la socia cada sábado muy temprano por la mañana lleva una serie de artículos reciclados por ella durante toda la semana el mercado de pulgas llamado baratillo, ella lleva desde clavos pequeños, hasta alfombras, cubiertos libros, y todo lo que pueda vender como repuesto de algún artefacto o simplemente como objeto de segunda mano o segundo uso, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de algunos materiales de hierro o plástico para revenderlos.

Ella hace esto desde hace  20 años.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner, Maria, belongs to the bank "ALLIN MUJU", located in the city of Cusco in the district of Huanchac. She is 35 years old, married, and has 5 children. She alternates her various household chores with her business. Every Saturday, very early in the morning, she takes a variety of items that she has recycled throughout the week to a flea market called Baratillo. She takes everything from small pins to rugs, books, and anything she can sell as a spare for something, or simply as a second-hand object. Our partner is requesting the loan to be able to invest in the purchase of some iron and plastic materials to then resell them. She has been doing this for 20 years. She is grateful for and values the loan granted to her through this medium, and likewise is committed to fulfill her payments in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase iron and plastic materials for sale

loans.name: Kelly

texts.en:
Kelly truly has the mindset of an entrepreneur. When her daughter was born, she was inspired to use her talent for sewing to make unique clothes and accessories for her rather than buy them. Soon after, her children's clothing business took off, and she was selling and sharing her handmade items with others. Kelly draws her inspiration from her daughter, who models most of her designs, and she is also helped by her supportive husband, who from time to time helps her with various sewing tasks.

Kelly always feels successful when she receives emails from her customers thanking her for her work, and telling her how much their children love the outfits. She is always striving to offer new designs and meeting the ever-changing needs of her customers. She will use her loan from ACCION USA to purchase additional machines for making her items, fabric and t-shirt inventory, embroidery designs, and marketing. This is Kelly's first time obtaining a loan for her business - in the past, she had always used funds from previous sales to buy supplies, but was always just breaking even.

In the future, Kelly hopes her company will be able to produce all of her customer's needs, like accessories, bags, and even shoes, becoming a "one-stop shop." She would also like to eventually hire an employee to assist her in production.

loans.use: Sewing machines, fabric, t-shirts, embroidery, and marketing

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a member of LAPO microfinance. She runs a sewing service and also sells drinks. She is 24 years old, single and hopes to become a high class fashion designer and to have a comfortable home in the future. She is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sewing materials and more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma tiene 51 años de edad, está casada, tiene 9 hijos, seis de ellos varones y  tres mujeres. Dos de sus hijos se encuentran en España y la ayudan con  la manutención del hogar mientras que ella se dedica a la venta de leche que le producen sus 3 vacas lecheras. 

Sus clientes son dueños de despensas de la zona y particulares, el préstamo que solicita en esta ocasión es para la compra de una vaca holanda el cual le producirá mayor cantidad de leche, con eso la señora busca aumentar sus ingresos y lograr mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

La señora Irma es cliente de la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2.008, demostrando ser muy responsable en el pago de sus cuotas en el crédito anterior cancelado.
texts.en:
51-year old Señora Irma is married and has nine children, six boys and three girls. Two of them now live in Spain and help her financially with household expenses. Irma sells milk which she gets from her three cows. Her customers are owners of local corner stores or private individuals. The loan she is asking for is to buy a Holland cow which produces the greatest quantity of milk. In this way Irma is looking to increase her income so she can improve her own and her family’s lives. Irma has been a client of the Paraguay Foundation since 2008, and she demonstrated responsibility in the repayment of her previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Maluay De Curiquingue (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
La señora  María O. es socia del banco comunal Maluay este banco esta formado por mujeres emprendedoras que buscan día a día la superación personal y familiar, el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Maluay a  unos 30 minutos a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca donde la mayoría de su población se dedica al cultivo de maíz, fréjol y papas.

María se encuentra casada y ha procreado dos  hijos que se encuentran de 10 y 7 años actualmente están cursando la educación primaria en una escuela de la comunidad, su esposo trabaja elaborando estucos (cielos rasos para tumbados de casa), con su esfuerzo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia

A más de los quehaceres del hogar  María se dedica a la cría de  pollos y chanchos, esta actividad realiza desde que era pequeña y lo  aprendió de su familia. Sus animales los comercializa a los negociantes que van a su comunidad y con la venta de éstos aporta económicamente y ayuda a su esposo en la atención del hogar.

Este es su primer crédito en la fundación y se entero de los beneficios que ofrece la  institución por su sobrina;  con el crédito que reciba va a comprar pollos, maíz, y vitaminas para su crecimiento y sacar adelante su pollería.

Su mayor sueño es darles el mejor estudio a sus hijos y verlos convertidos en buenos profesionales. 

María C. es  otra socia del banco comunal Curiquinge tiene una gran amistad con todas sus compañeras del banco, tiene 56 años, casada y madre de seis hijos, cinco de ellos adultos que formaron sus propias familias, ella vive en la comunidad Conchan de Milagros con su hija de 15 años y su esposo que  trabaja en el arte de la construcción y gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo han logrado construir su casa propia.

 Este es su primer crédito y  con el espera comprar arroz, azúcar, café, aceite, jabón, caramelos, pan, colas, etc. para abastecer su pequeña tienda en la que atiende desde las 06H00 a 21H00 todos los días, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas que las vende cuando tiene algún apuro económico.

Su sueño es que su hija siga estudiando hasta que logre su titulo profesional.
texts.en:
Sra. María O. is a member of the Maluay Communal Bank, which was formed by a group of enterprising women who try every day to improve themselves and their families. The bank is located in the community of Maluay, which is about 30 minutes away from the city of Cuenca. The majority of the residents grow corn, beans, and potatoes.

María is married and has two children, ages 10 and 7, who attend elementary school in her community. Her husband prepares stucco used on the ceilings of houses. With great effort, María and her husband built their own home.

In addition to her household chores, María raises chickens and pigs. Her family taught her this skill when she was a young girl. The animals are sold to traders who pass through her community. The sale of these animals provides financial support and helps her husband focus on their home.

This is her first loan from the Foundation. She learned about the benefits offered by the Institution from her niece. With this loan, she will purchase chickens, corn, and vitamins for the growth and success of her chicken farm. Her greatest dream is to provide her children with the best education and see them become outstanding professionals.

María C. is another member of the Maluay Communal Bank. She has established good friendships with all of the other members. She is 56 years old, married, and the mother of six children, five of whom are grown and have their own families. María lives in the community of Conchan de Milagros with her husband and 15 year old daughter. Her husband is a construction worker. Thanks to their efforts, María and her husband were able to build their own house.

This is her first loan and she plans to buy rice, sugar, coffee, oil, soap, caramels, bread, colas, and other products in order to restock her small store, which is open every day from 6am to 9pm. In addition, she raises chickens to sell whenever she faces financial difficulty. Her dream is for her daughter to continue her studies until she is able to earn a professional degree.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Timon

texts.en: Timon D. is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 42 years old. Timon is single. To make a living, Timon operates a family member's business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing space rental services to local community members. Timon has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Timon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Timon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating the business. Timon is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Timon from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es:
La señora Lizeth G. tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la venta de ropa y zapatos.   
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía y de temporada de verano ya que sus clientes le están pidiendo que tenga ya se tipo de ropa. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder surtir de mercancía y así complacer a sus clientes.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que del negocio ya que los gastos familiares los cubrirá con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como encargada de una lavandería.
texts.en:
Lizeth G. has sold clothes and shoes for more than three years now. The business needs more variety of merchandise for summer because her customers are asking her to have that type of clothing available. She is asking for funds to stock up on merchandise so that she can please her customers. She plans to repay the loan with profits from the business since family expenses are covered by her salary as a laundry attendant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Sed

texts.es:
Sed es socio del Banco Comunal Las Margaritas.
Sed es soltero, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Sed estudia reparación de maquinaria pesada, tiene un mototaxi con el cual realiza transporte publico en la ciudad.
Sed necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la reparación de su mototaxi.
Los sueños de Sed son mejorar la calidad de vida y ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
Sed is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Margaritas”. He is 22 years old, single, and has one child. Sed studied heavy machinery repair and owns a motorcycle taxi with which he provides transportation services within the city.

He needs a loan of 1000 PEN to invest in repairs to his motorcycle taxi. Sed dreams of improving his quality of life and exercising his profession.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for repairs to his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase equipment for carrying milk e.g., buckets

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 48-year-old married lady who lives in the Wanyee Road area. She operates a primary school in the area, which has a high population of low-income earners. Her school has been in operation for the last three years. Her school serves children from Wanyee Rd, Dagoretti and its environs.

She had never borrowed from any other financial institution before joining Kadet. She has applied for a loan, which she plans to use to buy office furniture and stationery for use by her staff (the teachers).

In the future, she hopes to complete building the school up to class eight level. Currently, it’s up to class two and she wants to build more classes with time.

loans.use: To buy office furniture for Ksh 10,000, and stationery for Kshs 10,000

loans.name: Jayanthi

texts.en:
Jayanthi is a 27-year-old married woman who lives in Kekanadura, part of the Matara area of Sri Lanka. She has two children, a son and a daughter who are both still in school.

Five months ago, Jayanthi started a business making coconut oil. She buys coconuts from wholesalers, dries them, brings them to a mill and then prepares the coconut oil. She earns respectable profits from this business.

Jayanthi has asked for a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri lanka to purchase coconuts for her business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy coconuts

loans.name: Antolina

texts.es: Antolina tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo Edgar de 44 años de edad, y sus hijos, Edgar de14 años y Gabriel de 11 años.  Juntos viven en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica, es la venta de productos de primera necesidad, es por ello que posee una bodega dentro de su domicilio, pues siempre había pensado tener un negocio propio que ella misma pudiera administrar. Lleva 3 años trabajando de esa manera y le ha ido muy bien, siempre procura implementar de varios productos su establecimiento, ganando así la atención y preferencia de la clientela. Antolina se siente contenta con lo que hace, de esa manera es más independiente además que complace con las necesidades de sus hijos, ya que aún están en edad escolar. En un futuro quiere seguir mejorando su negocio abasteciéndolo de productos más variados con el fin de satisfacer a su clientela. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, por lo que seguirá siendo muy puntual con todos los pagos de las cuotas. El crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Antolina is 53 years old. She lives with Edgar, her forty-four-year-old husband, and her two children Edgar and Gabriel, who are 14 and 11 years old, respectively. They live in their own home. She has a grocery store in her home, from which she sells basic necessities. She had always thought of having and managing her own business. She has been managing the store successfully for 3 years. Because she offers a wide variety of products, she has obtained many customers. Antolina is content with her work; she is more independent and is also able to meet the needs of her school-age children. In the future, she wants to continue improving her business and to offer a greater variety of products, with the goal of pleasing her customers. This is her seventh loan from Microfinanzas Prisma (local lending institution), and she will continue to make timely loan payments. This loan will be invested in a larger quantity of products and will therefore increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of products for her grocery store

loans.name: Women Of Vision Group

texts.en:
Vagula M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Women Of Vision. She is 45 years old, married and has four children. She was not able to attend school due to financial difficulties. Two of her children are in school.

For 10 years, she has been selling potato greens and charcoal at the Pipeline in Paynesville Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. 

She plans to use her 7,000-Liberian-Dollar portion of this 35,000-Liberian-Dollar group loan to buy more potato greens and more bags of charcoal. Her hope is to empower her children for a brighter future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Korpo is inset at lower right because she was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more potato greens and more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina L., from the village of Kiwalan Iligan City, is 40 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP for the same purpose. Gina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly L. is from the town of Trento. She is 30 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Nelly owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nelly has been engaged in her business for over 15 years.
Nelly joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nelly is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be her third from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI
Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina C. is a 49-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: tricycle and fish-vending businesses. She lives in Blk. 9, Sta. Cruz Heights, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. Marina has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her tricycle and fish vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income income of 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Marina is borrowing 13,000 PHP so she can repair her house and pay off the remaining balance on the tricycle she purchased. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 11,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Marina hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For house repair and additional working capital

loans.name: Norman Isaac

texts.es: El  Sr. Norman Isaac R. S.   él es Trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur  desempeñándose como Ayudante de Mecánica tiene  un año de trabajar para esta empresa. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Norman Isaac R. S. works in the San Rafael del Sur city hall as a mechanics assistant. He has been working for the city hall for one year. He has had two loans with CEPRODEL and has used them to purchase construction materials to improve the house in which he lives. These loans have benefited him in a great way, since as a result he has improved his living condition and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: sand, cement, stone, and gravel

loans.name: And Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité AND LIGGEY est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Ces femmes se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage. 

Madame SIGAMA C., debout à droite sur la photo, avec une écharpe orange et portant de lunettes, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 65 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de huit enfants. Elle a aussi sous elle la responsabilité de ses 04 belles filles car ses enfants n’ont pas encore de travail fixe. 

Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, elle achète des bêtes les engraisse pendant au moins 05 mois avant de les revendre. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 25 ans. Elle est soutenue par ses enfants dans l'activité.

Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et soutenir ses belles filles dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
The solidarity group And Liggey was created on December 4, 2007. It is made up of 10 women who are all from the same neighborhood. These women know each other through friendship and neighborly relations. Mrs. Sigama C., standing on the right in the photo, wearing an orange scarf and glasses, is the group's leader. She is 65 years old. She is a widow and has 8 children. She is also in charge of her 4 granddaughters because her children don't have steady jobs yet. She fattens cattle, she buys them and fattens them for at least 5 months before reselling them. She has been doing this for more than 25 years. Her children help her with her work. Her goal is to take care of her personal needs and support her granddaughters. Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et soutenir ses belles filles dans les charges familiales.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth G. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Talakag, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Maribeth is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Maribeth owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling silver hand made jewelry in the local community. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maribeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth is requesting a  loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Maribeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Felina

texts.en: Felena Bredan is 62 years old an a  member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. – a microfinance partner of Kiva in the Philippines. Felena’s dream is to have a nice, comfortable house with rooms she can rent out to boarders. While still young, she decided to remain single so that she could support her family. She uses the profits she earns from renting rooms to help her brothers, sisters and other member of her family. She also saves some money to pay her health expenses. She is applying for a loan for 25,000 PHP to use to buy materials and pay workers to expand and renovate her house. Her goal is to make her home more inviting to boarders, especially students who go to nearby schools. She hopes and prays that ASHI and KIVA will help her reach her dreams in life.

loans.use: To improve and expand her boarding house

loans.name: Asinath

texts.en:
N. Asinath is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kabwohe in the Mbarara region of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children.  Both of her children are currently in school.  Asinath has a business of a retail shop, which she has had for 6 years.         

To help expand her business, Asinath has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar and soap.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Asinath hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Asinath hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: sugar and soap

loans.name: Emelina

texts.en:
Emelina F. is 57 years old and resides in Cardona which is located in the Province of Rizal. She lives with her husband and their two adult children. Emelina has a store in her house where she sells basic necessities and all types of products that people use in their homes. She also owns and operates sewing business as her second venture for additional profit making. With that, she has been able to provide other basic needs, allowing them to enjoy life in a simple way.

Over almost 12 years of being an ASHI member, Emelina has shown herself to be working hard to make her dreams come true and hoping that her businesses will continue to be more productive and improve the overall living conditions of her entire family. Knowing that she can access secured financial support through loans has also given her courage and faith that someday, her two children will have a good life and be ready to face their own lives.

Now, Emelina is requesting a loan so that she can have the funds needed to buy more food products and basic household necessities. The remaining funds will be used to support her second venture, her sewing business. This will allow her to attract more customers and increase her sales. She believes this opportunity will give her the confidence to succeed. The financial opportunity of her sari-sari (variety) store and sewing business is one of the best ways to help provide for her family, and she very much wants to lift her family out of poverty. 

Emelina gave her best to develop her two business and hopes if possible, to have a full-fledged mini-grocery store and tailoring shop in the local area someday, so that she can provide employment to others who want to get ahead. The sacrifices that she has encountered are her weapon and inspiration to fight against poverty. 

Her family is grateful to ASHI and Kiva for allowing room for improvements. They love what they do in making their business achievements. The couple’s biggest dreams are providing the best for their family and having a happy family, allowing them an experience full of blessings.

loans.use: To buy more food products and basic household necessities

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Julio Cesar; el tiene 25 años de edad y es soltero; el socio se dedica a trabajar como ingeniero químico, el es propietario de una empresa de producción de productos lácteos y néctares y después lo distribuye a diferentes lugares, el socio quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para la producción de leche, queso y mantequilla y de los néctares.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar belongs to the “Mosoc Runa” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Julio Cesar is 25 years old and is single.  He works as a chemical engineer and owns a business producing dairy products and nectars which he distributes to different places.  He would like to improve and expand his business.  He is requesting this loan to buy materials for producing milk, cheese, butter and nectars.

He is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials for producing milk, cheese, butter and nectars

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Esta es la primera renovación del credikiva que hizo Rosalba y está muy satisfecha porque pudo  hacer todo lo planeado : a pesar de 20 años trabajando con la mercancía es la primera vez que tiene un lugar fijo, ya que antes vendía de puerta en puerta o directamente en las viviendas de sus clientes. Ahora para surtir su vitrinas con motivos de las festividades que mas repuntan sus ventas en el fin de año, ella está planeando comprar mercancias como ropa, calzado, fantasia para vender a sus clientes y ganar mas dinero. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Rosalba ingrese al sguiente enlace: 
http://kiva.org/lend/163633
texts.en:
This is Rosalba's first renewal of her Kiva loan, and she is very satisfied because she could do everything she had planned.  Despite 20 years working with the merchandise, this is the first time she has had a settled place.  She used to sell door to door or in her customers' homes.

Now, to stock her display cases with holiday items that make her sales go up at the end of year, Rosalba is planning to buy merchandise like clothing, shoes and costume jewelry to sell to her customers and earn more money.  If you want to know Rosalba's story, click on the following link:
http://kiva.org/lend/163633

loans.use: Buy clothing, shoes, costume jewelry to sell to her customers and earn more money

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 21 years old. He lives with four family members.

In 2008, Zaid opened his own workshop where he manufactures metal water tanks. His becoming well-known in his local community and has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $1200 loan to buy two specialized machines for his business. His goal is to produce more water tanks and expand into making new products so he will be able to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: Buy two specialized machines

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en: Jargalsaihan D. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in their own house and fence. His three children attend a local secondary school and his wife works as an assistant in the local dentist office. Jargalsaihan operates a meat and raw material trading business in his town. He started his own business in 2008 after working under raw materials traders for two years. He usually purchases his raw materials from a neighbor city, which makes his transportation costs high. Therefore, he plans to buy a new mini truck for his business in the future. Jargalsaihan is a hardworking, modest and optimistic person. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to buy more livestock skins and wool as well as meats from herders for his meat and raw material trading business.

loans.use: To buy more livestock skins and meat from herders

loans.name: Jovelita

texts.en:
Jovelita B. is from the village of San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 36 years old. Jovelita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jovelita owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business is the sale of daily use products such as sugar, canned goods, pancit, meki, behon, instant noodles, milk, milo, soft-drinks, shampoo, soap, & toothpaste in the local community. Jovelita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jovelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jovelita is now requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Jovelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business.

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema M. K. is 30 years old. She is married to a hotelier and has two children, aged 4 and 11 years. Her business is located at Magongo estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well-known for its many many tourist-attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. 

She has been selling fruits and vegetables for the last two years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is there are so many people doing the same kind of business as hers in the area and so customers are spoiled for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more fruits and vegetables to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and stock cereals as a wholesaler in the future. She also hopes to give her children a quality education. She describes herself as customer-friendly.

loans.use: Fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Marline

texts.fr:
Marline M. est une jeune cliente de HOPE Congo. Cliente de 36 ans, célibataire avec 3 enfants a sa charge dont l’âge varie entre 3 et 21 ans.
En 2002 elle se lance dans la vente des tissus.
A l’octroi de son premier prêt elle avait acheté des tissus comme, des rouleaux de popelines pour tenues scolaires,   soies, du coton piqué , des dentelles et des tissus pour homme comme le tergal, super 100 et super 200.
Ayant  rembourse avec succès et réalisé des épargnes énormes, avec ce deuxième prêt elle renforcer le stock de sa marchandise. 
Très entreprenante, elle tient à ouvrir un magasin des tissus.
texts.en:
Marline M. is a young client of Hope Congo. She is 36 years old, unmarried with three children to care for, whose ages range between 3 and 21. In 2002, she began retailing fabric.

As soon as she was granted her first loan she bought batches of poplin in different colors for grade school uniforms, silk, flowered cotton satin, cotton piqué, and fabric for men’s clothing such as tergal, Super 10 and Super 200.

Having fully repaid her loan and made some significant savings, she hopes with this second loan to purchase more stock.

An ambitious woman, she hopes to open a fabric store in the future.

loans.use: Buy clothing fabrics such as poplin in different colors, cotton piqué and cotton satin, taffeta, organza, velours, tergal, silk

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita M. is from the village of Namnama, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 38 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Warlita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. Warlita has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Warlita joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Warlita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Muñequitas Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "MUÑEQUITAS" esta ubicado en EL Estado de MÉxico esta conformado por 11 integrantes entre ellas se encuentra la señora Veronica Sandra G. quien tiene un negocio de tienda de regalos desde hace 5 años que se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, inicio con muy poca mercancia y al principio no tenia un lugar establecido para sus ventas poco a poco el negocio dió frutos y logro establer un local. El crédito lo desea para tener mejor variedad de producto y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos, ya que su mayor anhelo es que sus hijas tengan una mejor calidad de vida y los ingresos suficientes para poder hacerle frente a sus necesidades economicas así como apoyar a su esposo con los gastos alimenticios y de educacion de sus hijas, ellas tiene tres hijas de 5 años 8 años y 10 años actualmente cursan preescolar y primaria y desea brindarles una carrera profesaional.
texts.en: The name of the group is "Little Dolls" and it is located in the state of Mexico. It is made up of 11 members and among them is Veronica Sandra G.. She has had a souvenir business for the past 5 years and it is located in her house. She started out with very little merchandise and at the start she didn't have a conditioned space for her sales but gradually the business began to prosper and she managed to set up a store. She requires the loan to have a better variety of products and therefore increase her sales. Her greatest goal is to see her daughters have a better quality of life and to have enough income to meet their financial needs, such as helping her husband with the nutrition and education expenses of their daughters. She has three daughters, aged 5, 8, and 10 years old. They are in preschool, and primary school and she wants to support them to have a professional career.

loans.use: to purchase souvenirs to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife. He worked as an electrician specialized in electrical projects for seven years; then he decided to work as a freelance electrician in 2004. With his business income, he is able to handle heavy living expenses. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new electric tools instead of the used ones to offer his clients better quality service. He is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the future. He is looking forward to working on bigger projects in his community. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase new electric tools.

loans.name: Nueva Ilución Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA ILUCIÓN” iniciará su ciclo decimo tercero en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por trece  integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Maria.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comida, venta de vidrios, punto Entel, venta de papa, venta de chicharrón, tejidos, venta de peluches y juguetes, artesanías, venta de ropa, comida, venta de cortes de manta, venta de batidos, joyería.
 
La señora María, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que hace un año y medio que participa en Pro Mujer y que ingreso por invitación.

En la actualidad la señora María tiene un negocio de venta de comida con el que trabaja hace doce años; nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá, porque le ayudaba hace años atras. El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra de verduras, la que compra generalmente de la ceja y la vende en Nuevos Horizontes todos los días. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella esta casada y tiene dos hijos

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo
texts.en:
The “NUEVA ILUCIÓN” ["New Hope"] communal association is starting its thirteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional center. It is composed of 13 members, and its president is Maria. The businesses operated by the members of the communal association are diverse, including food services, glass sales, Entel [telecommunications] service point, potato sales, chicharrón [cooked pork] sales, weaving, toy and stuffed animal sales, handicrafts, clothing sales, blanket sales, milkshake sales, and jewelry. 
 
María, the president of the communal association, reports that she has participated in Pro Mujer for a year and a half, and she joined by invitation. 

Currently, María has a business selling food, which she has operated for twelve years. She reports that she learned this business from her mother, because she had helped her with it in previous years. The loan that she will receive now is to buy vegetables, which she generally buys in La Ceja and sells in Nuevos Horizontes every day. This type of work allows her to generate resources to contribute to her family, since she is married and has two children. 

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes everything.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino K. lives in the village of Pkhero in the Adigeni district. She is 51 years old. Nino is married and has a 24-year-old daughter and 23-year-old son. 

Nino has a grocery store in the village. She sells different types of grocery products in the store. Her average monthly profit is 270 Laris. Nino's husband Bejan is a farmer who earns on average 200 Laris per month. 

The house where Nino’s family lives is very old and needs capital for renovation. Nino wants to create a clean and comfortable environment for the family. She decided to request a loan for house renovation. She hopes that the improvement of their living conditions will positively impact their business activities as well.

loans.use: to purchase materials to renovate her house

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald S. is 34 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Gerald has an electrical appliances sales business, which he has run for two years.
To help expand his business, Gerald has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more electrical goods for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Gerald hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical goods for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy blouses and skirts, as well as beauty products such as powders, lipsticks and creams.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old engaged woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents and one sibling. She has been working for several years as a beautician. In 2010, she opened her own beauty salon where she started to offer her customers different beauty services. Her business income is very important, because she is planning to get married soon and needs to gather enough money to be able to afford the wedding expenses. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional beauty products. In the future, she is planning to expand her business level.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for beauty care.

loans.name: Luz  Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNITA DE BELEN CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ccorao, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella junto con su hermana venden artesanía en la ciudad de Cusco en un centro artesanal, la socia también trabaja como profesora del nivel primario en la provincia de Paucartambo,por medio de este negocio y este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere terminar de construir su casa y mejorar el negocio de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena y yeso.
                                                           
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the "Reynita de Belen Ccorao" community bank which is located in Ccorao district, in Cusco province and department.

Luz Marina is 35 years old, single, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling handicrafts.  Together with her sister, she sells handicrafts in a craft center in the city of Cusco.  She also works as an elementary school teacher in Paucartambo province.  Through her business and her job, Luz Marina gets her children ahead in life.

Luz Marina would like to finish building her house and also improve her handicrafts business.  She is requesting this loan to buy construction supplies such as cement, sand and plaster.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies such as cement, sand and plaster

loans.name: Sergio

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, povincia de Maputo ao sul de Mocambique casado  e pai de 2 filhos de idades entre 7 e 10 anos idades. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, e funcionario permanente no comite olimpico a mais de 3 anos e tem um rendimento de 3.000.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Fez emprestimo no banco C.C.O no valor de 20.000.00mt para a construção da sua casa. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem sao clientes  este e o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 9.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para a sua obra (cimento, areia, blocos,chapas, ferro e outros ).
sonho e concluir a sua obra, mobiliar para propor mais conforto para a sua familia e iniciar um negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Sergio was born in the district of Boane in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  He is married and the father of 2 children who are 7 and 10.  He studied through the seventh grade and stopped due to the lack of financial resources.  He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone besides them.

He never left Maputo.  He has been a full-time employee with the olympic committee for more than 3 years.  He makes 3,000 meticals per month that he puts towards his home's expenses.  He also saves some in his bank account at the BIM bank.

He had a previous loan with the CCO bank for 20,000 meticals that he put towards building his home.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through friends that are also clients of the institution.  This is his first loan with Hluvuku, and he will use it to buy materials to finish his home (cement, sand, bricks, metal sheets, iron, etc.).

His dream is to finish his house and to furnish it to provide his family with more comfort.  He also wants to start a business.  He plans to request more loans from Hluvuku to do this.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish his home (cement, sand, bricks, metal sheets, iron, etc.)

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa operates a food stall at the market at Elmina in the central region of Ghana. In the picture, she is shown pounding fufu to be made ready for sale. She is a widow taking care of seven dependents. 

Her loan will be used to purchase more food items to cook and offer for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase food items to cook and offer for sale

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio es un señor de 32 años el cual vive con su familia en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos. Existen también algunos proyectos de agricultura orgánica y hortalizas en hidroponía. Además de la agricultura en la comunidad hay talleres mecánicos, un supermercado, pequeños restaurantes (sodas) y una mueblería.

Desde hace algún tiempo Don Eugenio se dedica a su granja agrícola. Dice que desde que inició el proyecto los resultados han sido buenos, ya que ha tenido una gran aceptación en su comunidad y los ingresos que ha generado lo han ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.

En estos momentos lo que desea Don Eugenio es solicitar un préstamo por ¢600,000 (seiscientos mil colones) para comprar gallinas, alimento y equipo, que necesita para su proyecto de avicultura. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar más ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida.  
Don Eugenio forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socio ha recibido un microcrédito que le han permitido crecer como microempresarios.
texts.en:
Eugenio, age 32, lives with his family in a rural community called called Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón in Costa Rica .  Mollejones is a community that is 150 kilometers to the south of San José province, the capital of Costa Rica.  It is 850 meters above sea level.  

This is where he grows vegetables and coffee.  He also engages in other business activities like raising and fattening livestock and pigs.  There are also other organic farming and hydroponic vegetable projects.  In addition to the farming in the community there are mechanics shops, a supermarket, small restaurants (soda), and a furniture store.

Eugenio has devoted himself to farming for some time.  He says that since he started the project the results have been very good.  He has been widely accepted in his community, and the income it has generated has helped him get his family ahead.

Eugenio is now requesting a loan for ¢600,000 (six hundred thousand colones) in order to buy chickens, feed, and equipment that he needs for his poultry farming.  With the loan he hopes that his small business will grow and come to generate more income in order to improve his living conditions.

Eugenio is part of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce, one of the hundred member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  As a member he has received a loan that has allowed him to grow as a businessman.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and equipment that he needs for his poultry farming.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Felipa; La socia tiene 39 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y  tiene 1 hijo de 13 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la artesanía, la socia realiza diversos trabajos  en tejido, la socia teje chompas, chompones, guantes, gorros, medias, chalinas en lanas, ella teje también en alpaca, lanas finas, lanas de algodón, lanas matizadas, hilos y según los pedidos que le hagan ala socia, ella también compra botones para completar la chompa, La socia requiere el crédito para la compra de diferentes lanas según los pedidos que se le hagan y también comprar botones para las chompas en los colores y tonos que le pidan. La socia solicita el préstamo parta invertir en la compra de lanas de diferentes colores, grosores  y botones

 La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN".  The bank is located in the District of Huanchac in the Province of Cusco and Department of Cusco.

The member is Felipa: the member is 39 years old, she lives with her partner and has one child aged 13.  The member works doing handicrafts.  The member does various types of work with fabric, the member knits sweaters, gloves, hats, socks, and scarves from wool.  She also knits using alpaca, fine wool, cotton, variegated wool, and yarn, and depending on the orders the partner has received, she also buys buttons to complete the sweaters.

The member is requesting the loan for the purchase of different types of wool in line with the orders she has received, and also to buy buttons for the sweaters in the different colors and shades that have been ordered.  The member is requesting the loan to invest in buying wool of different colors and thicknesses, and buttons.

The member appreciates the support being granted to her, and likewise agrees to comply in a disciplined manner with her repayments.

loans.use: to invest in buying wool of different colors and thicknesses, and buttons.

loans.name: Shuraki

texts.en:
Shuraki is 27 years old, single and supports his parents; he operates a butchery which he has been doing for the last three years.

He learned about KADET through a KADET customer. This is his first loan. He has been loaned KES 50,000 which he plans to use to expand his butchery. 

With the anticipated profit made he will open another butchery. His dream is to grow bigger in his business.

loans.use: to expand his butchery.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is a businesswoman aged 38. She is single and blessed with two children. She has been practicing dairy farming to bring up the family. Besides, she owns a cafeteria where she earns more income for her family. In the next five years, she wants her business to become successful. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to construct a cow shed and to buy some animal feed.Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become business-oriented.

loans.use: To construct a cow shed and to buy some animal feed.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
El señor Benjamín se dedica a la comercialización de leña, maíz y a la cría de ganado, Benjamin vive con sus cuatro hijos y su esposa, sus hijos le ayudan con el cuidado del ganado y al acarreo de la leña, don Benjamin es una persona muy humilde y seria.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de leña seca. en la zona en donde vive Benjamin esta lloviendo mucho y la leña seca es muy dificil de encontrar, muchos hogares en esta zona, por no decir todos, utilizan este tipo de producto para cocinar.
Su meta es que sus hijos terminen la secundaria y luego enviarlos a la universidad.
texts.en: Benjamin works in the trade of firewood, and in corn and livestock. He lives with his 4 children and his wife. His children help care for the livestock, and with the hauling of firewood. Benjamin is very humble and serious. He will use this loan to buy dry firewood. He lives in an area that receives a lot of rain and dry firewood is very hard to find. Many homes in this area use this type of product for cooking. His goal is for his children to finish high school, then to send them to college.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Kari Elizabeth

texts.es: Kari tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos, reside en el municipio de Moroceli y se dedica a la venta de frijoles. Ella inició con esta actividad hace tres años atras cuando se le ocurrió que en el patio trasero de su casa podia sembrar frijoles y entonces se decidió y lo hizo, y gracias a Dios el producto de su cosecha fue muy bueno y desde ese momento supo que esa actividad le permitiria sostener a su familia y darles lo mas necesario para tener una vida digna. Las ventas las realiza en su casa y sus vecinos son sus principales clientes. El prestamo que esta solicitando Kari lo necesita para comprar varias cargas de frijoles porque no se da abasto con solo el producto de su siembra. Con el apoyo de este prestamo espera aumentar sus ventas y con eso sus ingresos aumentaran y su negocio se mantendra activo. Si meta es tener una bodega y ampliar la gama de productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes variedad de granos basicos. Este es su segundo ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas y seguir ayudando a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su hogar especialmente espera poder seguir cubriendo los gastos de estudio de sus hijos porque ella sueña que tengan una mejor vida que la que tuvo ella.
texts.en:
Kari, 30, is married and has five children.  She resides in the town of Moroceli and works selling beans.

She started this business three years ago when it occurred to her that she could grow beans on the back patio of her house, so she decided to do it and she did.  Thanks to God the product of her harvest was very good, and from that moment on she knew that the work would allow her to support her family and give them the most things necessary to have a live of dignity.  She sells from her house and her neighbors are her main customers.

Kari will use the loan that she is requesting to buy several loads of beans because her crop doesn't give her enough.  With the help of this loan she hopes to increase her sales and, with this, her earnings will go up and her business will remain active.

Her goal is to have a grocery store and expand the range of products to offer her customers a variety of basic grains.

This is her second loan cycle with FAMA and she hopes to fulfill her loan payments punctually and continue helping her husband with the support of their home.  She especially hopes to be able to continue covering her children's school expenses because her dream is for them to have a better life than she did.

loans.use: to sell beans.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a thirty-three-year-old married woman with five school-going children. Her husband Shida Charo is a motorcycle transport operator who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She has a house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Nelly has operated as a coconut vendor for the past four years; her potential clients are her neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of transporting her stock from the point of purchase to her place of sale. She dreams of establishing a coconut wholesale shop.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Papag

texts.en: Papag is engaged in agriculture. He keeps sheep and cultivates potatoes and beans. Papag would like to develop his business and and keep livestock, too. With the requested loan, Papag plans to purchase livestock, forage, fuel and seeds.  With the help of this loan, Papag will enlarge his business and increase his income. This will allow him to improve his family's living conditions. Papag lives together with his wife.

loans.use: to pay for livestock, forage, fuel and seeds.

loans.name: Set

texts.en: Mrs. Set is 60 years old and a mother of three children. She is a local farmer, working alongside her husband from Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. She has been engaged in the farming business for years. She has learned how to do it well from her parents and it is her only income. She usually earns approximately of $2.00 per day through farming. As shown in the picture, she’s standing in front of her house with her daughter. This house was built a long time ago. Currently, it’s partially broken and requires repairs immediately. Therefore, she’s seeking some funds from HKL and Kiva to fix some parts of her house. With rest of these funds, she wants to build a room made of brick under her wooden house. She is grateful to all the kind funders and she says that she won’t make a late payment of her loan.

loans.use: to fix some parts of her house and build a room made of brick under her wooden house.

loans.name: Jose Concepcion

texts.es:
José tiene 34 años de edad, esta soltero y su actividad es la caficultura, cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en el manejo del cafe, siendo esta actividad la fuente principal de ingresos que percibe anualmente.
José utilizara el credito para comprar un panel de energia solar y poder iluminar su casa en la que pronto  formara su familia, toda su vida no ha gozado del servicio de energía eléctrica y él desea tener su casa iluminada y ya no seguir usando los candiles y velas, que son dañinos para la salud y el medio ambiente.
texts.en:
José is 34, single, and cultivates coffee. He has four years' experience in this line of work, and this is his main source of annual income.
José will use this loan to purchase a solar panel so that he can light the home in which he will soon start a family. In his entire life, he has never had electric power. He would like to have light in his home so that he can stop using oil lamps and candles; these are harmful for human health and for the environment.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Mrs. Men is 61 years old and a widowed woman who has been living in Kampong Chhnang province. She has spent most her life cultivating rice crops for her livelihood. But this business seems barely enough to satisfy her family, despite daily food. 

Presently, two of her children have started working to help solve and support the family’s financial needs. Her son, Mr. Seth, 24, is acting as a barber in the commune, while the other one is working as a seamstress for a clothes shop in the province. 
 
Mrs. Men feels pity for her son, who is travelling to work by riding a bike. Therefore, she would like to borrow some funds from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her son. 

She is very thankful for the support from all lenders.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her son.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 52 year old business man. He is married to Jane who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children aged 21 and 19 years respectively. He has been running a butcher shop for the past three years and receives monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Paul will use the loan to buy a bull to slaughter for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop which will increase his income.

loans.use: To buy a bull for his butcher business.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is twenty-seven years old and married and with three children.  He has a farm where he keeps livestock and poultry for meat, milk and eggs.  He has been in this business for a period of about three years with an income of approximately KES 9,000 a month.

This is his first loan from KADET Ltd after being introduced to KADET by a KADET credit officer.  He wants to use the loan to add more chicks and goats to his farm, which he will rear to a bigger and better size and then resell. 

He hopes to be the leading poultry supplier in his area and give his children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and goats.

loans.name: Rio

texts.en:
Rio (pictured here) sells fruit. She buys fruits from Phnom Penh market and carries them by bicycle to resell in her village. Her husband, Both is a Tuk Tuk taxi driver. Tuk Tuk is a motorbike attached with a trailer at the back. His trailer is old and breaks and he wants to repair it. He does not have money. 
In 2009, Rio asked for a loan to replace a Tuk Tuk because his Tuk Tuk taxi broke in some parts, and he used the loan to replace Tuk Tuk as planned. He now wants to ask for another loan to buy a new trailer because it broke again.  
Hence Rio is applying for a loan of $300 to purchase a new trailer for her husband.
 
The couple lives in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have one daughter who is in school.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer for her husband.

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is a 22-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Hanen is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase materials needed tomake milk nd dairy producrts.

Hannen is looking to to expand her business with an aspiration of improving her family's living conditions.

Due to cultural issues Haneen did not wish to appear in a photo published on the internet, and Haneen's husband appeared in the photo in her place.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to make milk and dairy products

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a married woman with 5 children all of whom have completed school. Her husband is a fisherman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mesalimu has operated a fried fish selling business for the past 13 years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of fish and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Justo Antonio
