texts.es: El Joven Justo Antonio le trabaja a una institucion del estado desde hace mas de 5 años como bibliotecario, actualmente es su segundo credito que tiene con CEPRODEL, agradece a la institucion por haberle facilitado el credito para cubrir sus pagos de mensualidad escolar y compra de utiles,

loans.use: Compra de utiles escolares y pago de mensualidad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on stock.

loans.name: Firangiz

texts.en: Firangiz is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Jabrail region, settled in Sumgait city and has 4 children. This 59-year-old woman has been engaged in her business for 8 years. Firangiz sells women’s clothes. She supports her family with this business. Now Firangiz needs a loan amount of $1200 to be busy with selling the women's clothing

loans.use: To be busy with selling the women's clothing

loans.name: Jesús

texts.en:
Jesús has two years' experience. She worked at home doing domestic tasks. She has decided on her own to go to business for herself. She has learned her trade of sewing on her own. What's motivated her with her savings is that she needed to buy a sewing machine. With it, she makes sheets and then goes out to sell them. She works every day from 8 am until after 4 pm.

Jesús would like credit to buy more fabric, since she has a lot of orders for sheets. In addition, with the greater income, she would like to buy another machine to continue working and make her products with better quality.

Jesús is a single mother. She lives with two grandchildren who are in school. She takes care of them since their mothers work. Her wish is to be able to obtain greater income from the investment she will make with the credit. In addition to improving her home, which is currently made from sugar cane, little by little.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Jesús tiene ya una experiencia de 2 años. Trabajaba en casa realizando quehaceres domésticos. Decide poner su propio negocio por iniciativa propia. Solamente viendo ella aprendió el oficio de la costura. Lo que la motivo a ella para con sus ahorros que tenia comprarse una maquina de coser. Con la que elabora sabanas y luego sale a vender. Trabaja todos los días de la semana desde las 8 a.m. hasta pasadas las 4 p.m.

La señora Jesús desea el crédito para comprar telas por mayor ya que tiene pedidos bastantes de sabanas. Además desea con los ingresos que mejoren poder comprarse otra maquina para seguir trabajando y darle una mejor calidad a sus productos. /p>

Jesús es madre soltera. Vive con dos nietos los que estudian. Ella los tiene a su cargo ya que sus madres trabajan. Su deseo es poder obtener mejores ingresos debido a la inversión que va a realizar con el crédito. Además de adecuar su domicilio poco a poco ya que actualmente es de caña.

loans.use: Buy more fabric

loans.name: Suraio

texts.en:
Suraio has a small candy shop in the central market of Khujand. She is a teacher and has higher education but she could not find a job with a good salary and so decided to sell food products. Suraio is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a doctor.

Suraio sells different kinds of candies, sweet biscuits and wafers. Her husband helped her to rent a place for her business and to work out contracts with suppliers from Russia, Uzbekistan and Kirgizistan. Today, the turnover of her business is fast and she has clients who come back to her shop frequently from districts of Khujand such as Konibodom, Isfara, Panjekent and Mastchoh.

In future Suraio plans to involve her elder son in the business and rent another market stall for him.

loans.use: Purchase of confectionery items

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi M. lives with three children in district Nghi Loc, province Nghe An. Her husband, Mr. Hoang Van Chiem, and their oldest son work away from home as construction workers. They only visit home once a month. In order to raise her three kids, Mrs. M. works really hard on her 1.4-acre field of rice and peanut and breeds pigs and poultry. During the first year joining the Fund, she borrowed $200 to buy pigs and poultry. From this, she earned an average of $20-30 per month. Encouraged by the initial success, she continued to borrow money to develop her business. Unfortunately, her youngest son got in an accident. All the savings from M.’s project as well as the family income is used for the hospital and medicine bills. Although facing a lot of difficulties, Mrs. M. still believes in a bright future. Now her youngest son has just been able to walk again. M. hopes that in 10 years, by the time she is 60, all of her children would be well-educated and each would have a good job. Mr.s M. wants to borrow $500 to buy more pigs to expand her project, bringing more income to her family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Mười sống cùng ba con tại huyện Nghi Lộc, tỉnh Nghệ An. Chồng chị, anh Hoàng Văn Chiêm, cùng con trai đầu đi làm thợ xây mỗi tháng mới về nhà một lần. Để nuôi 3 con ăn học, ngoài 1, 4 mẫu đất trồng lúa và lạc, chị Mười còn tích cực đầu tư chăn nuôi gà, lợn. Năm đầu tiên vào Quỹ, chị vay 200 USD để mua lợn, gà, vịt. Sau năm đầu khoản đầu tư này mang lại cho gia đình trung bình mỗi tháng 20 - 30 USD. Được khích lệ bởi thành công bước đầu chị tiếp tục vay vốn để phát triển dự án. Nhưng không may, con trai thứ 3 của gia đình chị bị tai nạn. Toàn bộ số tiền lãi từ dự án cũng như lương của hai bố con anh đi làm thuê đều chi tiêu hết vào việc thuốc thang, viện phí. Tuy gặp khó khăn nhưng chị Mười vẫn luôn tin tưởng vào tương lai. Hiện tại con trai chị đã có thể đi lại được. Chị Mười mong 10 năm nữa khi 60 tuổi các con chị đều học hành tử tế có công ăn việc làm. Cộng với số gà vịt hiện tại, chị đang làm đơn vay vốn 500 USD để mua thêm vài con lợn cho dự án tăng thu nhập của mình.

loans.use: buy pigs

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
"I have a business in my house selling groceries, but I would like to expand it to accommodate the merchandise better. I want to build a room soon so that there is more space."

He is seeking $1,200 to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo un negocio en mi casa de venta de abarrotes, pero me gustaría ampliarlo para acomodar bien la mercancía, quisiera hacer un cuarto enseguida para que el espacio sea más grande”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para ampliar mi negocio.

loans.use: Expand his business.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora is a very optimistic woman of 54 years of age, in spite the economic hardships that she has gone through in her life. She works incessantly to proviD. her nine children a better future. They all have a big desire of self- improvement. Two of her children are in college and the others want to start their studies in a specialization center at the latest next year. All of this needs of a big investment, for this reason some years ago, Teodora decided to open a small shop to help fulfill her wishes and to increase the economic income of her home. Let's support Teodora!

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Teodora, es una mujer que a pesar D. sus 54 años sigue mostrando gran optimismo, ya que a pesar D. las carencias económicas por las que ha pasado trabaja incesantemente por un futuro mejor para sus nueve hijos que tienen muchos deseos D. superación, dos D. sus hijos aún se encuentran en el colegio y los demás desean iniciar sus estudios en un centro D. especialización a más tardar el próximo año. Todo esto requiere D. una gran inversión, es por ello que Teodora decidió abrir una pequeña tienda hace algunos años atrás para ayudarlos a cumplir sus anhelos e incrementar los ingresos económicos D. su hogar. Apoyemos a Teodora a seguir adelante y a no dejarse vencer por las adversidades D. la vida a través D. un préstamo.

loans.use: Buy a larger variety of products for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel de Jesus U. Sanchez is an enterprising man with hopes to do better and improve his business to be able to support his family offering them a stable life and satisfying the food and educational needs of his wife and children.

Two years ago, Mr. U. Sanchez opened a general store, which has grown, now offering a variety of products. His starting capital was US$900.00, a loan from relatives.

Mr. U. Sanchez has worked with Ceprodel for a year, and so has experienced great changes in his general store. Today, he feels very satisfied with the support offered to him, because it has allowed him to increase his business, satisfy the needs of his customers, and support his family. He has a record of five loans.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Manuel de Jesús U. S. es un hombre acompañado, emprendedor con deseos de progresar en su negocio para poder apoyar a su familia ofreciéndole una vida estable y poder satisfacer las necesidades tanto de alimentación como educación su esposa e hijos.

Hace Dos años el Sr. U. S. inició con la pulpería la cual ha ido incrementando, pudiendo ofrecer variedad de productos. Su capital inicial fue de U$900.00 (dólares) de un préstamo familiar.

El Sr. U. S. trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace un año por lo que ha experimentado grandes cambios en su pulpería. Hoy en día se siente muy satisfecho por el apoyo ofrecido, ya que de esta manera ha podido incrementar su negocio, satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela y sacar adelante a su familia. El tiene un record de Cinco créditos.

loans.use: Investing in his general store (Inversión al negocio)

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
In 1994, when a TYM Fund branch was opened in Tiên Dược, Mrs. Phạm Thị O., 45 years old now, was among the first to join the fund. She borrowed her first loan of 20USD to raise few pigs. Her pigs raising business prospered, next rounds of loan she applied to the maximum limits. She always maintains 7 or 8 pigs ready for slaughtered in her inventory. In 2000, she sent the oldest son to a mechanical school. Upon his graduation she invested 2000USD to open a shop for him. Her youngest daughter is still in school. The family’s economy is adequate. Besides raising pigs and farming the family’s rice paddy, she sells scrap material. Subsequently she built a scrap material processing plant. The plant is prosperous and employs 15 workers with monthly salary of 50USD per employee. The net profit is 380USD a month. This time she would like to apply for a loan of 1200USD to finance her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Năm 1994, khi Quỹ Tình thương về đến xã Tiên Dược, chị Phạm Thị O., 45 tuổi, là một trong những người đầu tiên tham gia với Quỹ. Đầu tiên chị vay mức vốn 20USD để chăn nuôi lợn. Được cái duyên mát tay, chị chăn nuôi rất phát triển. Các vòng vốn sau, chị vay tối đa tập trung cho chăn nuôi, lúc nào chị cũng có 7,8 con lợn thịt trong chuồng. Năm 2000, chị O. cho người con lớn đi học sửa chữa xe máy và mở cửa hàng với số vốn 2000USD. Con út của chị O. vẫn đang đi học. Cuộc sống của gia đình khá đầy đủ. Ngoài việc chăn nuôi và đồng ruộng, chị O. còn đi chợ phế liệu, thu mua bao tải cũ. Công việc thuận lợi, chị bàn với chồng vay vốn của Quỹ cộng thêm số tiền tích lũy được mở cơ sở sơ chế bao bì, phế liệu. Hiện nay, cơ sở của chị khá lớn mạnh với 15 công nhân, chị trả lương 50USD/tháng/người. Mức thu nhập bình quân sau khi trừ chi phí của gia đình là 380USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị O. xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm bao tải, phế liệu phục vụ cho hoạt động kinh dO. của mình.

loans.use: Buy garbage, sacks to preliminary treatment

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr:
Born in Lomé on July 9, 1982, Mr. Ayaovi Z. is a young electrician for a building unit. He still lives and works in Lomé, in the district of N'Kafu. From a rather poor family, he was only recently able to finish his apprenticeship diploma. Very ambitious, he is asking for a loan which will allow him to purchase materials he needs for work and to open a workshop with the goal to exercise his trade to its full potential. This will make it possible for him to expand his business and take charge of his career and his future.

Translated by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Né à Lomé le 09 Juillet 1981, Monsieur Z. Ayaovi est un jeune électricien en bâtiment et réside à Lomé au quartier N’Kafu. Issu d’une famille très pauvre, il a tout récemment eu son diplôme de fin d’apprentissage. Très ambitieux, il sollicite un financement qui lui servira d’acquérir les matériels et outils de travail et ouvrir un atelier afin d’exercer pleinement son métier. Ceci lui permettra de mieux s’épanouir et se prendre en charge

loans.use: To purchase materials he needs for work.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Señora Leonor is 55 years old. She is very lonely due to the loss of her two dear children and her beloved husband. Thanks to her great love for the kitchen, she has found in her devoted clients a big family who help her through moments of sadness. With them she shares part of the morning and a great part of the afternoon since they come and go quickly during the course of the day. To offer them better comfort, she desires to improve her sales space and for this reason she has requested a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Leonor de 55 años de edad, se encuentra muy sola debido a la pérdida de sus dos queridos hijos y de su amado esposo. Gracias a su gran amor por la cocina ha encontrado en sus asiduos clientes a la gran familia que le hace falta para aplacar momentos de tristeza, con ellos comprate parte de la mañana y gran parate de la tarde ya que acuden presurosos en su búsqueda al término de sus jornadas diarias.Par brindarles mayor comodidad desea implementar su espacio de ventas y a esta razón a tiende su solicitud de un préstamo.

loans.use: Improve her little sales space.

loans.name: Veronica's Upendo Mloganzila B Group

texts.en:
Veronica, age 58, is married with 2 children (ages 26 and 18). She has a shop where she sells alcohol and soft drinks, which she began 3 years ago. She works from 10:00 AM to 11:00 PM daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $833 from her sales.

Veronica has taken out 4 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to pay for her son’s school fees, build a small house, and increase her capital. She hopes for a new loan for school fees and to open a retail shop. Veronica will share this loan with her subgroup members, selling grains, vegetables, fruit, and house chemicals.

In the picture, Veronica is standing second from the left.

loans.use: For school fees and to open a retail shop

loans.name: Tumain

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Tumain M.. She is married and has four children from 20 to 27 years of age. In 1997, Tumain opened a business that sells clothing and crops wholesale. She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from SELFINA, and has applied a new loan to expand the range of clothing and cloth she has for sale, and to buy additional stocks of rice, beans, and maize in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand the range of clothing and traditional African cloth for sale, and to buy additional stocks of rice, beans and maize in bulk.

loans.name: Comité Yboty Group

texts.es:
The committee is comprised of 16 working women from the Yboty of Cabañas company in the city of Caacupé. All of them are informal micro-entrepreneurs and are currently in the 7th cycle of the program for Enterprising Woman. The committee's name, "Yboty", means flower in Guarani, the native language of Paraguay. The women are currently benefiting from a loan of around 718,000 guaranis each (roughly $200 USD).

The group began with its first meetings in the home of Mrs. Marta M. who is currently the group's secretary. One of the characteristics of this group is that they are interested in constantly learning and always ask their assessor Freddy Bordon to school them in specific areas such as marketing, public relations, finances, break even points amongst other topics.

The committee has embarked on a project for the month of June 2008 to host a celebration for Saint John in the neighborhood square. The proceeds will go to helping their neighbor who is currently ill but was once a member of the committee.

Laura, the group leader, expresses the thanks of all the members of the "Yboty" committee to the Paraguayan Foundation for being the only institution that has given them the chance to receive a formal loan to use as working capital and for enabling them to manage their own business.

Today they are requesting a new loan to invest in their mirco-enterprises by purchasing products to be sold in their kiosks such as sugar, meats, rice, vegetables, fruit, candy, soda and others. Those who prepare and sell food, especially "chipa" (a traditional Paraguayan bread with cheese) need to purchase ingredients. The traveling saleswomen in the group will purchase various products including undergarments, clothes and kitchen utensils etc.

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

El comité está compuesto por 16 señoras trabajadoras de la compañía Yboty de Cabañas de la ciudad de Caacupé, todas son pequeñas microempresarias informales y actualmente están en 7to. Ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendoras. El comité lleva por nombre “Yboty” que significa flor en el idioma guaraní, idioma nativo de nuestro país. Las señoras actualmente están siendo beneficiadas con un crédito promedio de 718.000 mil guaraníes a cada integrantes.

El comité se inició con las primeras reuniones en la casa de la señora Marta M., quien actualmente cumple la función de secretaria, una de las características de este grupo es que están interesada constantemente en capacitarse, por lo siempre piden a su asesor Freddy Bordón que les hable de algún tema en especial, como ser Marketing, Relaciones Públicas, Finanzas, Punto de equilibrio, entre otros temas.

El comité actualmente se aboca a un proyecto para este mes de Junio, que es la de realizar una fiesta de San Juan en la plaza del barrio, lo recaudado será para ayudar a una vecina quien se encuentra enferma y en alguna oportunidad fue integrante del comité.

La señora Laura, manifiesta y trasmite el agradecimiento de todas las que componen el comité “Yboty” a la Fundación Paraguaya, por ser la única institución que les dio la posibilidad de obtener un préstamo formal para capital de trabajo y a parte el de capacitacitarles para manejar su negocio.

Ellas hoy día solicitan un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en sus micro comercios comprando mercaderías para despensa y kioscos como azúcar, carnes, arroz, vegetales, frutas, golosinas, gaseosas, entre otros. Para las que se dedican a la elaboración y venta de comidas, especialmente “chipa” que es una comida típica parecida al pan con queso, se necesita comprar ingredientes y para las vendedoras ambulantes mercaderías varias como lencerías, ropas, utensilios de cocina, etc.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, sugar, meat, herbs, flour, milk, coal, drins, seeds and garden plants as well as raw materials to prepare 'chipas' such as starch cheese and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Chuiquisis Group

texts.es:
The women of Chuiquisis Group come from a rural town in the area of Sololá called Concepción. This place is known in the area for the great agricultural production that it has. Many merchants come to Concepción to buy vegetables, for the most part, biweekly. The peasants plant onions, carrots, and cabbage among other vegetables. Because of the work that they put in to the land, the peasants have designed strategies to maintain the fertility of the soil. For example, in Concepción, the practice of rotating the type of vegetable to be planted in the same space of land for much of the year is widely used. Basic techniques like those mentioned minimize the risk of farming for the group members.

The Chuiquisis group has been together for almost four years. They have already had four loans with this institution. This group is very good with re-payments, since the members are very responsible. If this is not the case, at the end of the loan, the group separates from the person that has not been responsible. In this way, the reputation of the group has remained intact. The women say that the success of the group lies in the responsibility of each woman and in the fact that they choose well at the time of making the group.

All of the women in this group work in the agricultural sector. In their plots, the women plant the traditional vegetables of the area. They use their loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and to rent the land.

Another positive aspect that this female group has is that all the women believe in the power of education. The members try to send all of their children to school, at least to primary school. This attitude is very positive, since it demonstrates a great improvement between the generations of the parents and the children.

The Chuiquisis Group is made up of a group of working women that want to go forward with their families. As a result, we have to extend them a hand by means of a loan that will help them to drive their businesses and to generate more profits that will allow them to invest in their children.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Las mujeres Chuiquisis provienen de un pueblo muy rural en el departamento de Sololá llamado Concepción. Este lugar es conocido en el medio por la gran producción agrícola que tiene. A Concepción llegan muchos comerciantes a comprar verduras al por mayor quincenalmente. Los campesinos siembran cebollas, zanahorias, repollo entre otras verduras. Los campesinos debido a la presión que ejercen a la tierra han diseñado estrategias para mantener la fertilidad de la tierra. Por ejemplo, en Concepción es ampliamente practicada la técnica de rotación de cultivo así como varíar el tipo de vegetales que van a sembrar en un mismo espacio de tierra a lo largo del año. Técnica básicas como las mencionadas minimizan el riesgo del cultivo para las clientes.

El grupo Chuiquisis lleva junto por casi cuatro años. Ellas ya han trabajado cuatro créditos con la institución. Este grupo ha sido de muy buena paga ya que las integrantes son muy responsables, y cuando no lo son, al final del crédito separan a la persona que ha faltado con la institución. De esta manera la reputación del grupo se mantiene intacta. Las señoras comentaron que el éxito del grupo yace en la responsabilidad de cada mujer y que se escogieron muy bien a la hora de formar el grupo.

Todas las señoras de este grupo trabajan en el sector agrícola. En sus terrenos ellas siembran los vegetales tradicionales del área. Ellas utilizan su crédito para la compra de semillas, abono, fertillizante y algunas lo utilizan para el alquiler de la tierra.

Otro factor muy positivo que tienen este grupo de señoras es que todas ellas creen en el poder de la educación. Las clientes tratan de envíar a todos sus hijos a la escuela, por lo menos a la escuela primaria. Esta actitud es muy positivo ya que demuestra una gran mejora generacional entre padre e hijos.

El grupo Chuiquisis está conformado por un grupo de mujeres trabajadoras que quieren salir adelante junto con sus familias, es por eso que nosotros tenemos que extenderles una mano por medio de un préstamo que las va a ayudar a impulsar sus negocios y generar mayores ganancias que las puedan invertir en sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and tools for cultivation and vegetables.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Mrs. Son C. is a 41-year-old widow. She works hard at her fishing business every day on Tunle Sap Lake. She has been fishing since 1998 and earns approximately $2.50 a day. She lives with four children; one is married, the oldest is a fisherman, earning approximately $2.50 per day, and her one daughter earns some selling grocery items. They live in Anlong Somnor Commune, Sieap Reap Province.

Mrs. Son seeks a loan to purchase a fishing boat to use for her fishing business. She hopes the loan will improve her business and sustain the family living.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat to use for the fishing business

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
La señora  Anita G. R. tiene cuarentaicuatro años y vive en la avenida Primavera sin número, del distrito de Mache  provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Curso el quinto año de secundaria, pero no continuo estudiando porque se casó, con el señor Segundo Lozano Gamboa y tienen cinco hijos, de los cuales la mayor ya es casada.
Su negocio consiste en comprar y vender menestra, trigo, cebada  y chocho, su negocio lo realiza en su propia casa.
Anita es una mujer emprendedora que le gustan los retos ella siempre cumple con las metas que se  propone es por eso que la invitaron a Manuela Ramos para pertenecer al Banco Comunal Progresistas, donde consiguió su primer préstamo de 300 soles para ser devueltos en cuatro meses, con el que compró trigo.
Con este préstamo de S/. 500 soles, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará chocho y trigo, porque son granos de la época.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal Progresistas es socia.
Sueña con ir de viaja turístico con su esposo por todo el Perú, siempre quiso conocer la patria de palmo a palmo, dice.
texts.en:
Anita G. R. is forty-four years old and she lives in on Primavera street, a locale with no street number, in the district of Mache in the Province of Otuzco, in the regon of La Libertad in Peru.

She finished her fifth year of high school, but she didn't keep going because she married her husband, Segundo Lozano Gamboa and together they have five children, the eldest of whom is married.

Her business consists of the buying and selling of vegetable stew, wheat, sweet drinks and vegetables, and she runs the business from her own home. Anita is a hard working woman and she enjoys having goals and reaching them. For her strong spirit she was invited to join Manuela Ramos and become member of the Banco Comunal Progresistas where she received her first loan of 300 soles. She will repaid the loan in a term of 4 months and the funds were used to purchase wheat.

With this loan of 500 soles, which will also be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase grains and wheat because they currently in season.

She is a member of the community bank Banco Comunal Progresistas.

She dreams of taking a trip touring all of Peru alondside her husband. She always wanted to see her country from palm tree to palm tree.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grains (such as wheat) wholesale.

loans.name: Noelia

texts.es: Noelia es una joven soltera muy trabajadora, vive en la casa de su madre, en sus horas libres ayuda en casa y en el negocio de comida que realiza su madre. Desde hace 11 meses trabaja en un restaurante cerca al barrio donde vive, trabaja de 6 de la mañana a 2 de la tarde, luego apoya a su mamá.  Anteriormente tenía la idea de estudiar corte y confección; pero con el trabajo en este restaurante, ha cambiado su modo de pensar;  ahora quiere tener su propio restaurante, porque ha aprendido el manejo de ello, sobre todo porque le fascina el mundo de la gastronomía  y estar en contacto con la gente, esto le va a permitir emplear a su madre, que también conoce de ese negocio. Lo malo es que no cuenta con los recursos para iniciar este negocio, debido a que conoce el funcionamiento considera que en el futuro le iría muy bien. El motivo de su esfuerzo es apoyar a su madre, y sobre todo tiene ambiciones de crecer y ser una empresaria. Noelia, ahora que tiene la oportunidad de acceder al préstamo, inmediatamente va emplearlo para realizar una actividad de venta de pollada o parrillada, de ese modo hará crecer su dinero, y después empezar la venta de comida en su casa con la ayuda de su madre, y poco a poco llegar a tener su restaurante.
texts.en:
Noelia is a young, single woman who is a very hard worker. She lives at home with her mother. In her spare time she helps around the house and also with her mother's food business. For the past 11 months, she has worked in a restaurant near the neighborhood where they live. She works from 6:00 in the morning until 2:00 in the afternoon and then helps her mother. Before, she had the idea to study dressmaking but because of her work at the restaurant, she has changed her way of thinking. Now she wants to have her own restaurant because she has learned how to manage one, but mainly because she is fascinated by the world of gastronomy and being in contact with people. This is going to allow her to employ her mother who also knows that business. The bad thing is that she doesn't have the resources to start the business. Since she knows how it functions, she thinks that things will go will for herself in the future. The motive behind her determination is to support her mother and above all, she has the ambition to grow and to be a businesswoman. Noelia now has the opportunity to receive a loan. Right away she is going to use the money to sell chicken and grilled foods. That way she will make her money grow and, after food sales from home with the help of her mother, little by little she will get to the point of having her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to start a business selling food from home

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in large quantity of fresh meat for her butcher shop

loans.name: Mary-Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann M. says, “In this world everything is unfair. That is why I do not hesitate to improve our poor living condition in Sisim Alto." She does not believe in waiting to see what blessings come to her family, but instead believes in working hard to make those blessing occur.

Mary Ann M. is a 33-year-old, hard-working woman who is married to a farmer-husband named Jerry. They are blessed with two children in elementary school: Jelly Ann – 11 years old currently in grade five, and Jomar – 8 years old. They live in Sisim Alto near the clear Abuan river, wherein the road conditions are still rough.

Mary Ann manages a small store in their village, and the small income she earns is used for her family's basic needs. She is requesting a loan so she can stock more merchandise at one time. This will save on transportation costs and enable her to be more able to meet her customers' need. She also will be able to save some money for the high school and college education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of items for her store

loans.name: M/mpya E Group

texts.en:
Julieth owns a small charcoal store and sells clothes in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma, which she has done for the last five years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of 175 USD. Every day she works for 12 hours at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and clothes for her inventory. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money.

Julieth is 26 years old, single, and has one child who is seven years old; she also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Sharifa, Teddy, Dotto and Zuhura. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and clothes for her business

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
ADELA CÁRDENAS GONZALES, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Guerreras”, ubicado en el Jr. Fernando Stall N° 187  de la Ciudad de Pucallpa, Distrito de Callería, tiene 02 hijos, el trabajo que realiza su esposo es independiente, es socia de Manuela Ramos hace 02 años.

Su primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró implementos para repostería (tazones, fuentes, moldes) ella prepara, tortas, pasteles, bufetes, moldes a la vez administra un hospedaje llamado “Las Orquídeas”

Con este préstemo de S/.2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en  la compra de materiales de limpieza para el Hospedaje como, papel higiénico, 04 jabones de tocador, 02 cajas, toallas 02 docenas, sábanas 06 juegos, ambientado el local. La señora ADELA continúa con su preparación de tortas y bufetes.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo, se siente bien.
texts.en:
Adela Cardenas Gonzales is a member of the communal bank "Las Guerreras" which is located at Fernando Stall N° 187 in the city of Pucallpa, district of Callería. Adela has two children and her husband works independently. She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for two years. The first loan Adela received was in the amount of $100 and she used it to purchase implements for confectionery (bowls, molds, serving dishes). She prepares tarts and cakes and also runs a lodging business named "Las Orquideas." She will invest this loan of $800 in the purchase of cleaning products for the lodgings such as toilet paper, soap, towels and sheets. Adela will also continue preparing her baked goods. Adela is thankful to Manuela Ramos for her support.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cleaning products for lodging.

loans.name: Mohammad Nayam

texts.en: M. nayam lives in Kabul Afghanistan. He is married with three children. M. nayam wants to receive a loan for his general store which he wants to enlarge. He is requesting an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 11 months  to buy the necessary materials for his shop to complete his stock. M. nayam wants to thank both  Kiva and AFSG for this loan process in Afghanistan  that helps poor people.

loans.use: To complete his stock by buying the necessary materials for his shop

loans.name: Zohirdzhon

texts.ru: Клиент Курбонов Зохирджон проживаюший в городе душанбе, холост, образования среднее техническое. Сам клиент занимается мантажом свадьб и разных мероприятий. Этим видом деятельности занимается у себя дома. На полученные от нас деньги клиент хочет купить более мощьный компьютер для дольнейшей работы.От полученной прибыли клиент хочет женится.
texts.en:
Client Zohirdzhon K. lives in Dushanbe. He is a bachelor and has a secondary technical education. The client creates montages of weddings and different events. He creates them at his home. The client would like to use the money from the loan to purchase a more powerful computer for future work. He would like to use the profits to get married.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new computer

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor es socio del Banco Comunal Morenita.
Victor es casado, tiene 54 años y 3 hijos, Victor tiene un restaurante llamado San José ubicado en cerca del mercado Magdalena, en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de 5 trabajadoras.
Victor necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de mesas, sillas.
Los sueños de Victor son mejorar su negocio, tener un local propio y otra sucursal.
texts.en:
Victor is a member of the Banco Comunal Morenita (Morenita Communal Bank). Victor is married, 54 years old and has 3 children. Victor has a restaurant named San José located near the Magdalena Market in a rented location. He runs his restaurant with the support of 5 workers. Victor needs a loan of 1500 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of tables and chairs. Victor’s dreams are to improve his business, to have his own location and to open another restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of tables and chairs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace F. is twenty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both sons. She says both of her sons are in the basic school. She says she lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Grace works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is into mining activity.

Grace is a trader. She fries and sells yams in the day and in the evening. She serves the fried yam with ground pepper and fried fish. She sells by the roadside to passers-by. She procures tubers of yam from wholesalers in Accra and sometimes directly from the farmers.

Grace has been in business for barely a year now and wants a loan to procure yams and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to sponsor all her children to the university level.

loans.use: To procure yams and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sumarmi

texts.en:
Ni Ketut Sumarmi - (DNR.M-0666) is a 34 year-old woman living in the town of Manistutu, Melaya.  She is married and has one school-aged child.  To make a living, Ni Ketut Sumarmi owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not her only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Ni Ketut Sumarmi has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 300,000 - 400,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2007, Ni Ketut Sumarmi joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Ketut Sumarmi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  Ni Ketut Sumarmi is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI.  Ni Ketut Sumarmi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to support her family.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ni Ketut Sumarmi - (DNR.M-0666) merupakan 34 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Ketut Sumarmi memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Ketut Sumarmi sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 7 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut Sumarmi menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 - 400,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2007, Ni Ketut Sumarmi bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Ketut Sumarmi meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli ternak indukan.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Ketut Sumarmi berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es: Doña Julia María M. es una muy trabajadora de 35 años de edad. Ella se dedica al destace de cerdo, y lo procesa para luego distribuirlo de manera ambulante, por lo que tiene que correr muchos kilómetros para ofrecer sus productos. Se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace 15 años, Julia es madre de 4 hijos varones, de los cuales todos estudian con el esfuerzo de ella y de su esposo, que trabaja brindando el servicio de transporte en un triciclo. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de cerdos además, tiene que pagarle a un señor para que recorra con ella los diferentes lugares donde le ofrecen los cerdos a un mejor precio. Los sueños de Julia son de salir adelante para que  a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Doña Julia María M. is a very hard working 35 year old. She butchers pork and then processes it to later distribute as a street vendor. She has to cover many kilometers to offer her products. She has been doing this for fifteen years. Julia has four sons. Through her efforts and her husband’s efforts (he works with a tricycle in the transportation service) the children go to school. The loan is to buy more pigs. Also, she needs to pay a man to travel with her to the different places where they sell pigs at a better price. Julia’s dream is to get ahead so that her children do not lack their daily bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bashiran Sajjad Hussain Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. 
Shazia baji wants a loan to buy material (leather and nails) for her shoe-making business. 
Naseem baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil. and spices) for her food-selling business. 

Bashiran baji is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies. They all live in Lahore, Pakistan. Bashiran baji is married to S. H. who sells paint. Bashiran baji sews clothes to sell so she can pay the utility bills. She is applying for a loan to buy more paint to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy paint

loans.name: Bibi Saheab Group

texts.en:
Bibi Saheab is the group leader of Bibi Saheab Group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money to purchase more materials for their businesses and make a good income for their family in future.
Bibi Saheab and Qaseyma want to take a loan for their business of tailoring, to buy one or two new machines for tailoring. Saefadine wants to take a loan for car part selling. He wants to buy the necessary materials for his business. Shakofa wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. And she wants to enlarge her businesses. They all want to expand and progress their businesses and want to earn more money to support their families. With this loan, they can expand their businesses, support their families and make a better future for themselves and for their families in the future.

loans.use: To buy new machines for tailoring

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: Rashida is 48 years old and is a widow with four children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria where she sells soap. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more soap to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more soap to sell

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es: Demetrio es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 61 años, y nunca se casó, es por ello que vive solo en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años y medio se dedica al alquiler de su cochera para guardar carritos sangucheros y salchipaperos (carritos que venden comida). Decidió incursionar en este negocio debido a que su sueldo de jubilado no le alcanza para cubrir todos sus gastos, es por ello que emprendió un negocio que puede realizar desde su propia casa. Actualmente alberga 14 carritos, los cuales le pagan al día dos soles, con lo cual Demetrio genera algunos ingresos extras para su economía. Por otro lado, nos comenta que este trabajo es una forma de mantenerse activo y no sentirse solo. Este es su segundo préstamo individual con MFP, y con el dinero que viene solicitando planea ampliar el espacio de su cochera para poder albergar a más móviles e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Demetrio is a very hard working 61-year-old man. Never married, he lives by himself in his own house. For the past two and a half years he has rented out his garage to house the cars of food vendors. He decided to venture out into this business due to the fact that his retirement pay was not enough to cover his expenses. For this reason he launched a business that he could run from his home. Currently the garage accommodates 14 cars at the rate of 2 soles a day, used as extra income to help his finances. On the other hand, Demetrio’s work also serves as a way for him to stay active and not feel alone. This is the second individual loan that he has requested with MFP, and with the money he plans to increase his garage space in order to accommodate more cars and increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase the size of his garage

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is a 28 year married with three children aged between 9 and 12 years.  She resides and owns  a two roomed house where she is staying with six people and All her children go to school. Faridah takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area.   She incurs extra transport to and from shopping .She buys her cold drinks in Kibuye one of the busiest markets in Uganda and does her shopping twice a week. She sells to 35 customers a day.and sells to all categories of people on Faridah works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for business plus medication. She has been in this business for the last six years Faridah has been with MCDT for6 years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to stock more food stuffs Faridah is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business premise 
 

.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda

loans.name: Saidbuvi

texts.en: Saidbuvi is married and has four children. She has a business selling clothing in the small market of Shahrituz. Her business is going well as demand has been very stable over the last eleven years. Saidbuvi is an entrepreneur of high integrity and is very hardworking and energetic. Even when her competitors have similar products or lower prices, clients naturally gravitate to her as she can skillfully make them feel valued, respected and heard. Saidbuvi is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni to purchase seasonal clothing which will help her to continue stabilizing her business and income so that she can support herself and her daughter. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia M. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old. Patricia is married and has 4 school-aged children.

To make a living, Patricia owns & operates a business selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling personal care products like cosmetics, lotion and body powder to local community members.

Patricia has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Patricia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Patricia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Patricia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
La señora Pabla R. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el ayudo a surtir su negocio y tener más variedad de productos.
Pero se le ha terminado la mercancía y por eso esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo y así surtir su negocio de mercancía. 
Ya que es la fuente de ingresos de sus hijos ya que es viuda y solo cuenta con su negocio. Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio.

loans.use: Comprar mercancía

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Mrs. Anastacia A. is from the town of D'Ban Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, married and blessed with four school-aged children. She has been engaged in her business for more than six years, earning 8,000.00 per month from her business particularly the corn production endeavor. In 2000, she joined PMPC to gain access to their programs and services. Currently, she's availing her second cycle loan in the amount of 30,000.00 which will be used for additional capital for her existing project (corn production) and for the purchase of fertilizer and labor expenses.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for purchasing fertilizers for her corn production and labor expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase holiday season products.

loans.name: Ana Lorena

texts.es:
Ana Lorena V. C., tiene la edad de 37 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos.Ella quiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una máquina y telas para la costura, esto le ayudaría a percibir ingresos no solo por las costuras que realiza sino también podría obtener ingresos vendiendo a sus clientes las telas.Ella se dedica a la costura desde hace varios años, manifiesta que tiene experiencia y que la ha complementado con cursos que ha aprobado con satisfacción.
Es la segunda vez que doña Ana Lorena realiza un préstamo con FUDECOSUR, y manifiesta estar muy contenta pues las condiciones del préstamos son muy buenas y accesibles para ella.Ella se había financiado hace algún tiempo con Coopealianza, pero e solicitaron muchos requisitos y el trámite era un poco más lento.
Las metas y aspiraciones que ella tiene para el futuro es el de progresar para poder ayudar con el estudio de sus hijos y el tener una mayor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Ana Lorena V. C. is 37 years old. She is married with two children. She will use the loan to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics. This will help her increase her income through selling sewn products and fabric. She has worked as a seamstress for several years. She has experience and has passed courses in sewing too. This is the second time that Ana Lorena has applied for a loan with FUDECOSUR and is very happy with the loan conditions; they are very good and accessible for her. She had received a loan a while ago with Coopealianza, but they asked her to fit many requirements and the process was a little slow. The goals that she has for the future are to be able to help with her children's studies and to have more economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Kizaara Twihaneyo Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
T. Edson has a hotel and tomato-growing business in Kizaara cell. He is 29 years old and married with four children between the ages of 6 months and 8. He also takes care of two dependants. All his children are in school except for the last born 6-month-old baby.

Edson is able to make 60,000/= profit a week although he has business challenges like low capital and little market for his tomatoes. Edson knows how to treat his customers well and he would like to expand his business further and sell tomatoes wholesale instead of retail. He also hopes his children get the best education for self sustainability. Edson needs a loan to be able to purchase more foodstuffs and seeds to grow tomatoes and maize. Edson is a friendly and hardworking man with a strong drive to succeed.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and seeds

loans.name: Nellys

texts.es: Doña Nellys vive  en la zona# 4 de Nueva Guinea junto a sus dos hijos:  la niña mayor tiene 14 añitos estudia su segundo año de secundaria y el niño menor tiene 9 añitos estudia su tercer grado de primaria, su esposo trabaja como chofer de un bus colectivo, ella trabaja como adminsitradora  en la casa Materna desde hace 9 años,  está solicitando su cuarto credito   para la Construccion de una cocina, y asi tener mejor comodidad  y mirar su cocina mas bonita. Nellys  es una mujer emprendedora que ha ayudado a muchas mujeres campesinas que llegan a dar luz a sus bebe,  por medio de gestiones realizadas por la responsable de la Casa Materna se les da albergues,  su sueño es tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, estabilidad laboral para así  ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nellys lives in zone #4 of Nueva Guinea with her two children: the eldest daughter is 14 years old and studies her second year of secondary school, and the younger boy is 9 years old and is in 3rd grade. Her husband works as a bus driver. She has been working as an administrator in the Casa Materna for the past 9 years. She is requesting her fourth loan to build a kitchen so they be more comfortable and look at a prettier kicthen. Nellys is an entrepreneuring woman who has helped many women who come from the country to give birth to their babies. She offers them shelter through negotiations made by the one responsible in the Casa Materna. Her dream is to have a house in better conditions and work stability so she can help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a kitchen

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
El Sr. Rogelio  nació en Cochabamba en octubre en 1958 actualmente vive en Santa cruz en San Carlos aproximadamente 2 años, el trabaja como agricultor actividad principal.

El Señor trabaja junto con su familia en la agricultura y luego comercializa sus productos en el mercado de la zona, el es muy trabajador y responsable viene de una familia bin unida y el esta agradecido por el financiamiento para la reparación de su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Rogelio was born in Cochabamba in October 1958 and now has lived in Santa Cruz, San Carlos for the last 2 years. He primarily works as a farmer. He works with his family growing produce then selling it in the local market. He is a very hard, responsible worker that comes from a very unified family. He is grateful for the loan that will help him to repair his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Calixta's Group

texts.en:
Calixta E. is from the village of Panta-on, Ozamiz City. She is 37 years old and the leader of a two-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if he or she is delinquent or defaults.
Calixta is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, candies, biscuits, eggs, soap, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. Calixta has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2007, Calixta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Calixta is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees and meet their daily needs.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lhamsuren

texts.en: Lhamsuren operates an iron product making business in his town. He makes a variety of iron products such as pots, garages and doors, etc. He started his business in 1997 after running a transportation service for several years. Lhamsuren is 51 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His family lives in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent called a ger. His second daughter, who is 20 years old, studies at university and his wife is a hairdresser. Over the years, Lhamsuren has worked hard to expand and improve his business. Now his working capital is 2,400,000 tugrugs (~$1700 US) with a monthly net profit of 450,000 tugrugs (~$320 US). He buys all his raw materials from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is a hardworking man with good communication skills. He says, "I am planning to have my own workshop in the future." He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase raw materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his business

loans.name: Sielaa

texts.en:
Sielaa P. is 52 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture, selling local Samoan snacks such as palusami (coconut cream wrapped in taro leaves), cooked taro, yams, and soupo ese (hearty papaya soup).  Sielaa has 4 years of experience in this business.  Sielaa needs a loan of WST $1700 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 tala or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Sielaa joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Sielaa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Sielaa P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabián tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente hace 7 años, tiene un hijo de 6 años de 
edad. El vive en casa propia la cual es de adobe. El se dedica a brindar el servicio 
de transporte en su mototaxi, la cual adquirió con ahorros obtenidos de los años 
laborando como obrero de campo junto a su pareja. El se dedica a este servicio 
aproximadamente hace 3 años teniendo amplia experiencia en el servicio. Fabián destina 
todos los ingresos para la educación de su hijo, el cual se encuentra en edad escolar. 
fabian  sueña  ver su casa construida  ya que fue seriamente afectada por el terremoto 
y también que su menor hijo pueda estudiar y así poder brindarle seguridad y bienestar, solicita el credito para poder darle mantenimiento a su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Fabián is 38 years old and has been in a common law marriage for seven years. He has a six year old son. Fabián lives in his own home, which is made of adobe. He provides transportation services using his motorcycle taxi, which he bought with the money he saved after years of working as a farm laborer with his partner. Fabián has been in the transportation sector for three years and has gained ample experience in providing this service. His earnings will go toward his son’s education since he is currently in school. Fabián dreams of seeing his house built since it was seriously impacted by the earthquake. He also wants to see his son study, so he will continue to provide for his security and well-being. The loan he is requesting will be used to provide maintenance to his motorcycle taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Karla Geraldina

texts.es:
La señora Karla Geraldina A. J., tiene en 36 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos, los cueles se encuentran bajo su dominio, viven en el Barrio Laureles Sur, es casada y su esposo le apoya económicamente.

Se dedica a la venta de repuestos de motocicletas, y en estos últimos meses se ha enfrentado con la dificultad de salir a ofrecer de forma ambulante los repuestos con su hijo recién nacido, ahora que el niño ya se podría quedar con su hermano el cual tiene 21 años de edad, ella solicito un préstamo para la compra de mayor inventario de repuestos, el resultado de este apoyo econpomico le presento mejores expectativas de las que estaba esperando, debido a que vendio en su totalidad, todos los repuestos que habia adquirido, gracias al prestamo, es de esta manera que la señora Almendàrez, ha podido mejorar sus capacidades  financieras y le permitara condiciones optimas de vida para toda su familia.
texts.en:
LKarla Geraldina A. J. is 36 and has two dependent children. They live in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She is married, and her husband helps her economically. She sells replacement parts for motorcycles. In the last few months she has had difficulty leaving to sell the replacement parts as a street vendor with her newborn son. Now her son can stay with his 21 year old brother. She requested a loan to buy a greater inventory of replacement parts. The result of this economic help was better than she had hoped for. She sold everything, all of the replacement parts that she had, thanks to the loan. This is the way that Mrs. A. has been able to improve her financial capability, and it has allowed for better living conditions for her whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater inventory of motorcycle replacement parts

loans.name: Ndiack

texts.fr: NDiack N. est une femme de  30 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAMAKHEUL depuis 3 ans et y a reçu 6 fois de suite de crédit qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter 5 paires de moutons qu'elle va engraisser pendant au moins 4 mois pour aller ensuite revendre au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Par ailleurs elle mène une activité parallèle qui consiste la vente de denrées alimentaires. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des différentes dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Ndiack N., aged 30, is married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of the credit association of Diamakheul for three years and was granted six consecutive loans which she always managed well and repaid on schedule. Ndiack breeds cattle. This new loan will enable her to buy 5 couples of sheep. She will fatten them for at least four months and then sell them at the weekly trade fair of her village. At the same time she runs a grocery store. Her aim is to help her husband to provide for the family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital and buy sheep

loans.name: Jackline Olima

texts.en:
Jackline Olima N. sells electronics, a business she started in 2009 due to demand. Drop in demand made her quit her former business of selling plastics. Despite being married, Jackline plays a very pivotal role in supporting the family. She is currently 40 years old, married, and has two (2) children. This family is living in Nambale Busia Kenya. Jackline travels as far as Nairobi once a month to buy her stock.

Jackline would like to expand her business so as to improve her living standard. She would wish to get a loan worth KES 20,000.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Ketty Del Rocio

texts.es:
Ketty de 26 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín (llamado así por sus montañas y caminos de tierra) de Guayaquil. tiene un niño de 4 años, su papa le enseño a arreglar teléfonos cuando tenia 18 años, cuando creció no tuvo oportunidad de trabajar y tuvo que practicar lo que su papa le enseño, arreglando los teléfonos de sus amigos. 

Ahora ella tiene un puesto de reparación y venta de artículos de teléfonos,  trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 20h00pm todos los días, para tener mas variedad quiere comprar con el préstamo teléfonos, cargadores, carcasas de celulares. 

En el futuro quiere que su negocio se extienda con una línea de locales de reparación.
texts.en:
Ketty, 26, lives in the Fortín area of Guayaquil, an urban hillside area with dirt roads that is located in outskirts of the city of Guayaquil. She has a 4 year-old son. Her father taught her to fix telephones when she was 18. Later, when she was grown, she did not have a job and so had to practice what her father taught her, fixing the telephones of her friends. Now she has a post where she repairs and sells telephones and telephone accessories. She works from 8am until 8pm every day. In order to have a greater variety of products, she wants to buy telephones, chargers, and cell phone housings with this loan. In the future, she wants to extend her business to include a line of repair shops.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: chargers, phones

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
El Señor Joaquín ascarragal tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero y es padre de  2 hijos, a los cuales cría y ayuda en su educación, la madre de sus hijos lo abandono ya como 4 años, él vive en Villa Cristal con su mama y sus 2 hijos.  

Joaquín es un señor muy dedicado a su trabajo, tiene un lote agrícola muy pequeño en el Sindicato de Santa Ana D que está a 2 ½ Km de la carretera Cbba.- Sta. Cruz, el cultiva   mandarina y otros cítricos y por las noches se dedica al servicio de moto taxis en un sindicato de moto taxista “Carrasco” en Ivirgarzama porque él vela y mantiene a sus dos hijos y ayuda en sus estudios, el mayor tiene 7 años  y el menor tiene 5 años.  

El señor Joaquín se apersono a las oficinas en busca de un crédito para la compra de plantines de naranja para poder incrementar la producción de cítricos y así poder tener más ingresos para el bienestar de sus hijos y un futuro mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Joaquín Ascarragal is 30 years old, single, and the father of two children he is raising and sending to school. The mother of his children abandoned them four years ago. He and his children live with his mother in Villa Cristal.

Joaquín is very dedicated to his work. He has a small plot of farmland in the township of Santa Ana D, which is 2½ kilometers from the Cochabamba-Santa Cruz Highway. He grows tangerines and other citrus fruits. At night he provides motorcycle taxi services as a member driver of the Carrasco taxi union in Ivirgarzama. This enables him to support and educate his two children, ages 7 and 5.

Sr. Joaquín visited the offices of CIDRE to apply for a loan in order to buy orange tree saplings so that he can increase his citrus fruit production. This will enable him to earn more income for the welfare of his children and a better future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase orange tree saplings

loans.name: Kyaitamba Tweyambe Group

texts.en: Annet is a 35-year-old woman and a single mother. She heads a family of six people living in a house Annet has constructed through her own efforts. She operates a restaurant in which she sells food and drinks. She has been in the business for the last five years. Before starting her business, Annet was working for a plantation as a casual labour. She says prospects are promising and she hopes to see her business progress to the next level. Annet is a member of the group called "Kyaitamba Tweyambe". There are 10 members with two women and eight men. This is a solidarity kind of borrowing where each of the members is a guarantor to the others to ensure that they all meet their obligations on time and in equal amounts. This is the group’s first loan cycle, and Annet intends to use the loan funds to purchase wheat flour to make mandazi (a donut-like pastry) for her restaurant business. In the picture, Annet is raising her arm.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour for her restaurant to make "mandazi"

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en: Guillerma F. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 50 years old. Guillerma is married and has 11 children. Her eldest is aged 32 and she still has children who go to school. She dreams for her children to finish college and have bright futures. To make a living, Guillerma raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Guillerma has been engaged in her business for more than 30 years. Guillerma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guillerma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Guillerma is requesting a new loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be the third loan taken out by Guillerma from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI), has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also offers savings, insurance, and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a single mother with three children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses includes food, rent and school fees.

Constance owns a store in Naguru selling charcoal which she buys in bags from Luwero and Nakasongola districts. She uses her own lorry (truck) to and from buying charcoal. She has been in this business for over ten years, selling in Naguru market. She works six days a week and sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale. Her only business challenge is the rainy season when the roads becomes impassable.

Constance joined MCDT because of the low interest rate it charged. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She is aspiring to own another delivery van.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mariano Guadalupe

texts.es:
Mariano Guadalupe nació en el distrito de Chinchero de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento Cusco y tiene 54 años. Actualmente, Mariano Guadalupe vive en la misma ciudad donde nació.

Mariano Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de golosinas, galletas, gaseosas, él socio tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en el mercado de Chinchero. Mariano vende sus productos a los turistas nacionales y extranjeros que visitan la zona arqueológica de chichero. Le pueden encontrar en su negocio los 7 días de la semana, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la noche o hasta que los turistas se retiren del lugar.

Con su próximo préstamo, Mariano Guadalupe que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates, etc. 

El banco comunal “Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero” tiene dos años y medio de funcionamiento, Mariano Guadalupe pertenece desde hace dos años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. El nombre del banco comunal es un término que en quechua (el idioma autóctono) significa “Princesa Hermosa de Chichero”.
texts.en:
Mariano Guadalupe was born in the district of Chinchero, Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco. He is 54 years old. He still lives in the same town in which he was born. Mariano sells candy, cookies, soft drinks from a small stand in the Chinchero market to local and overseas tourists who visit the archeological sites of Chinchero. He can be found at his stand seven days a week, from 7 am to 6 pm or until the tourists leave the area. With his next loan Mariano hopes to receive 1000 soles which he will use to buy merchandise such as candy, soft drinks, cookies, chocolate etc. The Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero community bank has been in existence for two and a half years. Mariano has been with the bank for two years and all is going well. The name of the bank comes from the local Quechua language and means ‘Beautiful Princess of Chinchero’.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy candy, soft drinks, cookies, chocolate etc.

loans.name: Edin Percy

texts.es:
Edin tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable que pertenece a la región del mismo nombre y que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.
