She hopes to use the funds to buy more grocery stock for resale (cabbages, onions, and tomatoes) and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, onions, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Vuochteang's Group

texts.en:
Vuochteang is fifty-six years old, married and lives in a village of the Sa Ang district of Cambodia. She has four children, one of whom works at a garment factory.

Vuochteang has been earning a living by growing and selling taro for the past twenty years. She currently earns less than 4 USD each day to feed her family.

Vuochteang has been with VisionFund for two years, and she has successfully paid back her loans with them. Now she leads a group of three members who are applying for a 2,800,000 KHR loan.

With her portion of the loan, Vuochteang wants to buy taro seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow more taro to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy taro seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en:
Venantie is 50 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 6 and 17.All of them go to school. She has been running a business selling clothes for the past three years. She will use the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

Venantie plans to use the profits from her business to pay her children's school fees and provide food for the family. In the future, she would like to own a big shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Jom est mis en place depuis le 30 décembre 2009, il est composé de neuf femmes issues du même village. L'activité dominante est le petit commerce.



La responsable Kiné est âgée de 42 ans,elle est mariée mère de trois enfants et a en charge son petit fils; elle mène une activité de petit commerce de légumes et fait parallèlement de l'élevage de moutons, elle a une bonne expérience dans ces secteurs. Sur la photo elle est assise à droite avec un châle bleu-blanc autour des épaules.

Elle achéte les légumes ( choux,aubergines, carottes,navets....) et les moutons dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour revendre dans son village. 


Son prêt lui servira à diversifier et agrandir ses activités afin de se faire beaucoup de revenus sur les légumes et moutons.


Elle aide son mari pour les dépenses de la famille sur le plan scolaire et sanitaire et souhaite développer son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bokk Jom was established on December 30, 2009. It comprises nine women from the same village. The dominant work is small-scale commerce. 

Kiné is the group's official and is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She also has a grandson to support. Her small business involves vegetables and concurrently the raising of sheep. She has good experience in these sectors. In the photo, she is seated at the right and wearing a blue-white shawl around her shoulders. 

Kiné purchases vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, carrots, turnips…) and sheep from the weekly markets and then sells them in her village. 

Her loan will serve to diversify and expand her businesses in order to make a lot of income from the vegetables and sheep. 

She helps out her husband with the family expenses with regard to schooling and health care. And she wishes to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Maria Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MARIA est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Julienne, celle qui a la main levée sur la photo est âgée de 52 ans et est mariée à un certain Gabriel. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Julienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par le couple. Julienne n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour y arriver, Julienne vend du sodabi (boisson locale) par la technique de distribution depuis trente ans. Julienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Julienne ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MARIA, sollicitent un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter de boisson alcoolisée locale

loans.name: Marthe

texts.fr:
Marthe a 32 ans, elle est mariée. Le couple a trois enfants de 4, 11, et 13 ans et ils sont tous scolarisés dont deux dans des écoles privées.  La famille habite dans une maison que le couple vient de construire. Leur rêve est la réussite des enfants dans leurs études et l’existence de source de revenus suffisants à la retraite. 
Marthe a comme activité la vente des chaussures à l'occasion. Avant, les produits vendus étaient les tissus, mais compte tenu du marché,  elle a changé de produits. L’activité a été hérité de sa sœur. En effet, au début, elle vendait les produits qui ne sont pas écoulées par sa sœur. Petit  à petit, elle s’est mise à son propre compte pour être autonome.

loans.use: acheter des chaussures à l'occasion

loans.name: Venko

texts.en:
Everybody in the town knows Venko K.. He is one of the most popular carpenters in the region. For 15 years he worked in the wood factory in town but 3 years ago, he decided to start his own business.

His workshop is on the first floor of the house he builds for 6 years. Venko K. makes any kind of woodwork – furniture, doors, windows, frames. Smolian is close to one of the most popular winter resorts in Bulgaria and therefore lots of hotels and houses are being built nearby. So Venko has many orders for these buildings.

He works alone and nobody helps him but although the work is hard he is not complaining. All the money he earns he puts into the house he builds. There is still to much work until the house will be finished but his dream is to live there with his family.

loans.use: Buying wood for his work

loans.name: Ninet

texts.en: S. is a market woman who sells used clothing. She buys the clothing in bales and later retails them to her community's market. Of late she is unable to go to the market to sell because she cannot buy in bales to sell. She needs assistance of $750 from Kiva to enable her to buy clothes in bales to sell.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Naomi wants to buy a dairy cow and animal feeds.

loans.name: Queen Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Queen Victoria O. is a good cook who learnt her business for 5 years. She started her business in the year 2002 in the area of Asaba, Delta State. She is 37 years old, married with four children. She needs a loan of $550 so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Aged 24, Mrs. Ablavi Z. is the mother of three children and lives with her husband in difficult conditions. Her husband is illiterate and has no trade to speak of. The children’s future is in jeopardy. But the bravery of this young woman gives the household much hope. Having obtained an initial loan of $300, she set up a small grocery business. Today, having repaid her loan, she is asking once again for help with the sum of $750, which she can put into the business. Supporting this family is also a humanitarian act for the children's future.

Agée de 24 ans, Madame Z. Ablavi est mère de trois (3) enfants et vit avec son mari dans des conditions difficiles. Le mari analphabète n’a aucun métier sous la main. L’avenir des enfants est presque compromis. Mais le courage de cette jeune femme donne beaucoup d’espoir au foyer. Avec un premier crédit de $300 qu’elle avait obtenu, elle a initié un petit commerce d’alimentation générale. Aujourd’hui, après avoir bien remboursé son crédit, elle sollicite de nouveau un appui d’un montant de $750 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce. Soutenir cette famille est aussi une œuvre humanitaire pour l’avenir des enfants.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buying and selling of general foodstuffs

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.en: For eleven years I have had this little business selling food in the market for San Miguel in the town of Guanacaste, Honduras. I have quite a few clients because they like the soups and foods such as meat, rice and salads. The soups of beef and vegetables are very delicious. Now I need to buy more meat and vegetables to make my meals, and help my family with the income from the sales.

loans.use: Buy vegetables, beef, chicken, condiments and more

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es:
Margoth is a hard-working exemplar mother. Since she formed her family next to her husband, she started working full-time in onion farming and production. She is very efficient at this work because of all of the experience she gathered working next to her parents year after year. This laborious job which she performs passionately fills her with optimism and joy because these efforts go directly to benefit her only recently born daughter.

The wish of this exemplar mother is to build the house that she's always dreamed about but has never been able to make a reality. In order to make her dreams come true she is requesting a money loan. She will invest this capital into her daily activities in order to obtain more profits from her sales. She promises to use your help appropriately. Her and her diligent husband appeal to our support to concrete their plans.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Margoth, es una empeñosa y ejemplar madre, que desde que formó su familia junto a su esposo, se dedicó por completo a la labor de cultivo y producción de cebollas; actividad que realiza eficientemente gracias a la experiencia que fue adquiriendo año tras año junto a sus padres.Esta laboriosa labor que desempeña apasionadamente la va llenando de optimismo y alegría, porque su esfuerzo se desplega en beneficio de su única y querida hija que acaba de nacer.El deseo de esta ejemplar madre es realizar junto a su familia la construcción de su anhelada casita, sueño que hasta ahora no han podido efectuar y para concretar sus planes solicita un préstamo de dinero, capital que invertirá en su actividad diaria a fin de obtener mayores ganancias con la venta de sus productos, así mismo promete utilizar adecuadamente tu ayuda. Ella y su diligente esposo apelan a nuestro apoyo para concretar sus planes.

loans.use: Increment capital for production growth.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị T., 50 years of age, has been a member of the TYM Fund since 1997. She is living with her husband and three children. In addition to farming its six acres of rice paddy, the family is running an animal husbandry business. The stock is usually composed of hundreds of pigs, hundreds of egg laying hens and chickens for meat, the main source of food for near by poultry processing plants and people in the area. As the result of her efficiency, the income of Mrs. T.’s family has increased from 50USD, before her joining the Fund, to 160USD a month, currently. She figures that in order to expand the family’s animal husbandry business she would need to apply for a loan of 775USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị T., 50 tuổi, là thành viên vào Quỹ từ năm 1997. Chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con. Gia đình chị làm 6 sào ruộng. Ngoài việc làm T.ần nông chị còn mạnh dạn cùng chồng đầu tư chăn nuôi gia súc gia cầm. Trong chuồng nhà chị lúc nào cũng có hàng trăm con lợn thịt, vài trăm con gà thịt và đẻ, cung cấp nguồn thực phẩm rất giá trị cho các nhà máy thức ăn gia súc gần nhà chị và cho người dân trong vùng. Nhờ làm ăn có hiệu quả T. nhập của chị T. tăng từ 50USD/tháng (trước khi vào Quỹ) lên 160USD/tháng. Để việc đầu tư phát triển chăn nuôi hiệu quả chị T. rất cần vốn để phát triển chăn nuôi với quy mô lớn hơn, chị đang đề nghị mức vốn vay là 775USD.

loans.use: Expanding the family's animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S., 42, works with her husband on their rice paddy growing rice and various kinds of vegetables, making collectively about $5 each day from selling their output. One of her children is employed by a nearby garment factory and one is a student. Mrs. Chea S. and her husband would like to request a loan to purchase a large quantity of peppers from the growers and resell them for a profit, and the leftover of the money is to buy more seeds and fertilizer for their crop expansion.

loans.use: To purchase large quantity of pepper from the growers and resell them for a profit, and the leftover of the money is to buy more seeds and fertilizer for their crop expansion.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
When the TYM Fund came to Thanh Lâm village in May, 2000, Mrs. Hoàng Thị Tất, 49 years old, checked out the organization then decided to join. At that time, the family’s economy was in deep hardship. Her oldest son just got a construction job, and there was nothing else besides farming a little patch of rent rice paddy. For dwelling, they got a modest [i]three section[/i] hut. She took out loan to invest in her new business, trading vegetable and grain. With her income, income from her son’s construction job and together with a loan from her relatives, she is building their first house which costs 10,000USD. This time she is applying a loan of 950USD to buy more grain. The monthly family’s income is 22-USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Tháng 5 năm 2000, khi Quỹ Tình thương về xã Thanh Lâm, sau khi tìm hiểu, chị Hoàng Thị Tất, 49 tuổi, là một trong những thành viên đăng ký tham gia. Điều kiện gia đình chị lúc ấy thuộc diện khó khăn, con trai lớn mới đi làm, ngoài vài sào ruộng khoán ra chị cũng không biết làm gì thêm. Ngôi nhà 3 gian tạm bợ, tuềnh toàng tránh mưa nắng rất khổ cực. Sau khi tham gia vay vốn, chị Tất luôn sử dụng đúng mục đích và có hiệu quả, con trai lớn đi xây dựng cũng có ý thức tiết kiệm cho gia đình. Ngoài ra chị cũng có thêm nghề phụ là hàng ngày thu mua rau ngô bao tử đặt hàng cho khách hàng Hà nội. Sau bảy năm tham gia Quỹ với sự tự tin, cần cù, chịu khó, chị Tất đã tích lũy được một số vốn. Cộng với vốn vay họ hàng, chị đang xây dựng căn nhà mới rất khang trang trị giá hơn 10000USD. Khi chúng tôi đến hai vợ chồng chị niềm nở tiếp chúng tôi và không giấu được niềm vui mừng khi ngôi nhà mơ ước của anh chị đang được cất lên. Tâm sự của anh chị là tiếp tục gắn bó với Quỹ để xây dựng cuộc sống gia đình ngày càng ấm no, tốt đẹp hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị Tất xin vay 950USD để thu mua rau ngô bao tử. Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình là 220USD.

loans.use: Buy grain

loans.name: Marta Felipa

texts.es:
Marta Felipa B. is a strong woman worthy of being a role model to others due to how hard she works in her business raising cattle, which is the sole source of supporting her four small school-aged children who also help their mother when they have the time to do so.

From a young age she has dedicated herself to this difficult work which makes it possible for her to support her family without any difficulty. Today she finds herself in need of buying calves to raise and therefore she is seeking CEPRODEL’s support in obtaining a loan that would enable her to buy these animals and continue to support her home and family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Marta Felipa B. es una dama muy esforzada y digna de imitar debido a que trabaja fuertemente en el negocio de crianza de ganado con el único fin de mantener a sus cuatro pequeños hijos en edad escolar y que también apoyan a su madre cuando tienen tiempo de hacerlo.

Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a esta pesada labor con la que hace posible mantener a su familia sin ningún problema. La necesidad atravesada por ella hoy en día es la compra de vaquillas para la crianza y es por este motivo que busca apoyo en CEPRODEL para obtener créditos directos que le permitan la compra de estos animales y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar que tanto necesita de ella.

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Elsa Teodita

texts.es:
Elsa Teodita V. Saavedtra lives in the department of San Martin, province of Moyabamba, district of Moyobamba. Her business is located in one of the markets of the city called Ayaymaman and she is dedicated to the sale of fruits that are produced in our region of the forest.

The idea for her business arose from the need to move her family forward and to support her husband to improve their income. She joined the "Ayaymaman" Communal bank where they gave her the opportunity to be able to undertake her business for which she is very thankful.

With the loan of 1500 soles which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest it in the purchase of more fruits, such as: bags of oranges, sapotes (a native fruit), pineapples, bunches of bananas, avocados, pears, lemons in hundreds, boxes of papayas and more.

The lady Elsa is 34 years old and has 3 children that, along with her and her husband, are their company; they work together, sharing their lives.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Elsa Teodita V. S. , vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de Moyabamba, distrito de Moyobamba, tiene ubicado su negocio en uno de los mercados de la ciudad denominado “Ayaymaman” y se dedica a la venta de frutas que se producen en nuestra región de la selva.

La idea del negocio surgió ante la necesidad de sacar adelante a la familia y apoyar a su esposo para mejorar sus ingresos, ingresa al banco Comunal “Ayaymaman” en donde le dieron la oportunidad de poder emprender su negocio por el que esta muy agradecida.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de más frutas, como son: sacos de naranja, sapotes, piñas , racimos de plátanos, paltas, limón en cientos, cajas de papaya y otros;

La señora Elsa tiene 34 años, 03 hijos que están con ella y su esposo quienes son su compañía, trabajan juntos, compartiendo sus vidas .

loans.use: To buy fruits, such as: bags of oranges, sapotes (a native fruit), pineapples, bunches of bananas, avocados, pears, lemons in hundreds, boxes of papayas and more.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 40 year-old Severina W.. She is married, and has four children between the ages of 12 and 27. Two of her sister’s children also live with her and rely on her support. In 2000, Severina opened her general store and takeaway kiosk. She has applied for this loan in order to purchase additional stocks of beer, soda, rice, oil, and soap in bulk. Severina thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. For example, when a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. This is a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. They are, therefore, labelled ‘not-creditworthy’ by financial institutions because they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services, for women with low incomes.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beer, soda, rice, oil, and soap in bulk

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreng S., 51, is a widow and runs her own business at home selling bottles of gasoline to people who use a motor-bike or other type of vehicle in her town. She also has a sewing and clothing design business and makes custom clothing to her client's specifications. Both business activities bring a profit of around six dollars per day of net income.

Two of her children are married and live outside the family’s home. One son who is single lives with her and works as a taxi driver. All income he makes is contributed to his mother.

The taxi business is going well from day-to-day but the taxi is often broken. Mrs. Sreng S. has decided to request a loan from KIVA in the amount of $1000. This money, along with her savings, will allow her son to purchase a new taxi for his business and save them the constant cost of repairs.

loans.use: To purchase a new car for a taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of beauty soap, shampoo and also cakes and sweets for a small business.

loans.name: Thioya

texts.fr: Thioya S. est une femme de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 02 enfants avec 05 autres en charge. Elle souhaite un prêt qui lui permettra de préparer et de vendre du lait caillé et en même temps du thiackry (met préparé à base de lait caillé et de semoule). Elle pourrait ainsi améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et plus particulièrement des enfants. <b>voici son premier prêt qu’elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance<b/>.
texts.en:
Thioya S., 51, is married and the mother of 2 children with 5 others for whom she is responsible. She is hoping for a loan that will allow her to prepare and sell sour milk and at the same time "thiackry" (a dish prepared with sour milk and cream of millet). This will permit her to improve living conditions for her family, most especially for the children. This is her first loan and she will reimburse it at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: preparation and sale of sour milk

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is 22 years old and single. She has been a food seller since 2006. She works every day from 7 am to 4 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

Mwanahawa is now seeking a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 23 years old and lives in Beirut, where he is an automotive electrician. Ali has noticed that recently many Lebanese, particularly young people, are opting to install more advanced stereos in their cars, and Ali wishes to capitalize on this trend by purchasing several models for his shop. To fund this significant investment, he has requested a loan of 1000 US Dollars from Al Majmoua. This will be Ali's third loan with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: The loan will be used to help Ali purchase new stock for his auto electrical repair business

loans.name: Keng

texts.en: Keng S., 26, resides in the Kampong Cham with his old mother and one brother who works as a soldier. Since 2006, he has been working as a taxi-driver to earn a living and is able to make US$3 each day, while his mom, Chhouk Kan, 60, stays at home selling soft drinks. She makes around US$1.50 per day. Currently, the car is broken so Keng S. would like to take out a loan of US$250 to fix his car.

loans.use: To repair the car.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 29-year-old single man living in Jalala in the Bekaa valley. In 2000, Ahmad decided to open his own business as a hairdresser. Naming his barbershop Chanel, the young man caters to a wide range of clientele in the village and its neighborhoods. Today, Ahmad wishes to improve the decor of his barbershop and buy specially designed barber chairs. In order to do so, Ahmad is requesting $1,200.

loans.use: Buy specially designed barber chairs

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 45-year-old married man with two children, living in Ansar, Nabatieh, southern Lebanon. He owns a piece of land where he stocks scrap metal. Ibrahim buys and sells this scrap metal and now he has found well-priced merchandise in the amount of US$ 1,000, which can be sold for a greater amount and will help him excel in his career.

loans.use: Buy well-priced scrap metal for re-sale

loans.name: Freddy Ramon

texts.es:
El Señor de nombre Freddy Ramón V. C. tiene la edad de 34 años, su estado civil es casado Don Freddy tiene 2 hijas su edades son las siguientes su hija mayor de 19 años de edad y cursa el 1 año de su carrera y su otra hija de 13 años de edad cursa el 2 año de bachillerato, su compañera de vida labora como comerciante, los propósitos de   Don Freddy son de mantener la actividad económica por lo cual es su medio de trabajo y además el medio de sustento de su familia, sus sueños don de asegurar el futuro de sus hijas para que el día de mañana logren ser unas profesionales y puedan servir a la sociedad ya que la situación que enfrentamos en el país esta muy difícil y no todos los jóvenes tienen la oportunidad de estudiar ya que sus padres no cuentan con los recursos necesarios para apoyarlos con los estudios, sus deseos son de que sus hijas logren seguir con este medio de trabajo y que logren ampliarlo ya que esto les beneficiara para sus futuro y no se perderá la tradición familiar de este humilde trabajo.


La actividad económica a la que Don Freddy se dedica es a la sastrería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación y además de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 13 años, Don Freddy dio inicio a esta actividad con el apoyo de su hermana y por su Mama quienes ya tienen años de dedicarse a esta digna actividad por lo que al comenzar no fue tan difícil ya que su Mama le enseño a realizar faldas para damas por lo que al principio le costo mucho trabajo elaborarlas ya que presentaba problemas por lo que su Mama le enseña a realizar pantalones para caballeros y le resulta mucho mas fácil realizar los pantalones por lo que su Mama  le ayuda a que se instruya mas en este campo por lo que mas tarde decide independizarse de su Mama y establecer su propio negocio con el fin de sacar adelante a su familia por lo que empezó con un maquina de coser y ciertos encargos de sus amigos y familiares y es así como da comienzo a su trabajo a pesar de las dificultades que paso por obtenerlo, el  financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que es necesario la compra de materia prima como: tela, alfiler, tijeras, hilos y botones ya que sus encargos son solo uniformes por lo que no quiere perder la oportunidad de trabajar.
texts.en:
Freddy Ramon V. C., 34, is married and has two daughters, ages 19 and 13. The older daughter is a freshman in college and the younger is in middle school. Freddy's wife works in sales. Freddy hopes to continue working and support his family. His dream for his daughters is that both receive a college education, become productive citizens and that they continue the family business. Freddy is a tailor. He works off his home and he also goes door to door offering his services. He has been a tailor for 13 years. He started this business with the help of his mother and sister, who are both seamstresses. First, his mother taught him to make ladies' skirts, and then how to make men's pants. Later he started to work on his own to support his family, with one sewing machine and orders from a few customers. The loan Freddy is requesting will be used as work capital to purchase fabric, needles, scissors, thread and buttons, to make uniforms.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Sha  Gull Group

texts.en:
Sha gull is the group leader of the Sha gull group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to take a loan for their own business. The total amount of their group loan is 58,800 Afghani for the term of 11 months.
Nafesa wants to take a loan for her husband’s repair shop. bibi gull wants to take a loan for her son’s general store. Rana wants to take a loan for her husband's mechanic business and Sha gull wants to take a loan for her husband's business as a taxi driver. Their want to buy necessary materials for their businesses. 
They are confident that with the money they receive can have a good profit and can run their business in a good way. These women are happy about the loan process and want to say that it will support the entrepreneurs a lot.

loans.use: They want to buy the necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Jonas

texts.fr:
Né en 1970 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique-Porto Novo-du Bénin, D. Jonas réside dans le 3e arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo. Jonas est père de cinq (05) enfants dont  quatre (04) sont scolarisés. Jonas est un technicien en électronique et en a fait son activité principale. Cette activité lui procure des revenus l’aidant à gagner sa vie. L’électronique étant une activité qui nécessite de grands moyens, Jonas ne dispose pas assez de fonds pouvant lui permettre de satisfaire le grand nombre de clients et se faire  plus de revenus à la hauteur de ses différentes charges. C’est donc pour rendre plus performant son atelier que Jonas sollicite un crédit.
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Bénin, Mr. D. Jonas resides in the 3rd district of Porto-Novo. He is the father of five children, of whom four are in school. Jonas is an electronics technician and has made this trade his principal work. It brings in the revenues that help him to earn his living. Since electronics is a field requiring significant means, he lacks enough funds for allowing him to satisfy the large number of customers and for earning enough to meet his various responsibilities. Thus, in order to make his workshop more competitive, Jonas is requesting a loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electronic equipment

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa manages a small store in her village. She is planning to continue her business to support the education of her two children. Evangeline is twenty-four years old and a fourth year nursing student. May is twelve and an elementary student.  Elsa is fofty-four years old and can be described as a responsible mother and a good wife to Guillermo. 

She wanted to purchase more merchandise for her store, especially now that peak season is approaching.  She hopes to buy different commodities such as soft drinks, breads, biscuits and other items that are in demand during harvest season.  This is the reason why Elsa would like to borrow $100 to support her enterprise.  She hopes that her loan request will be granted and that she may achieve her goals someday.

loans.use: Business Support

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret B. started her local restaurant 20 years ago in Takroase, a suburb of Akim Oda, where she lives. Takroase is a mining community where most of the young ones have occupied themselves with the mining business. She identified the opportunity of providing food when she realized people need good, tasty meals to satisfy their hunger. Since then, she has become one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood.

She is now 38 years old and married with eight children. Six of her children are in school while the rest are working. She serves many kinds of local dishes like fufu, banku and fried fish, among others. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup.

She says demand for her food is increasing but her problem has to do with funds to buy more raw materials. She requests a loan to buy increased supplies of cassava, maize, fish, firewood, etc., to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance. Margaret belongs to a village bank called 1st kings.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish and firewood

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
"I was really a farmer since I was just a small kid. Now, that I have a family, I am working very hard with my husband to improve our livelihood", says Nenita A. to CEVI. "My husband has a farm and we are using it now to feed our children. We both belong to a clan of farmers. We dream of buying more lots to increase the size of our business".

Nenita is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides and seeds. The loan will really help her to increase her yield. Hence, more income for her family.

CEVI aims to help small businesses grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, herbicides and seeds.

loans.name: Barnokhon

texts.en:
U. Barnokhon is a single woman with no children. She lives with her parents and runs her own business. She sells kid’s clothing in the central market of Dushanbe. She has a wide variety of merchandise combined with reasonable prices. Barnokhon has been in this trade for 11 years. She is trying to do everything she can to provide for the well-being of her family. That is why she wants to continue expanding her business and growing her trade by increasing the number of her vending locations. Barnokhon is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni to sustain her business and help ensure it continues to provide enough income to live on.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more goods to increase her stock

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: C. Sambath, 43, pictured with her husband, is married and has five children – four of them are students, and the other is employed with a fair salary. Sambath has produced rice wine since 2000 and earns a daily income of $3.3 USD. In order to reduce the difficulty of supporting her children, she wants to take a loan of $600 USD from Kiva partner, CREDIT. She will use the loan to purchase more rice to make wine so that she can expand her business. Her perspective is that she wants to have a good standard of living by succeeding with her current business plan.

loans.use: To buy rice to make rice wine

loans.name: Abou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abou Koné est âgé de 27 ans et père de 2 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans la  quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni.(troisième administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, très vite il commença les activités génératrices de revenus. Pendant des années Monsieur Abou Koné faisait le transporteur des bagages avec un pousse-pousse. Il a pu économiser pour finalement ouvrir une boutique de ventes d’articles divers. Depuis 2 ans Monsieur Abou Koné vend au marché de Bougouni où il a sa boutique. Il est très sollicité et apprécié dans la ville de Bougouni
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, il décide de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel..
Avec ce prêt Monsieur Abou Koné compte acheter des articles divers pour sa boutique afin d’attirer  beaucoup plus de clientèle.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente au marché de Bougouni à une clientèle riche et variée.
 Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Abou Koné compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qu’il envisage investir exclusivement dans sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Abou Koné is 27 and the father of 2 children. He lives with his wife and children in the Hérémakono Nord district of the town of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having been able to go to school, he began early to earn his living. For years, Mr. Abou Koné transported baggage with a rickshaw. He was able to save up enough to open a little general store. For two years, Mr. Abou Koné has been selling at the market of Bougouni where he has his shop. He is much sought after and respected in the town of Bougouni.

In need of complementary financing, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is on his first individual loan. With this loan he intends to buy various items for his shop so as to attract more customers. He buys his merchandise in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) from wholesalers and makes his sales at the market of Bougouni to a vast and varied clientele. With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA which he hopes to invest exclusively in his shop.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing various items for re-sale

loans.name: Romualdo

texts.en:
Ever since Romualdo C. started to farm, he has always had an abundant harvest. This is because he always uses fertilizers and herbicides when he farms. He is 43 years old this year and still single. He needs capital to run his business. That is why he applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use his loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds. This loan will really help him achieve a better and more abundant harvest.

Romualdo has been actively participating in the CEVI credit program. He has loans, training and an insurance coverage package.

loans.use: To buy complete fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese F. is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Nuusuatia.  She is married and has 8 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Akenese raises crops.  Income for this business comes primarily from planting, harvesting, and selling breadfruit.  Akenese has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 300 Samoan tala (or about $125 US) from these activities.

Akenese joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Akenese has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1700 tala (or about $700) from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  Akenese is now requesting a new loan of 2400 tala (or about $925) which will be used to rent land to raise additional crops.  The loan will be Akenese's 4th loan from SPBD.  Akenese plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To rent land to raise additional crops

loans.name: Teresa Antonio

texts.pt:
Teresa Antonio C. nasceu no distrito de Boane, de 35 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 8 e 18 anos que frenquentam escola no mesmo distrito. Estudou ate 3 classe tendo interrompido devido à falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores. Sustenta mais 3 sobrinhas que estão sob sua responsabilidade cujos pais faleceram vitimas de guerra dos 16 anos terminada no ano de 1992, com assinatura do acordo geral de paz assina em Roma.

Cresceu na companhia dos seus progenitores em boane e saiu da casa dos mesmos quando contraiu matrimonio. O seu marido, também, exerce actividade de venda de outro tipo de produtos assim como prestação de serviços de pedreiro a mais de 20 anos enquanto que a Teresa possui 10 anos de experiência em negócios e actualmente possui um espaço ao lado do mercado de Boane. Não tem trabalhadores. Aprendeu a fazer este tipo de negocio (venda de camas, cadeiras e outros artigos plásticos) com amigas e marido ajuda na gestão financeira do negocio.

O seu melhor são camas que compra na áfrica do sul a 4.700,00mt e revende a 6.800,00mt. Em media ganha 14.000,00mt que aplica no sustento da família e pagamento de credito e tambe pouca algum valor no banco comercial.

Teve informações sobre a Hluvuku-Adsema através de vizinhos residentes, tendo aproximado e desembolsado 10.000,00MT para aumentar o stock.
Com o presente credito de 17.000,00MT pretende comprar camas e  artigos plásticos para vender( cadeiras, bacias, e outros).

Propõe se a pagar o emprestimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos co o objectivo de concluir a sua obra de construção de casa de alvenaria.
texts.en:
Teresa Antonio C. was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo, Mozambique. She is 35 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children between the ages of 8 and 18, all enrolled in school. Her studies were interrupted in 3rd grade, due to her parents' financial difficulties. She is also responsible for 3 nieces, whose parents died during the 16-year war which ended in 1992. She left Boane when she got married. Her husband has a small retail business and over 20 years of experience as a construction worker. Teresa has 10 years of experience running her own retail business selling beds, plastic chairs and other articles made of plastic––an activity she learned from friends. She doesn't have any employees, and her husband helps her manage the finances. Her most profitable articles are the beds, which she buys in South Africa for 4.700,00MT and resell in Boane for 6.800,00MT. On average, she earns 14.000,00MT per month, which allows her to support her family, make loan payments, and put a little money into the savings account she has at the Commercial Bank of Mozambique. Teresa learned about Kiva and Hluvuku-Adsema through neighbors. She plans to use this 17.000,00MT loan––as she did with the first, in the amount of 10.000,00MT––to increase her stock. She expects to pay off this loan without difficulties and plans to apply for additional credit in the future, to finish building her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beds, chairs and other articles made of plastic, all for resale

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim N. is thirty years old. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also cares for another dependent who goes to school. 

She operates a retail shop where she has been selling cosmetics and water for over ten years. She is using the loan to purchase cosmetics, water, etc to sell. She is a determined entrepreneur whose dream is to obtain a grinding machine for maize so she can manufacture maize flour and supply it to the markets.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, water, etc for sale.

loans.name: Frazer

texts.en: Frazer C. is currently in the business of selling beer at the bar and is requesting a loan to purchase wines and more crates of beer to sell.  Frazer is 30 years old and is Married with a husband that is a business man. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a hotel for selling foodstuffs BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase wines and more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora ELENA R. R. , tiene 28 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal BELLAVISTA.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 3ero de secundaria.  Es conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo de 3 años de edad quien depende económicamente de ella.
ELENA se dedica a la venta de comida y gaseosas en su domicilio.
Actualmente se encuentra habilitando un lugar para que sea un restaurante en donde venderá comida y bebidas. El 18 de Octubre inaugurará su local.
El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de  productos alimenticios al por mayor para la preparación de sus menús (comida).
Este crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles lo utilizará en la compra de más productos (arroz, azúcar, fideos, huevos, conservas), cerveza, gaseosa y también invertirá en la remodelación de su local.
La empresaria sueña aperturaza pronto su local y tener acogida.

loans.use: compra de más productos como cerveza, gaseosa.  Invertirá en la remodelación de su local.

loans.name: Tanjudean

texts.en:
Tanjudean sells palm oil. He has been in this business for 10 years. He lives in Ogbomoso in Oyo State, Nigeria. He is 39 years old and married, and has a child. 

He wants a loan of N150,000 to purchase more palm kernel to produce oil. He hopes to increase his production to meet the demands of his customers. He thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernel for production of oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothes

loans.name: Carmen Lisseth

texts.es: Carmen Lisseth E. F. de 24 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad. Carmen posee una venta de tortillas en su casa, trabajo el cual le permite darle el sustento a su pequeño hijo, ya que Carmen es madre soltera, debe esforzarse el doble por brindarle todo lo necesario a su pequeño. Ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más maíz para la elaboración de las tortillas.
texts.en:
Carmen Lisseth E., 24, lives in Ciudad Arce, which is in the La Libertad department, with her little 3-year-old son. She sells tortillas from her home, a line of work that allows her to support her small son since Carmen is a single mother. She must work twice as hard to provide everything her child needs. She asks for financing to buy corn with which to make tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn.

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad has been working at plowing land. He is a 25-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Imad is known for his good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties.

Imad requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase an irrigation system for his work. This is his second loan cycle and he has always repaid on time. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase an irrigation system

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda T. is a 48-year-old single parent of three children whose ages range from ten to 22 years old. After having her own children to raise, Erlinda believes that dreaming is not just kids but for someone like her also. After her husband left her and her children, that striving to achieve that dream became so intense. For all her life as a mother, she didn’t want anything more to happen but for her children to experience life not being poor and for their future to be secured financially. Without her husband, her eldest 22-year-old son took the responsibility of helping her earn money being a laborer. Her son is also helping her in raising her two remaining children whose age range is from ten to 13 years old. Despite the many sacrifices and trials Erlinda has been through in her life, she found strength within herself and a vision to achieve. In order to take a step in reaching her goal she joined Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), KIVA field partner in the Philippines to be able to have an access to loan which she will going to use in starting a food and soft drinks selling business. Foods such as hotdogs and other frozen goods as well as soft drinks will be sold in her own house. With this kind of business, she can earn while staying at home and attending to her two children. Once she can make this business successful and will fully pay her loan, she wished to request for a bigger amount to enhance further her business.

loans.use: To finance her food selling business.

loans.name: Gloria Consuelo

texts.es:
la sra. Gloria Consuelo O. tiene 35 años de edad, vive en el barrio la Nueva Caucara en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, vive con su familia.
Gloria se dedica al comercio, vende cepillos de dientes, focos de mano, baterias, focos para casas, tijeras, corta uñas etc. estos productos los vende ambulantemente en diferentes barrios y colonas de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, los fines de semana vende su producto cerca del mercado municipal de San Lorenzo.
ahora necesita el credito ya que no tiene mucho producto y este se le esta vendiendo rapido, desea comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor. 
con las ganancias que tenga desea ir remodelando su casa poco a poco y asi darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Gloria Consuelo O. is 35-years-old. She lives with her family in the Nueva Caucara neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo. Gloria has a business selling toothbrushes, flashlights, batteries, lights for houses, scissors, nail clippers, etc. She sells these products as a street vendor in different neighborhoods and areas of the city of San Lorenzo. On the weekends, she sells her product near the city market of San Lorenzo. She needs a credit because she doesn't have much product left because she is selling it quickly. She hopes to buy more merchandise wholesale. With the profits, she would like to remodel her home little by little so she can give her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy batteries, flashlights, toothpaste, toothbrushes, lights, scissors, and nail clippers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Andres

texts.en: Andres is 55 years old and married to Soriana Cabral, who helps him with the household chores.  They have five children together who are now grown up, and some of whom work with Andres in producing and selling charcoal.  Andres inherited his profession from his father, with whom he worked since he was very young.  Andres starts work at 5 a.m., traveling to local corner stores to sell his charcoal.  One of his sons helps him sell the product, while another produces it.  Andres is seeking the loan to purchase wood for his business.

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: John Muturi

texts.en:
John is a 52-year-old gentleman who is married to Catherine and they are both farmers. They have one daughter, aged 20 years. John has been doing small-scale farming for the past ten years. He has been planting crops like maize and beans, but he specializes mostly with dairy farming.

He was introduced to Kadet through marketing outreach in his home town - Gatundu. He plans to purchase a Friesian dairy cow with the loan he has applied for, and with the extra income that he hopes to generate he will add still another dairy cow. 

He hopes to be a famous dairy farmer and he describes himself as a hardworking farmer.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anhtuya

texts.en: Anhtuya B. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a ger. Her two children attend a local secondary school. Currently, Anhtuya operates a meat trading business with her husband at Huchit Shonhor, the most popular food market in Mongolia. She has been operating this business since 2000 and has expanded her business with a loyal customer base. Recently, in 2009, Anhtuya and her husband purchased their own plot of land. They have been planning to build a house with a yard on their own land. Anhtuya is a very hardworking person. She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to increase her working capital and to purchase timbers for a yard that will be built on her land.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is married with two children. Both of her children go to school. She owns a two-room house where she stays with six people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Agnes takes care of additional family members.Agnes owns a food stall in  Kanyanya she sells bananas, cassava, tomatoes,  oranges and passion  friuts. She sells to all categories of people at retail and at wholesale. She works six days a week.Agnes receives at least 20 customers a day. She has been in this business for five years.  She has been with MCDT for many years servicing her 11th loan. Besides this food  business, she also owns rental houses. She wants to use this loan to buy bunches of bananas, boxes of tomatoes and sacks of cassava. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and start going directly to farmers. She joined MCDT because it was near her home and was giving out loans in groups.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, cassava and tomatoes

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Phen P., 60, is married and resides with his wife and four children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for its good quality rice products. He and his wife are butchers and sell pork for a gross income of about USD 50 per day.  

P. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase pigs to slaughter for pork to sell. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to expand his current business.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. P.'s wife is pictured here.

loans.use: To more pigs to slaughter for pork to sell

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
Memunatu B. (on the left in the photo) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Mansobrie village, about forty-five years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has five children, two of whom are still attending schools.

For over seventeen years now, Memunatu has been selling fish, rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), etc.

This is the first loan that Memunatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Memunatu will use her SLL 500,000 share of the loan to expand her business. She will buy fish, rice and palm-oil wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy more fish, rice and palm-oil wholesale

loans.name: Nancy Helida

texts.es:
Nancy es casada, tiene 2 hijos, Nancy tiene una tienda en un local céntrico en donD. venD. variedad D. productos como abarrotes en general, útiles D. escritorio, brinda servicio D. fotocopiado, y tiene cabina telefónica, su negocio esta ubicado al frente D. una escueL., actividad que realiza todos los días.
Nancy pertenece al Banco Comunal Violeta y necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles con el cual comprara gaseosas, azúcar, papeles.
Nancy sueña con educar a sus hijos y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy is married and has two children. She has a store in a central location. She sells a variety of products like general groceries and desk supplies. She also offers photocopy services, and she has a telephone booth. Her business is located in front of a school. She does this work everyday. Nancy belongs to the Violeta Communal Bank. She needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy soft drinks, sugar, and papers. Nancy dreams of educating her children and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, sugar, and papers

loans.name: Rosel

texts.es: Rosel, de 35 años, es un padre de familia muy trabajador, vive  con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en la casa de sus suegros.Se dedica a  prestar el  servicio de planchado y pintura para autos. Es especialista en el lijado y el empleo de masilla,  ya que dependerá del buen desempeño de su  trabajo, el acabado final de la pintura. Por muy maltratados que estén los parachoques o cualquier parte de las presentaciones  de los vehículos, él soluciona el problema uniformemente. Además sus clientes, son empresarios reconocidos  y algunos chóferes que lo vistan en su taller, que es alquilado. Trabaja en sociedad con su hermano, y pese a eso cuenta con un ayudante, con quien trabaja en conjunto para entregar los autos en el momento indicado. Se siente a gusto con lo que hace, ya que le es muy rentable; y  ya lleva 15 años realizando  esta actividad, y su mayor anhelo, para más adelante es instalar  su propio taller.Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete en  pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo.Rosel tiene planeado invertir el  dinero solicitado en la  compra de una  comprensora de aire para pintar y también un aspersor de sistema de planchados, para que sus trabajos resulten impecables.
texts.en:
Rosel, 35 years old, is the hard-working father of a family who lives with his wife and their 3 children in his in-laws house. He does auto body work and painting. He specializes in applying body filler and sanding and his success depends upon the quality of his work, especially how well he finishes and applies the paint. No matter how banged up the car is or which part is damaged, he solves the problem uniformly. Moreover, his clients are recognized business people and chauffeurs who are often seen in his rented workshop. He works jointly with his brother and, in addition, he employs an assistant with whom he works in order to deliver the cars at the indicated time. He enjoys what he does and it is very profitable. Rosel has been doing this for 15 years, and his greatest wish for the future is to install his own shop. This is his 1st loan with MFP, and he knows that credit will be very beneficial as a means of augmenting his capital. For that reason, he is committed to making all his payments on time. Rosel plans to invest the loan in purchasing an air compressor for painting and also, a paint sprayer so that his work will be impeccable.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING A COMPRESSOR AND PAINT SPRAYER FOR HIS AUTO REPAIR SHOP

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok N. 35 years old and lives in Roluos Village, Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhaom Nheb, are farmers who own three hectares of land to cultivate rice. In order to support this farming, Mrs. Sok N. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticides. Aside from farming, Mr. Chhaom is also a plowing machine driver, and he is able to earn a small income from his plowing machine to help support his family's living expenses. Mrs. Sok and Mr. Chhaom have three children, who all are students and also help out on the family farm. Mrs. Sok's husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticides to support a rice farm.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora N., 62 years old, is a widow, her husband having passed away some years ago. She has 9 children; some are married and some are in college. They live in the Nyamome area in Migori.

Flora has been selling maize for the last nine years. She does her business at Muhuru stage. Most of her clients buy the maize from her and take it to a maize grinding machine to be turned into flour. Flora's business has enabled her to support her family well and to cater for her children who are in college. She is applying for KES 20,000 as her fourth loan. She has a good credit history with Kadet since she has never defaulted on her loans. Flora expects to open up a bigger store where she will carry a larger stock of cereals. She also expects a big improvement to her business by using the loans from Kadet / Kiva to buy a grinding machine (posho mill) and improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy maize to add to her stock

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie A. is a married woman who lives in Bgry, Miranda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by fishing and fish vending.   Julie augments her income by selling home appliances as a freelance sales agent for one of the local appliance stores.  Her husband works as a fishermen, and he helps his wife.  They have five children who are seven to 21 years old.  

Julie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Julie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of PHP 10000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9000.  

This time, for her 12th loan, Julie is borrowing PHP 12000 to purchase more fishing nets so she can continue to save for her family's future.  Julie A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

--------------------------------------------------
About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishnet and additional capital

loans.name: Maria Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita resiD. en cantón el pedernal chilanga departamento D. Morazán, tiene 56 años D. edad vive con su esposo y un sobrino D. la edad D. trece años el niño depenD. D. los ingresos que felicita obtiene D. la tienda.
Tiene 10 años D. tener la tienda la cual la inicio por iniciativa propia viendo la necesidad D. recursos económicos que había en la familia, D. esta forma ella comenzó con pocos productos y viendo la demanda que hay con los clientes ella quiere aumentar su mercadería.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra D. boquitas,  granos básicos y bebidas carbonatadas por qué es lo que más se venD. en este tiempo D. crisis económica.
D. esta forma el crédito le ayudara a aumentar sus productos y tener variedad para satisfacer la demanda del cliente y así aumentaran las ventas y los ingresos que obtenga serán un poco más.
Sus aspiraciones es ser una vendedora mayoritaria D. productos básicos para el hogar y poder distribuir a otros negocios y D. esta forma poder asegurar el futuro D. su sobrino y su familia.
texts.en:
Felicita lives in Chilanga in the Morazán region. She is 56 years old and lives with her husband and her 13-year-old nephew, who is financially dependent on what Felicita earns in her shop. She has had her shop for 10 years. She opened the store by her own initiative because she needed help meeting her household's expenses. She began with a few products and demand from customers inspired her to expand her merchandise. She will invest this loan in the purchase of snacks, staple grains, and soft drinks, as these items still sell well despite the current financial crisis. The loan will help her expand her offerings to better meet the demands of her customers. This will increase sales and her income will be a little more. She hopes to one day be a wholesaler of products for the home and to be able to distribute these items to other businesses. This would ensure her future and that of her nephew and family.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of snacks, staple grains, and soft drinks

loans.name: Leiner

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  es el Sr. Leiner; La sociatiene 24 años de edad;  ella es soltera  y viene desde hace 2 años trabajando como administrador del grifo continental; La socia también tiene una tienda abarrotes la cual la trabaja en sus ratos libres y cuando él está ausente lo administra su familia. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar con mercadería su tienda abarrotes. La sociasolicita el préstamo para invertir en la implementación de su tienda abarrotes. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ms. Leiner is a member of the "PROSPERIDAD" ("Prosperity") community bank, which is located in the Huanchac district of Cusco province and in the department of Cusco. She is 24 years old and single. For the last two years, she has been working as an administrator at Grifo Continental. She also has a grocery story, where she works in her free time; her family runs it when she is away. Ms. Leiner is seeking a loan to buy merchandise for her store. She thanks you and appreciates getting a loan in this way. She promises to meet her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock for her store

loans.name: Mucee

texts.en:
Mucee N. is a 36-year-old married man and a father of three children. He operates a retail shop that has been in existence for the past three years now. The business is situated in Central Malindi town where it serves the town dwellers and passersby. 

The businessman was introduced to KADET LIMITED by another client of the company and this is the second time that he is taking a loan from the KADET LTD. The loan amounts to Kshs. 38,000 and Mr. Mucee is planning to use it to add stock to his shop. Mucee wishes to use the anticipated profit from the business continue educating his children, keep on looking after his family and to further expand his business so as to one day own a chain of shops or even to own a well established supermarket.

loans.use: To add stock to his retail shop

loans.name: Bashiran Abdul Majeed's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran A. M. is a housewife who spends her time at home doing household chores and taking care of her family. She lives in a mid-sized city called Vehari that is famous for its agricultural industry in Pakistan. Her husband’s name is A. M. whose tea stall in the market earns him income for his family. He has been in business for the past seven years. He is good at making tea and can make different and tasty-flavored teas such as green tea, milky tea, creamy tea and black tea. People of Pakistan are fond of tea. It is a Pakistani custom to serve guests a cup of tea first, then serve them food.

Bashiran has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan her husband will buy milk, sugar and tea for his tea stall. Bashiran is hopeful that this investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and that he will be able to make his income double in size by increasing his clientele.

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Bashiran.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar and tea for her husband's tea stall

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa J. is a 35 year old married lady with five children. She sells charcoal to residents of Barani in Malindi town where she resides. Asmaa has been operating the business for two years now she wishes to expand it with the loan she has taken.

This is the fourth time that Asmaa is taking a loan from KADET LTD. The loan amounts to Kshs.30,000 and the she intends to add more stock to her business as well as repair the business premises so as to propagate growth of the business. By growing the business, Asmaa will be able to satisfy her customers who are mostly from the local area and will also be able to look after her family.

Asmaa hopes to eventually own a wholesale charcoal business, selling to hotels around Malindi and to people residing outside the ever busy town.

loans.use: To expand the business by adding more stock of charcoal and repair the business premises

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine B. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has two children, both in school.  Catherine has a business  selling fruits and vegetables.  She has been in this business for three years, and she works six days out of every week.  Catherine sells her products at the market, both wholesale and retail.    

Catherine has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions and oranges, pineapples.     She also generates additional income through selling piped water. The main business challenges for Catherine include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to farmers directly and also to educate her children up to university.   

 Catherine lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more  boxes of tomatoes, onions, oranges and pineapples

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi is married with two daughters who are 9 and 13 years old.  He owns greenhouses and grows vegetables for sale.  Vitalyi has 15 spacious greenhouses and 3 separate ones for seedlings.  He started this farming enterprise 10 years ago.  Vitalyi started out small but has gradually expanded his business. He has already invested about 500,000 Grivnyas in his greenhouse business.  His expenses on seeds and polyethylene film amount to 80,000 Grivnyas every  year.  

Vitalyi is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to install heating units in 8 greenhouses. He is planning to plant and harvest 10,000 tall-grown tomatoes this farming season.  Vitalyi admits that the farming business has proved to be effective and profitable in this region. He sees the potential for the further growth of his venture in the future.

loans.use: To install heating systems in his greenhouses.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José Santos tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Olmos, caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en zonas rurales, pertenece a la ciudad de Lambayeque y queda ubicada a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina en donde se puede brindar servicio de transporte) con la que actualmente trabaja brindando servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en la ciudad de Olmos y sus caseríos, esta actividad tiene bastante acogida en la zona ya que este medio de transporte es muy utilizado por los pobladores para transportarse a sus domicilios que muchas veces quedan ubicados a varios kilometros de Olmos.

José Santos ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a brindar mantenimiento a su unidad móvil así como adquirir algunos accesorios para la misma. El ya ha trabajo anteriormente con un préstamo financiado a través del fondo Kiva y gracias a ese préstamo pudo realizar algunas reparaciones a su vehículo.

Jose Santos es un joven responsable y trabajador, con los ingresos que percibe ayuda a sus padres a sostener la economía de su hogar, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y adquirir mas mototaxis. El se encuentra bastante agradecido con las personas que han colaborado con el a través del fondo Kiva.
texts.en:
José Santos is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the Olmos district, where the majority of the population is concentrated in rural zones. This is part of Lambayeque city and it is located one hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He drives a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle with a cabin attached, where transport services are carried out) with which he provides cargo and passenger transport services in the city of Olmos and the surrounding areas.

This service is very welcomed in the region since the people often use mototaxis to get to their residences, often located many kilometers from Olmos. 

José Santos has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 soles to help him with the maintenance of his mototaxi and to purchase accessories for it. 

He has previously taken out a loan financed by Kiva funds, and thanks to that loan he was able to make repairs to his vehicle.  

Jose Santos is a responsible and hard-working young person. He uses his income to help his parents to sustain the household. His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman and to purchase M. mototaxis. 

He is very thankful for the people that have chipped in to his loan with Kiva funds.

loans.use: For the maintenance of his mototaxi and the purchase of accessories for it.

loans.name: Saira Eveling

texts.es:
Saira Eveling V. B. tiene 20 años. Unión Libre, vive con el compañero, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No  Tiene hijos 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS VENCEREMOS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto la America, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol gandul. 

Saira Eveling se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López  y en Agripac en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para hacer una casa.

Le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Saira Eveling V. B. is 20 years old.  She lives with her common-law partner in Ventanas Canton in Los Ríos Province.  She has no children. 

She is a member of the UNIDOS VENCEREMOS farm co-op, located in an area called America which belongs to the Ventanas Canton. This co-op grows short-cycle crops such as corn, rice and beans.

Saira Eveling specializes in growing corn, rice and beans. She buys products from Comercial López and Agripac in Ventanas, then sells them at the Ventanas market.

She is requesting a loan to buy farm equipment and fertilizer for her crops. The loan will help her purchase items to combat plagues, disease and climate change. She dreams of buying her own land so she can build a house one day.

She enjoys indoor games.

loans.use: To buy farm equipment and fertilizer

loans.name: Kirangara Group

texts.en:
Robert is single, 24 years old and hardworking. He lives in his own home in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has the zeal to work hard and save enough money. 

He has been growing tomatoes and preparing nursery beds for sale. He is a member of Kirangara Group and and his desire is to own at least ten acres of tomato garden in the next two years. Robert needs the loan to buy and plant tomatoes.

loans.use: Buying land and planting tomatoes

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica Odhiambo is married to John and they have four children; Murebith,Govan,Benson and Elvis who are all between the ages of 10 years and 18 years old.

Monica has a salon that she has been running for the past 11 years and is applying for her fourth loan from KADET LTD. She has a good credit history with KADET, as she has been paying back her loans well and in good time. She is in dire need of hair chemicals and hair piece for plaiting (type of hair style) her client's hair. She normally makes a profit of Kshs. 15,000 per month which is mainly used in paying school fees for her school going children. 

Her dream is to one day be able to own a big salon and open others in the neighbouring towns.

loans.use: Buy hair chemicals for treating hair and buy hair piece for plaiting

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is a married man with two children, both of whom are still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent.

He has operated a shoe-vending business for the past two years, selling in a shop to his neighbors, especially women. Amin faces a major challenge of paying the rent for his shop in his business. He hopes to establish his own shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase a bundle of shoes for resale. He decided to join Yehu because it is located near his area of operation.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of shoes for resale

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 52 years old and has six children, three of whom are working and three of whom are still school-aged. She has owned a restaurant in Ayacucho for two years now, and will be using her loan to buy supplies for food preparation such as rice and sugar. 

She used to sell grains at local markets and decided to open a restaurant to earn more profits. In the future she would like to improve and expand her restaurant, and perhaps move to a better location. 

Dina has been with FINCA Peru for four years now, and likes the savings, training, and overall business orientation that they proviD. to their members. She has been happy that she has been able to use her savings to help with her children's education.

loans.use: Restaurant supplies including rice and sugar

loans.name: Evans
