texts.en: Evans is 32 years old, married and blessed with two children. To earn a living, he sells green bananas. He has been in the business for five years and has been able to improve his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya. Evans hopes to become financially stable in the future. He needs this 30,000 KES loan to buy green bananas.

loans.use: to buy green bananas

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo quien se dedica a vender carbón por mayor en diferentes lugares   tienen una hija quien estudia. Ella tiene amplia experiencia en su negocio buena atención al cliente se dedica casi a tiempo completo a su tienda tiene  clientela segura por su buena atención, rapidez y extenso surtido en productos. Procura  tener surtida su tienda ya que la competencia siempre está a la orden del día.   Doña Elena asegura que el crédito anterior le ayudo a surtir, como también darle una mejor presentación a sus productos para asegurar el retorno de los mismos, ahora desea dar otro paso y expandir los servicios o seguir surtiendo con la venta de pollo y un poco de verduras. Por lo mismo desea  renovar su crédito. para la Compra de pollo y verduras.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 36 years old and lives with her husband who sells charcoal in different places, wholesale.  They have a daughter who is studying.

Elena has a lot of experience in her business and provides good customer service.  She works almost full time in her store and has a solid customer base because of her good customer service, her speed and her extensive stock of products.  She tries to keep her store well stocked since competition is always present.  Elena says that her previous loan helped her to stock her store and allowed her to better present her products in order to ensure their return.  She would like to take a step further, expand her services and continue stocking her store, selling chicken and some vegetables.  For this reason, she is renewing her loan to buy chicken and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy chicken and vegetables

loans.name: Gopi

texts.en:
Gopi K. lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband Mr. Karna Dhoj and seven children. She has four daughter and three sons. Some of her daughters are studying and some are working in a private office. All of her sons are studying in secondary school.

Both Mr. and Mrs. K. are engaged in their own fruit shop. They sell different varieties of fruit in their shop. They opened their fruit shop 5 years ago in Sanepa-chock. Now, Gopi is requesting a loan of Rs. 25,000.00 to buy fruit for their shop.

loans.use: to buys fruit for her shop

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 40 years old and married.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Margie is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Margie has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Santa Rita De Casia Group

texts.es:
Santa Rita de Casia se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita, gracias a que la actual presidenta, la Sra. Karina B., contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del programa logró juntar a 15 mujeres, quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en el 1° ciclo.
La sra. Karina se dedica a la venta de ropas, en especial de abrigos, por eso cuando se acerca el invierno sus clientes ya saben donde tienen que recurrir para comprar los mejores abrigos, originales en diseño y excelentes en calidad, por eso desea poder obtener este crédito de Kiva para comprar más abrigos y seguir ganando clientes, manteniendo su fama de buena vendedora en su ramo.
Ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia, y lo que más desea es poder sacar a sus familiares de la pobreza.
texts.en:
“Santa Rita de Casia” is the name of this fine group of women that was established in the city of Ita. Thanks to the current president, Sra. Karina B., they were able to get into contact with a loan officer during the weekly meeting that was held in the area. There they were informed about the work required for the Committee of Enterprising Women Program. Once they were informed about the program requirements, a group was established consisting of 15 women who are comfortable working with one another. They are participating in their first loan cycle.

Sra. Karina sells clothing, especially coats. When the winter season arrives, her customers know they can turn to her in order to buy the best coats that are original in design and of excellent quality. For this reason, Karina is obtaining a Kiva loan so that she can buy more coats to help her continue attracting customers. This will maintain her reputation as an excellent seller in her trade. Karina is a woman who is extremely dedicated to her family. What she desires most is for her family members to overcome poverty.

loans.use: to purchase coats to sell.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es: El señor Cristian tiene una café Internet y también trabaja como chofer asalariado en el sindicato San Cristóbal. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una máquina fotocopiadora para ofrecer más servicios a su clientela. Vive en casa de sus  padres, la misma que queda ubicada en la zona de Alto Chijini de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Sr. Cristian manages an Internet café and also works as a salaried driver for the San Cristóbal taxi union. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase a photocopying machine so that he can offer more services to his customers.

Cristian lives at home with his parents in the District of Alto Chijini in the city of La Paz. He is single and has no children. This is the first time that he has obtained a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopying machine for his cyber café.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia  is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Cynthia owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling balut in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Cynthia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional eggs for sale. This will be Cynthia’s first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership consists mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional eggs for sale.

loans.name: Tatiana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Tatiana Elizabeth tiene 22 años, es casada vive con el esposo y 2 hijos de 2 años y 15 años, vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SANTA ROSA DE AGUA CLARA, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 20 socios es el segundo crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao y yuca, además se dedican al comercio.

Tatiana se dedica al comercio a la venta de repuestos de bicicletas e insumos deportivos. Las compras las realiza en Guayaquil y las vende todos los dias en un  local en la casa.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de mercaderia para el negocio, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado las ventas y tiene suficiente mercaderia como llantas de bicicletas de diferente tamaño, focos, cadenas, pedales y demas acsesorios. Ha enfrentado desafíos como la falta de dinero para traer mercaderia y los precios de la competencia. Su sueño es tener mas ingresos para educar a los hijos y que no les falte nada.

En los tiempos libres le gustaria salir de paseo con el esposo y los hijos.
texts.en:
Tatiana Elizabeth, 22, is married and lives with her husband and two children, who are 2 and 15 years of age, in Agua Clara which belongs to Chillanes Canton.

The “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara” communal bank is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office.  It has 20 members and this is the second loan they’ve requested from the Cooperative.  The members of this communal bank farm cocoa beans and manioc and are also merchants.

Tatiana is a merchant; she sells bicycle spare parts and sporting goods.  She makes her purchases in Guayaquil and sells every day in a locale at home.

The loan will help her buy merchandise for the business.  The loan has helped her increase sales and have sufficient merchandise such as spare parts for the bicycles of different sizes, such as lights, chains, pedals, and other accessories. She's faced challenges like a lack of funds to purchase merchandise and the competition's prices.  

Her dream is to earn more to educate her children and so that they will lack nothing.   In her spare time she’d like to go on excursions with her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her bicycle business.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married and has two children. She sells smoked fish at Abura. Her husband is a steel bender. Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for resale. Adjoa plans to plough her increased profits back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Diamoral Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 03 juin 2010. Ledit groupe est  constitué de douze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Mba Fatoumata qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 28 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge deux autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce secteur d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…).
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on June 3, 2010. It comprises twelve women who live in the same area. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Mba Fatoumata (at the right in the photo with her hand raised) is the group's official. She is 28 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She also supports two other children entrusted to her by her parents. 

She is active in selling vegetables. She has good experience in this sector of work, since she has been working at it for several years. 

This loan will enable her to boost her capital and to develop her business further. The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.).

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Nila Abigail

texts.es:
Nila Abigail tiene 53 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con cinco hijos de 25,23,19,16 y 9 años, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Nila se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es tener carro y darñes lña mejor educaicon a los hijos.

Le gusta jugar con la pelota, limpiar la casa y salñir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Nila Abigail is 53 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and five children, who are 25, 23, 19, 16, and 9 years old. They live in the canton of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos.

The members of the "Tierra Nuestra" ["Our Land"] communal bank are located in the precinct of San Luis de Zapotal, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. The members of this communal bank perform short-cycle agricultural work such as growing corn and rice.

Nila works in agriculture, planing corn and rice. She buys her supplies from the AGRIPAC company and sells her products at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

She is requesting a loan to help with planting corn and rice. She will buy seeds and fertilizers for her crops. The support provided by this loan will help her economically so that she can cover her needs. She faces challenges like crop plagues and a lack of money to pay more workers. Her dream is to have a car and to give her children a better education.

She enjoys playing ball, cleaning the house, and going out walking with her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting corn and rice

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is forty years old, married and has five children, three of whom are in school. Judy raises cattle in the Philippines and has done so for four years now.

Judy has taken out loans eight times from NWTF. She is now requesting a 19,500 PHP loan to purchase more cattle.

In the future, Judy would like to save enough money so she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Angélica Maria

texts.es:
Angélica María tiene en su casa un pequeño negocio de Golosinas, Caramelos y colas, ella tiene 37 años y realiza su trabajo sola, tiene que ayudar en el hogar ya que es madre de 2 niños y uno de ellos tiene condiciones especiales.
 
La cooperativa donde viven es muy insegura  y peligrosa por lo que desea tener mas ingresos y poner mas seguridad en su casa, es por ello que quiere un préstamo y comprará  mercadería para expander su negocio. En el futuro junto a su esposo (albañil) desea ahorrar y darles un mejor futuro y condiciones de vida a sus pequeños niños.
texts.en:
Angélica María has a small business in her house selling candies, snacks and soda. She is 37 and does her work alone. She has to do housework, since she is a mother of 2 children and one of them has special needs.
 
The neighborhood where they live is very unsafe and dangerous and that is why she wants more income, so she can make her house more secure. That is why she wants a loan, and she will buy merchandise to buy a business. In the future, with her husband, a bricklayer, she wants to save and give a better future and quality of life for their small children.

loans.use: to buy candies and materials to make sweets.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at retail to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to expand her business and establish another stall in the future.

With the Kshs 35,000, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Saidu K.'s Group

texts.en:
Presented to you above in the photo are members of a primary school in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 9,400,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial problems.  At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 
Their leader is Saidu. Saidu was born in Makeni, 43 years ago. He is married, and the couple has 4 children.  Three of the children are attending primary and secondary schools. Saidu is pursuing further studies. He has requested this loan in order to pay his college fees.

loans.use: to pay his college fees

loans.name: Rieles Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Rieles” está conformado por las siguientes personas: Don Felipe, Doña Celia, Doña María del Carmen, ellos son de una comida pequeña pero con mucha cultura y costumbres la comunidad se caracteriza por ser tranquila donde sus habitantes son personas campesinas, obreras u comerciantes.
Le pusieron este nombre de los “Rieles” porque ellos viven cerca donde están unos rieles y porque siempre han vivido ahí, ellos saben que por ahí pasaba el tren desde hace mucho tiempo eso fue lo que les cuentan sus antepasados, sin embargo, los riles cayeron y ahora están en mal estado claro ahí ya no circula ningún tren pero ahí siguen los rieles.
Don Felipe quien es el representante comenta: "desde que recuerdo lo rieles han estado ahí, entonces cuando nos preguntaron qué nombre le queríamos poner al grupo decidimos ponerle “Rieles”" ël tiene 47 años de edad, esta casado con la señora María Carmen desde hace 26 años, ahora ninguno de sus hijos depende de ellos ya que todos se casaron y viven aparte.
Solicito el crédito para comprar 6 cerditos los cuales los conocemos como los famosos lechones, en casa tiene cuatro cerditas, y un semental, en su actividad ganadera tiene de experiencia 15 años.
Comenta por el momento no tiene ningún problema, ni siquiera que sus cerdos se enfermen ya que el prefiere comprar lechones y no de granja ya que los de granja son muy delicados al frio y no están acostumbrados al campo todo lo contrario a los lechones no se enferman aunque estén en el frio y si se les quiere sacar a pastar al campo no pasa nada.
Aunque en su casa tiene sus corrales bien construidos tiene 6 los cuales su meta será llenarlos todos de puerquitos lechones, ya que acaba de vender unos. Y se ha quedado casi sin cerdos.
Don Felipe le da las gracias a FRAC  “Gracias por el préstamo porque le ayuda de mucho de ya que sus cerditos a mantenerlos sanos y fuertes”
texts.en:
The group "Rieles" consists of the following  people: Don Felipe, Doña Celia, Doña María del Carmen. They are from a small community but one that has a lot of culture and many customs. The area is noted for it serenity where the inhabitants are farm labourers, workers or traders.

They named the group "Rieles" because they live near some railway tracks and have always lived there. They know that the train used go by there a long time ago according to their ancestors. However, the tracks fell apart and now are in poor condition. Ofcourse no train runs there now but the tracks remain.

Don Felipe ,the group representative says "Ever since I can remember the tracks have been there. So when they asked us what we wanted to name the group we decided to call it "Rieles" (tracks)". He is 47 years old and has been married to Señora María Carmen for the last 26 years. None of their children are dependents now as they are all married and live on their own. 

He is asking for a loan to buy 6 suckling piglets. At home he has 4 female piglets and a stud. He has been breeding livestock for 15 years.

He says that at the moment he has no problem not even his pigs becoming sick. He says this is because he prefers to buy suckling pigs rather than from a farm as the ones from the farm are very sensitive to the cold and are not used to the countryside. The suckling pigs are the complete opposite never getting sick even if left in the cold and they are fine even if taken out to graze in the fields.

Although he has well-constructed corrals at home, he has 6 he means to fill with suckling pigs as he just sold some and has almost no pigs left.
Don Felipe gives his thanks to FRAC, "Thank you for the loan because it helps me keep my piglets healthy and strong."

loans.use: to buy 6 suckling pigs.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Он не имеет высшего образования. Хуршед развозит людей по маршруту Кулоб – Душанбе. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Он берет кредит для приобретения запчастей автомашины.
texts.en: Khurshed lives in the town of Kulob.  He is 29 years old, married and has three children.  He does not have a higher education.  Khurshed transports people along the Kulob - Dushanbe route.  He has been involved in this business for five years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of spare parts for his car.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with three school-going children. Her husband, Kahindi, is a mechanic who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mariam has operated a retail shop for the past fourteen years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces the major challenge of competition from other retail operators. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility to loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Muộn's Group

texts.en:
Muộn is a 50-year-old female living in the Yen Phong district in Bac Ninh province.  Muộn is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Vọng Nguyệt 1.

Muộn is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To making a living, Muộn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Muộn has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

Muộn joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Muộn is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA.   She is a loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.   Muộn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Thức  is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 7,840,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising chickens.

2.  Ban is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising pigs and chickens.

3.  Phương Nam is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising pigs.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Muộn  là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Muộn là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Vọng Nguyệt 1 - nhóm 06 (6).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Muộn thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Muộn kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Muộn đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Muộn đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Thức là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  Ban là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3.  Phương Nam là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva

loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Gilsom

texts.en: Gilsom would like a loan to buy local brew to resell at his bar, which he has operated for 16 years. Gilsom is 34 years old and hails from the Kyenjojo District. Price fluctuations and inflation in the country are his major hardships. Gilsom dreams of building a permanent residential house and educating his children. His business goal is to expand his business into new markets, especially in the city where he can earn more.

loans.use: to buy local brew for resale.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a 61-year-old widow with two adult children. Rosalia is from Santa Cruz, Tangub City.

Rosalia owns and operates a business venture baking and selling a variety of goods including banana cue in the local community. She has been in this business for 30 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosalia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosalia is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
This is Amelia, 62, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Emmanuel, who is retired.  She and her husband manage their household while operating her business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                 
            
Amelia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling at retail. She also sells honey bee products for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 17,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Amelia hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: María De Los Santos

texts.es:
La Sra.  María tiene su negocio de venta de frutas como son naranja, limones y naranjas agrias al por mayor y al detalle en el mercado, ella trabaja sola de lunes a sábados desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde.
Ella es casada y con tres hijos pero ya ninguno depende de ella en la actualidad.
María acude a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio, para lograr las ventas de este mes de Diciembre ya que es donde ellos venden más y por salir cosecha de esos productos para estos meses.
texts.en:
María sells fruit like oranges, lemons and sour oranges at wholesale and retail in the market.  She works alone Monday through Saturday from 5 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon.  She’s married and has three children but none of them depend on her at present. 

María calls on Ceprodel offices to request a new loan to buy merchandise for her business for December sales which is when they sell the most because these products are harvested during these months.

loans.use: to buy oranges, sour oranges and lemons.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola cuenta con 22 años de edad, es casada tiene 1 hijo el cual esta cursando 2° de primaria, su esposo se llama José ángel es campesino, Fabiola seguirá estudiando entrara a la prepa de nuevo.

Ella es comerciante vende ropa por catalogo y ropa América ya tiene 5 años que comenzó con el negocio y le va muy bien e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los pedidos pendientes y un paquete que esta esperando de ropa a doña Fabiola le gustaría poner un local para ir incrementando su negocio ya que dice que le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Fabiola, 22, is married and has a son attending second grade.  Her husband’s name is José Ángel and he’s a farmer.  Fabiola will continue to go to school; she will reenter high school again.

She is a merchant.  She sells clothes via catalogue and also American clothes.  She started the business five years ago and does very well.  She will use her loan to buy her pending orders and a bundle of clothes that she’s waiting for.  Fabiola would like to open a locale to enlarge her business because she says that she does very well.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothes.

loans.name: Djanybek

texts.ru: Джаныбек 53-летний фермер, женат, воспитывает пятерых детей.  В 1996 году, в поисках доходов для своей семьи, Джаныбек решился на свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Джаныбека, начатое с суммы в 4,500 сом (KGS) хозяйство,  сегодня приносит около 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. Также он возделывает 4,16 га земли с картофелем и зерновыми культурами.  В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Джаныбек обратился в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Джаныбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Djanybek is a 53-year-old farmer who is married with five children. In 1996, in a search for income for his family, Djanybek decided to start his own business in farming and field work. Thanks to his tenacity and perseverance, Djanybek took the starting household sum of 4,500 Som (KGS) and today brings in about 6,000 Som (KGS) per month from the sale of meat and dairy products. He also cultivates 4.16 hectares of land with potatoes and cereal grains. 

In order to further increase the number of his livestock, Djanybek applied to the Bai Tushum and Partners company for a loan in the amount of 45,000 Som (KGS) for the purchase of additional heads of livestock. Djanybek plans to use income from the loan to invest further and increase the number of domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 27-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Muna is requesting a loan of 400 JD to do home maintenance. Her aspiration is to improve her family's living conditions and finance her children's education expenses.

Due to cultural issues, Muna did not wish to be photographed. The man in the photo is Muna's husband.

loans.use: to do home maintenance.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: This is 32 year-old Osman.  He is married to a trader, and has 4 children aged 12, 9, 6 years and a 10 months old baby, two are school-going children. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because he helps in the business. In 2005, Osman established his electronics business.  He began his business because of the rebel war that broke in his country of Sierra Leone. Osman says, "I was in form three (school grade 9 in the U.S) when the rebels attacked us in our village called Sanda twenty miles off from Makeni. Then we fled to Makeni and started working for people for our survival. During that time, I started raising funds until I got a substantial amount to start my business." Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,796,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 . Osman has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan and now needs a new loan in order to buy tape (6 batteries) - 8 pieces @ Lr125,000, radio - 10 pieces @ Le45,000, radio with memory card - 5 pieces @ Le75,000, tape (4 batteries) - 8 pieces @ Le65,000 and electronic lanterns - 1 carton @ Le1,000,000.  The balance will be used for transport. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 269,000. In the future, Osman plans to open a shop. He felt good about taking out this loan as it helps him to boost his business.  He wants his children to have a good education. The loan will help greatly because he will be able to make a profit out of it.  Increases in the cost of goods affects him greatly because as costs change, he has to change his selling prices which affects his customers' buying pattern.  He offers quality products.  Osman serves at least 20 people per day around the city.  His business is popular because he treats his customers fairly and with respect.  He is assisted by family members. He buys his goods in Conakry twice per month and in Freetown once every week.  He saves some of his profit, some he uses to add to his working capital. He plans to expand if he is given subsequent loans that will enable him to accomplish his dreams.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy electronics for sale

loans.name: Denis Elena

texts.es:
Denis se encuentra casada y junto con su esposo viven en un apartamento ubicado en la cancha deportiva de su municipio; ellos son los encargados del aseo del lugar, por lo que no tienen que pagar algún arriendo por esto. Desde hace un tiempo decidieron generar ingresos extras con el ánimo de poder gozar de una mejor calidad de vida, y fue así como montaron una venta de dulces, snack y gaseosas. Debido a que su negocio fue montado con muy bajo capital, Denis no puede ofrecer gran variedad de productos a sus clientes, sin embargo, aún así ha podido tener muy buenas ventas, es por esto que ahora que su negocio viene creciendo Denis busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de dulces, snack, y gaseosas para surtir su negocio y un refrigerador donde pueda almacenar las gaseosas.
De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo y les seguirá permitiendo tener una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas. Además, Denis sueña con algún día poder tener una gran tienda general ubicada en un lugar más estratégico y comercial y así poder tener mayores ingresos para su futuro.

loans.use: Compra de dulces, snack, y gaseosas para surtir su negocio y un refrigerador donde pueda almacenar las gaseosas.

loans.name: Benkadi Kagoua 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  Benkadi Kagoua 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kouroubadougou, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec    KADIATOU,  assise avec une écharpe jaune, sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte  acheter des intrants, semence, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour  pour l’exploitation de 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.  
NB/ DJELIKA absente
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi Kagoua 2 group are married women with an average age of 40, with 4 children and all living in traditional families in Kouroubadougou, one of the villages in San, the fourth largest administrative region of Mali. They work with Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to succeed in their agricultural business during the winter period.
They are on their third loan with the institution; previous loans have been fully repaid. The crop grown is peanut - under the responsibility of KADIATOU, seated and wearing a yellow scarf in the photo.
With her loan, she plans to buy inputs, seed, small agricultural equipment and to pay the labour costs for the 0.5 hectare farm. The production will be sold in the village and in San market, following the harvest, to a mixed customer base of both men and women.
She plans to generate an average profit of 55,000 FCFA per harvest. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to assist her husband with the daily expenses.

NB DJELIKA is absent

loans.use: to buy inputs, seed, small agricultural equipment and to pay labour costs.

loans.name: Batkhurel

texts.en:
Borrower Batkhurel is  49 years old married man and lives with his wife and son in outer ger district which lacks basic infrastructure of the city. As usual now its the housing projects season Batkhurel also decided to make some renovation work and housing project at his current old house.

He is requesting a 3.000.000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials in order to finish his housing project. He is a hardworking person who is willing to make better living condition to his family.

loans.use: to make housing project at his current house

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 24 years old from Iringa District, Tanzania. She is a mother of one child. Agnes volunteers at a secondary school, which is near her home in order to impact students’ lives by teaching them life skills. 

She has also employed herself through selling household items such as cups, plates and spoons. The business helps her to provide basic needs to both her mother and her daughter.  She requests a loan from Kiva to improve and increase the scale of her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by adding airtime and cash to support her business.

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.en:
I’ve had my small business for five years. I make and sell tortillas. I have set clients that pay me daily, weekly or monthly. My business has improved over time, and I am glad to now be able to help my children with their education. I didn’t have a chance to study a career, so I want them to be have the opportunity to become professionals, and improve their quality of life.

Loan Use: Purchase corn flour, lime, wood, and others.

Tengo cinco años de tener mi pequeña empresa de elaboracion y venta de tortillas, mis clientes son fijos ya que algunos me pagan diario, semanal o mensual. Mi negocio ha mejorado con el tiempo y me alegra ya que ahora puedo ayudarles a mis hijos con sus estudios, yo no tuve la oportunidad de estudiar asi que quiero que ellos puedan ser profesionales y que mejoren su nivel de vida.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, cal, leña y otros

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
to buy beach clothing and shoes for the beach season

para comprar ropa playera y zapatos deportivos por la temporada

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand and diversify my business.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. B. began his business 8 years ago by selling fruits and vegetables. Since then, his store has grown and today he has one of the best grocery stores of the area. Helped by his wife, he sells provisions and first need products in his store.

Use of Loan

He would like to invest his loan in the purchase of more merchandise and to enlarge his store. He would like to buy seasonal products on sale. By buying at wholesale prices, his costs remain low and, therefore, can offer his clients a better price.

Personal Information

He has a six year old daughter who studies in a nearby establishment. His home is made of concrete and his goal is to expand his business each day.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

El Señor B. empezó su negocio hace 8 años con la venta de legumbres y frutas, hoy en día su negocio a crecido y cuenta con una de las despensas mejores del sector, vende víveres y productos de primera necesidad, en su local le ayuda su esposa

Uso del Préstamo

El quiere invertir su préstamo en comprar mas mercadería y ampliar su tienda, quiere comprar productos que por la temporada están en promoción, ya que si compra al por mayor resultan los costos mas bajos y de esta manera el puede vender a sus clientes a precios cómodos

Información Personal

Tiene una hija de seis años y estudia en uno de los establecimientos cercanos, su vivienda es de cemento y su meta es ampliar cada día su negocio

loans.use: Purchase more supplies and to enlarge his store.

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Mrs A. Edoh is a 55 years old woman and worn out by tiredness. In spite of her old age, it is very voluntary and full with creative idea. Its principal activity is the sales and manufacture of manioc and gari. Manioc is a starch made by leaching and drying the root of the cassava plant; the source of tapioca; a staple food in the tropics. Gari is pickled ginger.

This activity is of great benefit and allows her provide for the needs for the family. She wishes today to increase the business and requests for that a loan of $600 which will be used to her to buy provisions in manioc for the manufacture and the sale of the gari . This will enable her to provide the needs for her five (5) children and the four (4) others whom she provides for.

ORIGINAL FRENCH

Madame A. Edoh est une femme âgée de 55 ans et usée par la fatigue. Malgré son âge avancé, elle est très volontaire et pleine d’idée créatrice. Son activité principale est l’achat des champs de manioc pour fabrication du gari. Cette activité lui procure de grands bénéfices et lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Elle désire aujourd’hui agrandir l’activité et sollicite pour cela un crédit de $600 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce pour s'approvosionner en manioc en vue de la fabrication et la vente du gari. Ceci lui permettra de venir à bout des besoins de ses cinq (5) et des quatre (4) autres à sa charge.

loans.use: Achat en gros du manioc et fabrication du gari

loans.name: Fausia

texts.en:
Fausia F. is 32 years of age, and she is married with three children. They live at Falelauniu, and she is one of the new members of the program. Her husband is a policeman, and she relied on him for everything before she joined the program.

She is is now running her own small business, and this money will really help the husband for the week’s expenses and other family things. She is young and active and her dream is for the business to be successful in the future.

loans.use: To buy seeds for cucumbers, cabbages and tomatoes, as well as tools for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Faasuamalie

texts.en: Faasuamalie P. is a very energetic mother running her own taro plantation business.  She’s fifty eight years old and has eight children.  Her husband is a strong man who works hard supporting her with their business and praising how lucky he is to have married Faasuamalie.  With her requested loan, she plans to do maintenance to their old fale (a traditional Samoan house) that they have been staying at for more than thirty years now.  She sells taros two days a week and earns the equivalent of USD $80-$100 a week.  She has fully paid back her previous loan with no difficulties and is now requesting a new loan.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for her plantation and for home improvements

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Nazira B. is from the mid-sized, industrial city Gujranwala, Pakistan. She is a married mother of five children who all attend school. Her husband is a shoe maker. He creates fashionable shoes and supplies shoe sellers in various cities. He has many clients, and he can improve his profits by buying shoe-making supplies in bulk in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. Nazira is requesting a loan of $825 to purchase these supplies in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase shoe-making material in bulk

loans.name: Rukkiah's Group

texts.en:
"I am Rukkiah M. from Arifwala, Pakistan. I am the mother of two: one boy and one girl. My daughter attends a stitching school and my son attends a local school. My husband is a public transport driver and now, he wants to become a partner in one of the wagons. This way our profits will rise sharply. For this reason, we require a loan.

My group members are: Nazira B. who will invest her loan in her son’s mobile phone store; Hajra B. who requires a loan to start a shoe manufacturing business; Zulakhan B. who plans to buy her son a rickshaw; and Shazia B. whose brother wants to buy a partnership in a cycle store. I completely trust all of these women and hence, request you to lend to all of us."

loans.use: To become a partner in one of the local transport wagons

loans.name: Jerónima De Los Ánge

texts.es:
Mrs. Jeronima has been selling vegetables for 10 years. She began with her own savings, selling the Terminal market of León.

Her business selling vegetables began as a street vendor with a small cart selling throughout the market, and then she found her own locale but it was in poor condition. Jeronima is a married woman with 5 children to support, and they are the source of her strength to build a successful business.

She has benefited from working with Ceprodel for 2 years, assisting her with 13 loans that have greatly impacted her vegetable business’s growth and has raised her standard of living and that of her children. She needs a loan from Ceprodel to acquire a large amount of vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad económica de la señora Jeronima es la venta de verduras variadas teniendo su negocio desde hace 10 años que dio inicio con sus propios ahorros en el mercado la Terminal de León.

Su negocio de venta de verduras lo inicia vendiendo ambulante con una pana pequeña por todo el mercado y posteriormente se ubica en un local propio pero en malas condiciones. Es de mucha importancia destacar que ella es una dama casada y con 5 hijos a su cargo por lo que ellos son el motivo de sus grandes esfuerzos en el negocio.

Ha sido beneficiada desde hace dos años por Ceprodel quien le asistió con financiamiento habiéndoles otorgado 13 créditos de los que le han impactado en un mayor crecimiento de su negocio de verduras y además ha mejorado su nivel de vida y el de sus hijos. Su necesidad por la que solicita el crédito a Ceprodel es por la adquisición de mayores volúmenes de verduras.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Satupaitea Mosula Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
After four weeks of rigorous business training, these six women of Satupaitea Mosula on the island of Savaii, passed their written tests on the SPBD principles (business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee) to ensure their first group loan from SPBD. Over the next year, they will support each other in their individual business development to guarantee on-time payments.

Merenaite F., 30, married, with five children, has over two years of experience growing vegetables. Specifically, she sells cabbages, cucumbers and tomatoes. Her husband is a seasoned farmer. With her loan, she will purchase cucumbers, cabbages, fertilizer, weed killing sprayer and pesticides.

Esi A., 41, married, with five children, has over three years of experience in maintaining a taro plantation. Taro is a staple of the Samoan diet. Her loan will be used to purchase a weed killing sprayer, pesticides, 2 bush knives, a filing and a spade. She hopes to earn a net cash flow of 310 Tala (~120 USD) per week.

Silika L., 29 and married, has worked in tandem with her husband growing cabbage and taro for over two years. A loan will permit her to purchase cabbage seeds, barbed wire, a filing, and a knife, a weed killing sprayer, a rake and fertilizer.

Fetu T., 38, married, with two children, has worked in tandem with her husband, catching and selling fish for over two years. With her loan, she will purchase a fishing boat, a lantern, a spear and fishing boots. Together, they expect to earn a net cash flow of 220 Tala (~88 USD) per week.

Fue M., 34, married, with four children, bakes banana chips sold to the other villagers, public and school children. She will use her loan to purchase pots, oil, bowls and other materials to bake the chips.

Solema I., 28, married, with one child, works with her husband catching selling fish. With her loan, she will purchase a fishing boat, goggles, a cooler and fishing boots.

loans.use: To purchase farming and fishing equipment

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es:
Delicia is a member of the Las Dalinas 2 Communal Bank, which is located in Alana Sisley Mz. H Lt. 2 in the district of Yarina Cocha. She is 54 years old and is the mother of 2 children. Her husband is a teacher. With her first loan of S. 300 from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a small bodega.

Now Delicia has been able to make her bodega expand. She sells products she formerly didn't sell and is there all day with the aid of her daughter who tends to the house.

With this loan of S. 800, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy one sack of rice, 1/2 a sack of sugar, milk, bread, soap, detergent, shampoo, bananas, carbon, et cetera.

Delicia is a very hard working woman. Since she was very young she dedicated herself to her work in order to feel more independent. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos because she has supported her and treated her well.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Delicia pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en el Jr. Rio Tapiche ultima cuadra, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 54 años es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es maestro, es así que Delicia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad Bella ha sabido hacer crecer su bodega, ahora vende otros productos que antes no lo hacia, esta mas surtida y atiende todo el día con la ayuda de su hija ya a la vez se dedica a su hogar.. Con este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará, 1 saco de arroz, ½ saco de azúcar, leche, pan, jabón, detergente, champú, lejía, plátano, carbón, etc. Delicia es una mujer muy trabajadora, empeñosa, desde que era muy joven se dedicó a trabajar para sentirse mas independiente, y esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por que es un apoyo excelente y el buen trato y apoyo que recibe de su promotora.

loans.use: Purchasing more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Philo would like to buy cereals (maize, rice, millet) to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of beauty products and clothing to restock a small business.
